translated: Practicing thus, he gradually fulfilled all the requisites for enlightenment without remainder and attained supreme enlightenment.🔽After that, still urged on by that same great compassion, he gave up the supreme bliss of the peace of seclusion and the bliss of liberation,

original: santaṃ vimokkhasukhaṃ pahāya bālajanabahule loke tehi samuppāditaṃ sammānāvamānavippakāraṃ
analyzed: santam vimokkha sukham pahāya bāla jana bahule loke tehi samuppāditam sammāna avamāna vippakāram
translated: and he disregarded the honors and insults heaped upon him by the people of the world, who are mostly foolish.

original: agaṇetvā vineyyajanassa vinayanena niravasesaṃ buddhakiccaṃ niṭṭhapesi. Tattha yo🔽bhagavato sattesu mahākaruṇāya samokkamanākāro, so parato āvibhavissati. Yathā ca
analyzed: a gaṇetvā vineyya janassa vinayanena niravasesam buddha kiccam niṭṭhapesi tattha yaḥ  bhagavato sattesu mahā karuṇāya samokkamana ākāro saḥ paratas āvibhavissati yathā ca
translated: He brought to completion without remainder the duties of a Buddha by training those who were trainable.🔽Herein, the way in which the Blessed One’s great compassion for beings manifests will be shown later.

original: buddhabhūtassa lokanāthassa sattesu mahākaruṇā, evaṃ bodhisattabhūtassapi mahābhinīhārakālādīsūti
analyzed: buddha bhūtassa lokanāthassa sattesu mahā karuṇā evam bodhisatta bhūtassa api mahā abhinīhāra kāla ādīsu uti
translated: And just as the Blessed One, the Lord of the World, had great compassion for beings when he became a Buddha, so also he had it when he was a Bodhisatta, from the time of his great aspiration onwards.🔽Therefore it is always and everywhere the same, not otherwise, not otherwise. Thus it is true, not false, not otherwise,

original: sabbattha sabbadā ca ekasadisatāya tathā avitathā anaññathā, tasmā tīsupi avatthāsu
analyzed: sabbattha sabbadā ca eka sadisa tāya tathā avitathā anaññathā tasmā tīsu pi avatthāsu
translated: in all three cases.

original: sabbasattesu samānarasāya tathāya mahākaruṇāya sakalalokahitāya gato paṭipannoti
analyzed: sabba sattesu samāna rasāya tathāya mahā karuṇāya sakala loka hitāya gataḥ paṭipanno ti
translated: He has gone to, he has reached, great compassion, which is impartial towards all living beings, and which is for the welfare of the whole world.

original: tathāgato. Evaṃ tathāya gatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ evam tathāya gataḥ iti tathāgataḥ
translated: He is the “thus-gone” (tathā-gata) because he has gone thus (tathā-gata).

original: Kathaṃ tathāni āgatoti tathāgato? Tathāni nāma cattāri ariyamaggañāṇāni. Tāni hi🔽idaṃ dukkhaṃ, ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo, ayaṃ dukkhanirodho, ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadāti
analyzed: katham tathāni āgataḥ ti tathāgataḥ tathāni nāma cattāri ariya magga ñāṇāni tāni hi  idam dukkham ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ayam dukkha nirodhaḥ ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati
translated: He is the “thus-gone” (tathā-gata) because he has come to (ā-gata) the thusness (tathā) of the four noble truths. The four noble truths are called “thusness” (tathā) because🔽they are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise because they are the truth for the noble ones.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the world because they are the truth for all beings.

original: evaṃ sabbañeyyadhammasaṅgāhakānaṃ pavattinivattitadubhayahetubhūtānaṃ catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ
analyzed: evam sabba ñeyya dhamma saṅgāhakānam pavatti nivatti tad ubhaya hetu bhūtānam catunnam ariya saccānam
translated: The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.

original: dukkhassa pīḷanaṭṭho saṅkhataṭṭho santāpaṭṭho vipariṇāmaṭṭho, samudayassa āyūhanaṭṭho🔽nidānaṭṭho saṃyogaṭṭho palibodhaṭṭho, nirodhassa nissaraṇaṭṭho vivekaṭṭho asaṅkhataṭṭho
analyzed: dukkhassa pīḷana ṭho saṅkhata ṭṭho santāpa ṭṭho vipariṇāma ṭho samudayassa āyūhana ṭho  nidāna ṭṭho saṃyoga ṭṭho palibodha ṭṭho nirodhassa nissaraṇa ṭṭho viveka ṭṭho asaṅkhata ṭṭho
translated: The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.🔽The four noble truths are the truth for the wise and the truth for the world because they are the truth for the noble ones and the truth for all beings.

original: amataṭṭho, maggassa niyyānaṭṭho hetvaṭṭho dassanaṭṭho ādhipateyyaṭṭhotiādīnaṃ tabbibhāgānañca
analyzed: amata ṭṭhaḥ maggassa niyyāna ṭṭhaḥ hetu aṭṭhaḥ dassana ṭṭhaḥ ādhipateyya ṭṭhaḥ ti ādīnam tad bibhāgānam ca
translated: The four noble truths are the truth for the wise

original: yathābhūtasabhāvāvabodhavibandhakassa saṃkilesapakkhassa samucchindanena paṭiladdhāya
analyzed: yathābhūta sabhāva avabodha vibandhakassa saṃkilesa pakkhassa samucchindanena paṭiladdhāya
translated: and which he has acquired by the severing of the defilement-class that obstructs the penetration of the individual essences of dhammas as they really are,

original: tattha asammohābhisamayasaṅkhātāya aviparītākārappavattiyā dhammānaṃ sabhāvasarasalakkhaṇassa🔽avisaṃvādanato tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni, tāni bhagavā anaññaneyyo sayameva
analyzed: tattha asammoha abhisamaya saṅkhātāya aviparīta ākāra ppavattiyā dhammānam sabhāva sarasa lakkhaṇassa  a visaṃvādanato tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni tāni bhagavā anaññaneyyaḥ sayam eva
translated: and which is called the “penetration of non-delusion” because of the non-deceptive occurrence of the individual essences of dhammas as their individual characteristics,

original: āgato adhigato, tasmā tathāni āgatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: āgataḥ adhigataḥ tasmai tathāni āgataḥ iti tathāgataḥ
translated: the Blessed One has come to know by himself, has realized by himself, and therefore they are “thus-come” .

original: Yathā ca maggañāṇāni, evaṃ bhagavato tīsu kālesu appaṭihatañāṇāni catupaṭisambhidāñāṇāni
analyzed: yathā ca magga ñāṇāni evam bhagavataḥ tīsu kālesu appaṭihata ñāṇāni catu paṭisambhidā ñāṇāni
translated: And just as the Blessed One’s knowledge of the paths, so also his knowledge in the three periods of time without impediment, his knowledge of the four discriminations,

original: catuvesārajjañāṇāni pañcagatiparicchedañāṇāni chaasādhāraṇañāṇāni sattabojjhaṅgavibhāvanañāṇāni
analyzed: catu vesārajja ñāṇāni pañca gati pariccheda ñāṇāni cha asādhāraṇa ñāṇāni satta bojjhaṅga vibhāvana ñāṇāni
translated: his knowledge of the four kinds of fearlessness, his knowledge of the delimitation of the five kinds of destinies, his knowledge of the six kinds of objects not directly perceived, his knowledge of the analysis of the seven factors of enlightenment,

original: aṭṭhamaggaṅgavibhāvanañāṇāni navānupubbavihārasamāpattiñāṇāni dasabalañāṇāni ca tathabhāve veditabbāni.
analyzed: aṭṭha magga aṅga vibhāvana ñāṇāni nava anupubba vihāra samāpatti ñāṇāni dasa bala ñāṇāni ca tathabhāve veditabbāni
translated: his knowledge of the analysis of the eight factors of the path, his knowledge of the nine successive abidings, and his knowledge of the ten powers should be understood to be “thus.”

original: Tatrāyaṃ vibhāvanā – yañhi kiñci aparimāṇāsu lokadhātūsu aparimāṇānaṃ sattānaṃ hīnādibhedabhinnāsu
analyzed: tatra ayam vibhāvanā yat hi kiñci aparimāṇāsu lokadhātūsu hīna ādi bheda bhinnāsu
translated: Here is the analysis: Whatever dhammas there are in the countless world systems, in the countless beings classed as inferior, medium, and superior,

original: atītāsu khandhāyatanadhātūsu sabhāvakiccādi avatthāvisesādi khandhappaṭibaddhanāmagottādi
analyzed: atītāsu khandha āyatana dhātūsu sabhāva kicca ādi avattha avisesa ādi khandha ppaṭibaddha nāma gotta ādi
translated: And in past aggregates, bases, and elements, the difference of state consisting in the same individual essence, function, etc., the difference of state consisting in the various individual essences, etc., the aggregates bound up with the name, the name-group, the name-collection, the family, the clan, etc., should be known.

original: ca jānitabbaṃ. Anindriyabaddhesu ca atisukhumatirohitavidūradesesupi rūpadhammesu
analyzed: ca jānitabbam an indriya baddhesu ca ati sukhuma tirohita vidūra desesu pi rūpa dhammesu
translated: And in material phenomena that are not bound up with faculties, that are extremely subtle, that are far removed, and that are remote in space,

original: yo taṃtaṃpaccayavisesehi saddhiṃ paccayuppannānaṃ vaṇṇasaṇṭhānagandharasaphassādiviseso,🔽tattha sabbattheva hatthatale ṭhapitaāmalake viya paccakkhato appaṭihataṃ bhagavato
analyzed: yaḥ taṃ taṃ paccaya visesehi saddhim paccaya uppannānam vaṇṇa saṇṭhāna gandha rasa phassa ādi visesaḥ  tattha sabbattha iva hattha tale ṭhapita āmalake viya paccakkhataḥ appaṭihatam bhagavato
translated: the difference in colour, shape, smell, taste, and nutritive essence, etc., that is due to the difference in their respective conditions,

original: ñāṇaṃ pavattati, tathā anāgatāsu paccuppannāsu cāti imāni tīsu kālesu appaṭihatañāṇāni nāma. Yathāha –
analyzed: ñāṇam pavattati tathā anāgatāsu paccuppannāsu ca ati imāni tīsu kālesu appaṭihatañāṇāni nāma yathā āha
translated: and in all these instances the Blessed One’s knowledge occurs unobstructedly, as if he had it directly before his eyes, like a ripe fruit in the palm of his hand, as it were. So too in the future and in the present. These are called the unobstructed knowledges in the three times. As it is said:

original: “Atītaṃse buddhassa bhagavato appaṭihataṃ ñāṇaṃ, anāgataṃse buddhassa bhagavato appaṭihataṃ ñāṇaṃ, paccuppannaṃse buddhassa bhagavato appaṭihataṃ ñāṇa”nti.
analyzed: atīta aṃse buddhassa bhagavataḥ a paṭihatam ñāṇam anāgata aṃse buddhassa bhagavataḥ a paṭihatam ñāṇam paccuppanna aṃse buddhassa bhagavataḥ a paṭihatam ñāṇanti
translated: “In the past, the Blessed One’s knowledge is unobstructed, in the future it is unobstructed, and in the present it is unobstructed” .

original: Tāni panetāni tattha tattha dhammānaṃ sabhāvasarasalakkhaṇassa avisaṃvādanato tathāni
analyzed: tāni pana itāni tattha tattha dhammānam sabhāva sarasa lakkhaṇassa avisaṃvādanato tathāni
translated: And these are called “thus” because they are not deceptive in regard to the individual essences of the various states.

original: avitathāni anaññathāni, tāni bhagavā sayambhūñāṇena adhigañchīti. Evampi tathāni āgatoti tathāgato.🔽Tathā atthappaṭisambhidā dhammappaṭisambhidā niruttippaṭisambhidā paṭibhānappaṭisambhidāti
analyzed: avitathāni anaññathāni tāni bhagavā sayambhū ñāṇena adhigañchi iti evam pi tathāni āgato ti tathāgataḥ  tathā attha ppaṭisambhidā dhamma ppaṭisambhidā nirutti ppaṭisambhidā paṭibhāna ppaṭisambhidā ati
translated: and they are not otherwise, the Blessed One has penetrated them with his own super-knowledge, thus he has come to know them as they really are, thus he is the “Tathāgata” .🔽The four analytical knowledges are the analytical knowledge of meaning, the analytical knowledge of truth, the analytical knowledge of language, and the analytical knowledge of perspicuity.

original: catasso paṭisambhidā. Tattha atthappabhedassa sallakkhaṇavibhāvanavavatthānakaraṇasamatthaṃ🔽atthappabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā. Dhammappabhedassa sallakkhaṇavibhāvanavavatthānakaraṇasamatthaṃ🔽dhammappabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā. Niruttippabhedassa sallakkhaṇavibhāvanavavatthānakaraṇasamatthaṃ
analyzed: catasso paṭisambhidā tattha attha ppabhedassa sat lakkhaṇa vibhāvana vavatthāna karaṇa samattham  attha ppabheda gatam ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā dhamma ppabhedassa sat lakkhaṇa vibhāvana vavatthāna karaṇa samattham  dhamma ppabheda gatam ñāṇam dhamma ppaṭisambhidā nirutti ppabhedassa sat lakkhaṇa vibhāvana vavatthāna karaṇa samattham
translated: The knowledge that occurs in the field of the analysis of meaning, and is capable of defining, revealing, and establishing the analysis of meaning, is the analytical knowledge of meaning.🔽The knowledge that occurs in the field of the analysis of mental data, and is capable of defining, revealing, and establishing the analysis of mental data, is the analytical knowledge of mental data.🔽The knowledge that occurs in the field of the analysis of language, and is capable of defining, revealing, and establishing the analysis of language, is the analytical knowledge of language.

original: niruttābhilāpe pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ niruttippaṭisambhidā. Paṭibhānappabhedassa sallakkhaṇavibhāvanavavatthānakaraṇasamatthaṃ🔽paṭibhānappabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ paṭibhānappaṭisambhidā. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: nirutta abhilāpe pabheda gatam ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā paṭibhāna ppabhedassa sat lakkhaṇa vibhāvana vavatthāna karaṇa samattham 🔽paṭibhāna pabheda gatam ñāṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā vuttam ha etam
translated: The knowledge that occurs in the field of the analysis of perspicuity, and is capable of defining, revealing, and establishing the analysis of perspicuity, is the analytical knowledge of perspicuity.🔽This is said:

original: “Atthe ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā, dhamme ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā, tatra dhammaniruttābhilāpe ñāṇaṃ niruttippaṭisambhidā, ñāṇesu ñāṇaṃ paṭibhānappaṭisambhidā”ti.
analyzed: atthe ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā dhamme ñāṇam dhamma ppaṭisambhidā tatra dhamma nirutta abhilāpe ñāṇam nirutti ppaṭisambhidā ñāṇesu ñāṇam paṭibhāna ppaṭisambhidā ati
translated: “The knowledge of what is the case is the discrimination of what is the case. The knowledge of ideas is the discrimination of ideas. The knowledge of the expression of ideas in speech is the discrimination of perspicuity. The knowledge of the kinds of knowledge is the discrimination of perspicuity in teaching” .

original: Ettha ca hetuanusārena araṇīyato adhigantabbato ca saṅkhepato hetuphalaṃ attho nāma.🔽Pabhedato pana yaṃ kiñci paccayuppannaṃ, nibbānaṃ, bhāsitattho, vipāko, kiriyāti
analyzed: ettha ca hetu anusārena araṇīyataḥ adhigantabbataḥ ca saṅkhepataḥ hetu phalam atthaḥ nāma  pabhedato pana yam kiñci paccaya uppannam nibbānam bhāsita tthaḥ vipākaḥ kiriyā ti
translated: And here what is the case in brief is the cause and the fruit, which are respectively to be sought and to be attained by following the cause.🔽But in detail any of the five ideas, namely, the presently arisen, extinction, the meaning of what is said, the result of kamma, and the inoperative,

original: ime pañca dhammā attho. Taṃ atthaṃ paccavekkhantassa tasmiṃ atthe pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ
analyzed: ime pañca dhammā attho tam attham paccavekkhantassa tasmin atthe pabheda gatam ñāṇam
translated: is what is the case. The knowledge of the discrimination of what is the case is the knowledge of the discrimination of what is the case in the various aspects in one who reviews that what is the case.

original: atthappaṭisambhidā. Dhammoti saṅkhepato paccayo. So hi yasmā taṃ taṃ atthaṃ vidahati🔽pavatteti ceva pāpeti ca, tasmā dhammoti vuccati, pabhedato pana yo koci phalanibbattanako
analyzed: attha ppaṭisambhidā dhammo ti saṅkhepato paccayo saḥ hi yasmā tam tam attham vidahati  pavattā iti ca iva pāpā iti ca tasmā dhammo ti vuccati pabhedato pana yo koci phala nibbattanako
translated: An idea is a condition in brief. It is called an idea since it spreads out ,

original: hetu ariyamaggo bhāsitaṃ kusalaṃ akusalanti ime pañca dhammā dhammo, taṃ dhammaṃ
analyzed: hetu ariya maggaḥ bhāsitam kusalam akusalanti ime pañca dhammā tam dhammam
translated: since it is what is spread out , and since it is what is made to be spread out . In detail, any of the five ideas, namely, the cause that produces the fruit, the noble path, what is said, profitable and unprofitable kamma,🔽is an idea. The knowledge of the discrimination of ideas is the knowledge of the discrimination of ideas in the various aspects in one who reviews that idea.

original: paccavekkhantassa tasmiṃ dhamme pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā. Vuttampi cetaṃ –
analyzed: paccavekkhantassa tasmin dhamme pabheda gatam ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā vuttam pi ca itam
translated: Knowledge of the analysis of the meaning of the Dhamma is knowledge of the various kinds of meaning in that Dhamma. And this is said:

original: “Dukkhe ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā, dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā, dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā”ti.
analyzed: dukkhe ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā dukkha samudaye ñāṇam dhamma ppaṭisambhidā dukkha nirodhe ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā dukkha nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya ñāṇam dhamma ppaṭisambhidā ati
translated: “Knowledge of suffering is the discrimination of meaning; knowledge of the origin of suffering is the discrimination of the Dhamma; knowledge of the cessation of suffering is the discrimination of meaning; knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of suffering is the discrimination of the Dhamma.”

original: Atha vā hetumhi ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā, hetuphale ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā. Ye
analyzed: atha vā hetumhi ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā hetu phale ñāṇam attha ppaṭisambhidā ye
translated: Or else: knowledge of the cause is the discrimination of the Dhamma; knowledge of the cause and fruit is the discrimination of meaning.

original: dhammā jātā bhūtā sañjātā nibbattā abhinibbattā pātubhūtā, imesu dhammesu ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā.🔽Yamhā dhammā te dhammā jātā bhūtā sañjātā nibbattā abhinibbattā pātubhūtā, tesu dhammesu
analyzed: dhammā jātā bhūtā sañjātā nibbattā abhinibbattā pātubhūtā imesu dhammesu ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā  yamhā dhammā te dhammā jātā bhūtā sañjātā nibbattā abhinibbattā pātubhūtā tesu dhammesu
translated: Knowledge of the things that have arisen, that have come to be, that have been produced, that have been brought into being, that have been heaped up, is the discrimination of meaning.

original: ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā. Jarāmaraṇe ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā, jarāmaraṇasamudaye
analyzed: ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā jarā maraṇe ñāṇam attha ppaṭisambhidā jarā maraṇa samudaye
translated: Knowledge of the things by means of which those things have arisen, have come to be, have been produced, have been brought into being, have been heaped up, is the discrimination of the Dhamma. Knowledge of ageing-and-death is the discrimination of meaning; knowledge of the origin of ageing-and-death is the discrimination of the Dhamma;

original: ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā. Jarāmaraṇanirodhe ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā, jarāmaraṇanirodhagāminiyā
analyzed: ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā jarā maraṇa nirodhe ñāṇam attha ppaṭisambhidā jarā maraṇa nirodha gāminiyā
translated: Knowledge is the discrimination of meaning. Knowledge of the cessation of old age and death is the discrimination of meaning, of the cessation of old age and death, of the path leading to the cessation of old age and death,

original: paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā. Jātiyā, bhave, upādāne, taṇhāya, vedanāya,
analyzed: paṭipadāya ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā jātiyāḥ bhave upādāne taṇhāya vedanāya
translated: Knowledge of the ending of aging-and-death is the discernment of meaning. Knowledge of the practice going to the ending of aging-and-death is the discernment of Dhamma. Knowledge of birth, becoming, grasping, craving, feeling,

original: phasse, saḷāyatane, nāmarūpe, viññāṇe, saṅkhāresu ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā, saṅkhārasamudaye🔽ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā. Saṅkhāranirodhe ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā, saṅkhāranirodhagāminiyā
analyzed: phasse saḷāyatane nāma rūpe viññāṇe saṅkhāresu ñāṇam attha ppaṭisambhidā saṅkhāra samudaye  ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā saṅkhāra nirodhe ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā saṅkhāra nirodha gāminiyā
translated: contact, the six sense spheres, name-&-form, consciousness, and intentional activities is the discernment of meaning. Knowledge of the origination of intentional activities is the discernment of Dhamma.

original: paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ dhammappaṭisambhidā.
analyzed: paṭipadāya ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā
translated: Knowledge of the ending of intentional activities is the discernment of meaning. Knowledge of the practice going to the ending of intentional activities is the discernment of Dhamma.

original: “Idha bhikkhu dhammaṃ jānāti suttaṃ geyyaṃ…pe… vedallaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati dhammappaṭisambhidā.🔽So tassa tasseva bhāsitassa atthaṃ jānāti ‘ayaṃ imassa bhāsitassa attho, ayaṃ imassa
analyzed: idha bhikkhu dhammam jānāti suttam geyyaṃ pe vedallam ayam vuccati dhamma ppaṭisambhidā  saḥ tassa tassa iva bhāsitassa attham jānāti ayam imassa bhāsitassa atthaḥ ayam imassa
translated: “Here a monk knows Dhamma: discourses, mixed prose and verse, expositions, verses, inspired utterances, quotations, birth stories, amazing accounts, and questions-and-answers. This is called the discernment of Dhamma.

original: bhāsitassa attho’ti, ayaṃ vuccati atthappaṭisambhidā.
analyzed: bhāsitassa atthaḥ ti ayam vuccati attha ppaṭisambhidā
translated: He knows the meaning of what is said in a particular way: ‘This is the meaning of this that is said. This is the meaning of that that is said.’ This is called the discernment of meaning.

original: “Katame dhammā kusalā? Yasmiṃ samaye kāmāvacaraṃ kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ hoti somanassasahagataṃ
analyzed: katame dhammā kusalā yasmin samaye kāmāvacaram kusalam cittam uppannam hoti somanassa sahagatam
translated: “What are profitable ideas? When a profitable consciousness, accompanied by joy, arises in the Sensuous Sphere, …

original: ñāṇasampayuttaṃ rūpārammaṇaṃ vā…pe… dhammārammaṇaṃ vā yaṃ yaṃ vā panārabbha, tasmiṃ🔽samaye phasso hoti…pe… avikkhepo hoti…pe… ime dhammā kusalā. Imesu dhammesu ñāṇaṃ
analyzed: ñāṇa sampayuttam rūpa ārammaṇam vāpe dhamma ārammaṇam vā yam yam vā pana ārabbha tasmin  samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe ime dhammā kusalāḥ imesu dhammesu ñāṇam
translated: accompanied by equanimity, and associated with knowledge, and has as its object any of the ideas of the sense-sphere, …

original: dhammappaṭisambhidā, tesaṃ vipāke ñāṇaṃ atthappaṭisambhidā”tiādi vitthāro.
analyzed: dhamma ppaṭisambhidā tesam vipāke ñāṇam attha ppaṭisambhidā tiādi vitthāraḥ
translated: at that time there is contact … non-distraction … These are profitable ideas. Knowledge of these ideas is the Discrimination of Ideas. Knowledge of their outcome is the Discrimination of Meanings” .

original: Yā panetasmiṃ atthe ca dhamme ca sabhāvanirutti abyabhicāravohāro abhilāpo, tasmiṃ🔽sabhāvaniruttābhilāpe māgadhikāya sabbasattānaṃ mūlabhāsāya “ayaṃ sabhāvanirutti,🔽ayaṃ asabhāvaniruttī”ti pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ niruttippaṭisambhidā. Yathāvuttesu tesu
analyzed: yā pana itasmin atthe ca dhamme ca sabhāva nirutti abyabhicāra vohāraḥ abhilāpo tasmin  sabhāva nirutta abhilāpe māgadhikāya sabba sattānam mūla bhāsāya ayam sabhāva nirutti  ayam a sabhāva nirutti iti pabheda gatam ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā yathā vuttesu tesu
translated: And the verbal expression of the individual essence of the meaning and of the idea, which is the invariable concomitant of the verbal expression of the individual essence of the meaning, is the “individual-essence language” .🔽The knowledge that is the means of distinguishing the individual-essence language from the non-individual-essence language in the Magadhan language, which is the basic language for all creatures, is the Discrimination of Language.

original: ñāṇesu gocarakiccato vitthārato pavattaṃ sabbampi taṃ ñāṇaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā paccavekkhantassa
analyzed: ñāṇesu gocara kiccataḥ vitthārataḥ pavattam sabbam pi tam ñāṇam ārammaṇam katvā paccavekkhantassa
translated: And all the knowledge that occurs in detail in the way stated above, in the way of province and function, is the Discrimination of Perspicuity when it is reviewed with that knowledge as its object.

original: tasmiṃ ñāṇe pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ paṭibhānappaṭisambhidā. Iti imāni cattāri paṭisambhidāñāṇāni
analyzed: tasmim ñāṇe pabheda gatam ñāṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā iti imāni cattāri paṭisambhidā ñāṇāni
translated: Thus these four kinds of knowledge of the discriminations

original: sayameva bhagavatā adhigatāni atthadhammādike tasmiṃ tasmiṃ attano visaye avisaṃvādanavasena
analyzed: sayam eva bhagavatā adhigatāni attha dhamma ādike tasmin tasmin attanaḥ visaye a visaṃvādana vasena
translated: were discovered by the Blessed One himself. They are “such” in the sense of being non-deceptive in their own respective fields, such as meaning, truth, etc.,🔽and they are “such” in the sense of occurring in the unperverted mode. Thus the Blessed One has “come” to suchness,

original: aviparītākārappavattiyā tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni. Evampi bhagavā tathāni āgatoti tathāgato.🔽Tathā yaṃkiñci ñeyyaṃ nāma, sabbaṃ taṃ bhagavatā sabbākārena ñātaṃ diṭṭhaṃ adhigataṃ
analyzed: aviparīta ākāra ppavattiyā tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni evam pi bhagavā tathāni āgataḥ ti tathāgataḥ  tathā yaṃkiñci ñeyyam nāma sabbam tam bhagavatā sabba ākārena ñātam diṭṭham adhigatam
translated: and so he is the Tathāgata.🔽“Whatever is to be known” is all that is knowable. The Blessed One has known it, seen it, realized it,

original: abhisambuddhaṃ. Tathā hissa abhiññeyyā dhammā abhiññeyyato buddhā, pariññeyyā dhammā
analyzed: abhisambuddham tathā hi ssa abhiññeyyāḥ dhammāḥ abhiññeyyataḥ buddhā pariññeyyāḥ dhammāḥ
translated: and fully awakened to it in all its aspects. For him, dhammas that are to be directly known are directly known, dhammas that are to be fully understood are fully understood,

original: pariññeyyato, pahātabbā dhammā pahātabbato, sacchikātabbā dhammā sacchikātabbato,
analyzed: pariññeyyataḥ pahātabbāḥ dhammāḥ pahātabbataḥ sacchikātabbāḥ dhammāḥ sacchikātabbataḥ
translated: dhammas that are to be abandoned are abandoned, dhammas that are to be realized are realized,

original: bhāvetabbā dhammā bhāvetabbato, yato naṃ koci samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro
analyzed: bhāvetabbāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvetabbataḥ yatas nam koci samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā devaḥ vā māro
translated: and dhammas that are to be developed are developed. No ascetic or brahmin, no god, Māra,

original: vā brahmā vā “ime nāma te dhammā anabhisambuddhā”ti saha dhammena anuyuñjituṃ samattho natthi.
analyzed: vā brahmā vā ime nāma te dhammāḥ an abhisambuddhā ati saha dhammena anuyuñjitum samatthaḥ na atthi
translated: There is no one, whether recluse or brahmin, whether a deity, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world, who can rightly reprove him thus: ‘These things are not fully awakened to by the Blessed One.’

original: Yaṃkiñci pahātabbaṃ nāma, sabbaṃ taṃ bhagavato anavasesato bodhimūleyeva pahīnaṃ🔽anuppattidhammaṃ, na tassa pahānāya uttari karaṇīyaṃ atthi. Tathā hissa lobhadosamohaviparītamanasikāraahirikānottappathinamiddhakodhūpanāha-🔽makkhapalāsaissāmacchariyamāyāsāṭheyyathambhasārambhamānātimānamadappamādatividhā-🔽kusalamūladuccaritavisamaviparītasaññā- malavitakkapapañcaesanātaṇhācatubbidhavipariyesaāsavagantha-
analyzed: yaṃ kiñci pahātabbam nāma sabbam tam bhagavataḥ anavasesataḥ bodhi mūleya iva pahīnam  anuppatti dhammam na tassa pahānāya uttari karaṇīyam atthi tathā hi ssa lobha dosa moha viparīta manasikāra ahirika anottappa thinamiddha kodhūpana aha  makkha palāsa issā macchariya māyā sāṭheyya thambha sārambha māna atimāna mada ppamāda tividhā  kusala mūla duccarita visama viparīta saññā
translated: Whatever is to be given up has all been given up by the Blessed One without remainder at the root of the tree of enlightenment.

original: mūlakadasaakusalakammapathaekavīsati anesanadvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhigataaṭṭhasatataṇhāvicaritādippabhedaṃ🔽diyaḍḍhakilesasahassaṃ saha vāsanāya pahīnaṃ samucchinnaṃ samūhataṃ, yato naṃ koci
analyzed: mūlaka dasa akusala kammapatha ekavīsati anesana dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi gata aṭṭha sata taṇhā vicarita ādi ppabhedam  diyaḍḍha kilesa sahassam saha vāsanāya pahīnam samucchinnam yatas kocid
translated: the ten courses of unskillful action, the twenty-one unseemly acts, the sixty-two views, the 121 types of craving, etc.,🔽the 1,250 defilements together with their underlying tendencies, have been abandoned, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that they are no more subject to future arising. There is no contemplative or brahman or god or Māra or Brahmā or anyone else in the world who can rightly accuse him, saying,🔽‘These defilements have not been abandoned by you.’

original: samaṇo vā…pe… brahmā vā “ime nāma te kilesā appahīnā”ti saha dhammena anuyuñjituṃ samattho natthi.🔽Ye cime bhagavatā kammavipākakilesūpavādaāṇāvītikkamappabhedā antarāyikā vuttā, alameva
analyzed: samaṇaḥ vā āpe brahmā vā ime nāma te kilesāḥ appahīnāḥ ati saha dhammena anuyuñjitum samatthaḥ natthi  ye cime bhagavatā kamma vipāka kilesūpavāda āṇā vītikkama ppabhedāḥ antarāyikāḥ vuttāḥ alam eva
translated: And the hindrances that the Blessed One has declared to be hindrances, if he were to practice in line with them, it would be enough for him to be reproved by other contemplatives & brahmans. But since he does not practice in line with them, there is no one in the world who can rightly reprove him, saying,🔽‘It is not enough for you to practice in line with these hindrances.’

original: te paṭisevato ekantena antarāyāya. Yato naṃ koci samaṇo vā…pe… brahmā vā “nālaṃ te
analyzed: te paṭisevataḥ ekantena antarāyāya yatas samaṇaḥ brahmā vā na alam te
translated: And the unsurpassed full stop to the effluents that the Blessed One has declared to be the full stop to the effluents, if he were to practice in line with it, it would be enough for him to be called ‘one who has reached fulfillment, tranquilized, a supreme person.’ But since he does not practice in line with it, there is no one in the world who can rightly reprove him, saying,

original: paṭisevato antarāyāyā”ti saha dhammena anuyuñjituṃ samattho natthi.🔽Yo ca bhagavatā niravasesavaṭṭadukkhanissaraṇāya sīlasamādhipaññāya saṅgaho sattakoṭṭhāsiko
analyzed: paṭisevataḥ antarāyāya ati saha dhammena anuyuñjitum samatthaḥ natthi  yaḥ ca bhagavatā niravasesa vaṭṭa dukkha nissaraṇāya sīla samādhi paññāya saṅgahaḥ satta koṭṭhāsiko
translated: ‘You have not reached fulfillment, you are not tranquilized, you are not a supreme person.’🔽And the seven sets of seven that the Blessed One has declared to be the path systematizing the noble true path, if he were to practice in line with it, it would be enough for him to be called ‘one who has reached fulfillment, tranquilized, a supreme person.’ But since he does not practice in line with it, there is no one in the world who can rightly reprove him, saying,

original: sattatiṃsappabhedo ariyamaggapubbaṅgamo anuttaro niyyāniko dhammo desito, so ekanteneva
analyzed: sattatiṃsa ppabhedaḥ ariya magga pubbaṅgamaḥ anuttaraḥ niyyānikaḥ dhammo desito saḥ ekantena iva
translated: ‘You have not reached fulfillment, you are not tranquilized, you are not a supreme person.’

original: niyyāti, paṭipannassa vaṭṭadukkhato mokkhāya hoti, yato naṃ koci samaṇo vā…pe… brahmā
analyzed: niyyāti paṭipannassa vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ mokkhāya hoti yatas nam koci samaṇaḥ vāpe brahmā
translated: it leads out, it leads to the escape from suffering and stress for one who has entered upon it. For this reason it is called the Noble Eightfold Path.

original: vā “niyyāniko dhammoti tayā desito na niyyātī”ti saha dhammena anuyuñjituṃ samattho
analyzed: vā niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ ti tayā desitaḥ na niyyāti iti saha dhammena anuyuñjitum samatthaḥ
translated: It goes forth to the deliverance of one who has entered upon it from the suffering of the round of rebirths. Since no recluse or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or anyone else in the world can legitimately accuse him, saying, “The Dhamma you have taught as leading to deliverance does not lead to deliverance,”

original: natthīti. Vuttañhetaṃ – “sammāsambuddhassa te paṭijānato ime dhammā anabhisambuddhā”ti🔽vitthāro. Evametāni attano ñāṇappahānadesanāvisesānaṃ avitathabhāvāvabodhanato aviparītākārappavattitāni
analyzed: na atthi iti vuttam ha etam sammāsambuddhassa te paṭijānataḥ ime dhammā anabhisambuddhā ti  vitthāraḥ evam etāni attanaḥ ñāṇa pahāna desanā visesānam avitatha bhāva avabodhanataḥ aviparīta ākāra ppavattitāni
translated: there is no one with whom the Exalted One has to argue. It is said: “If you claim to be a Perfectly Enlightened One, these things are not fully awakened to by you” .🔽The details are as follows. So these four kinds of perfect confidence of the Exalted One occur in him in the mode of non-deceptive actuality because of his realization of the non-deceptive actuality of his own knowledge, relinquishment, and teaching.

original: bhagavato catuvesārajjañāṇāni tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni. Evampi bhagavā tathāni āgatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: bhagavato catu vesārajja ñāṇāni tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni evam pi bhagavā tathāni āgataḥ ti tathāgataḥ
translated: Thus it is that the Exalted One has come in this way, thus he is the “Tathāgata.”🔽There are five destinations :

original: Tathā nirayagati, tiracchānagati, petagati, manussagati, devagatīti pañca gatiyo,
analyzed: tathā niraya gati tiracchāna gati peta gati manussa gati deva gati iti pañca gatiyaḥ
translated: the destination of the hells, the destination of animals, the destination of ghosts, the destination of human beings, and the destination of gods.

original: tāsu sañjīvādayo aṭṭha mahānirayā, kukkuḷādayo soḷasa ussadanirayā, lokantarikanirayoti
analyzed: tāsu sañjīva ādayaḥ aṭṭha mahānirayā kukkuḷa ādayaḥ soḷasaḥ ussada nirayā
translated: Among them, the eight great hells beginning with Sañjīva , the sixteen additional hells beginning with Kukkula , and the hells beyond these beginning with the Lohakumbhi Hell,

original: sabbepime ekantadukkhatāya nirassādaṭṭhena nirayā, yathākammunā gantabbato gati cāti
analyzed: sabbe pi me ekanta dukkha tāya nirassādaṭṭhena nirayāḥ yathākammunā gantabbataḥ gati ca ati
translated: All these are hells in the sense of being without any consolation because of being exclusively painful, and they are destinations in the sense of being places to go to according to one’s kamma.

original: nirayagati, tibbandhakārasītanarakāpi etesveva antogadhā. Kimikīṭasarīsapapakkhisoṇasiṅgālādayo🔽tiriyaṃ añchitabhāvena tiracchānā, te eva gatīti tiracchānagati. Khuppipāsitattā
analyzed: niraya gati etesu eva antar gadhā kimi kīṭa sarīsapa pakkhi soṇa siṅgāla ādayaḥ  tiriyam añchita bhāvena tiracchānā te eva gatī iti tiracchāna gatī khuppipāsita ttā
translated: All these are hells because of the utter undesirability of the state of being there owing to the unmitigated suffering, and because of the going there in accordance with kamma, they are the destiny of hell. The hell of the Great Roruca Hell, etc., are included here too. The creatures such as worms, insects, birds, and beasts of prey,🔽are animals because of their mode of locomotion, which is on their belly, and because of their stupidity. The destiny of these is the animal destiny. The hungry ghosts, who are tormented by hunger and thirst,

original: paradattūpajīvinijjhāmataṇhikādayo dukkhabahulatāya pākaṭasukhato itā vigatāti petā,
analyzed: para dattu upajīvi nijjhāma taṇhika ādayaḥ dukkha bahula tāya pākaṭa sukhataḥ itāḥ vigatāḥ ati pa itā
translated: who live on what is given by others, who are greedy for food, and so on, are spirits because of their lack of food, and because of their being manifest in the form of ghosts.

original: te eva gatīti petagati, kālakañcikādiasurāpi etesvevantogadhā. Parittadīpavāsīhi
analyzed: te eva kāla kañcika ādi asura api
translated: The destiny of these is the spirit destiny. The demons such as Kālakañja are included here too. The human beings, who live in the four great continents such as Jambudīpa,

original: saddhiṃ jambudīpādicatumahādīpavāsino manaso ussannatāya manussā, te eva gatīti manussagati.🔽Cātumahārājikato paṭṭhāya yāva nevasaññānāsaññāyatanūpagāti ime chabbīsati devanikāyā
analyzed: saddhim jambudīpa ādi catu mahā dīpa vāsinaḥ manasaḥ ussanna tāya manussā te eva gatī iti manussa gati  cātumahārājikato paṭṭhāya yāva nevasaññānāsaññāyatana upagā ti ime chabbīsati deva nikāyā
translated: and who are exalted in mind compared with the inhabitants of the small islands, are human beings because of their exalted minds. The destiny of these is the human destiny. The twenty-six classes of gods,

original: dibbanti attano iddhānubhāvena kīḷanti jotanti cāti devā, te eva gatīti devagati.
analyzed: dibbanti attanaḥ iddha anubhāvena kīḷanti jotanti ca ati devā te eva gatī iti devagati
translated: from the Cātumahārājika gods up to the Bhavāgra gods, are gods because of their divine power, because of their sport, and because of their shining. The destiny of these is the divine destiny.

original: Tā panetā gatiyo yasmā taṃtaṃkammanibbatto upapattibhavaviseso, tasmā atthato vipākakkhandhā
analyzed: tāḥ pana itāḥ gatiyaḥ yasmā taṃ taṃ kamma nibbattaḥ upapatti bhava viseso tasmā atthataḥ vipāka khandhāḥ
translated: But these destinies are in fact the different kinds of rebirth-process existence generated by the respective kinds of kamma.🔽And the material form is their outcome.

original: kaṭattā ca rūpaṃ. Tattha “ayaṃ nāma gati iminā nāma kammunā jāyati, tassa ca kammassa
analyzed: kaṭattā ca rūpam tattha ayam nāma gati iminā nāma kammunā jāyati tassa ca kammassa
translated: Herein, the Blessed One’s knowledge occurs by analysis of cause and fruit in each instance thus: “This destiny is produced by this kind of kamma, and that destiny is produced by that kind of kamma.

original: paccayavisesehi evaṃ vibhāgabhinnattā visuṃ ete sattanikāyā evaṃ vibhāgabhinnā”ti
analyzed: paccaya visesehi evam vibhāga bhinna ttā visum ete satta nikāyāḥ evam vibhāga bhinnā ati
translated: And because of the difference in the conditions for that kamma, the destiny is analysed into different kinds. So these different kinds of beings are analysed into different destinies because of the difference in their kamma. ”

original: yathāsakaṃ hetuphalavibhāgaparicchindanavasena ṭhānaso hetuso bhagavato ñāṇaṃ pavattati. Tenāha bhagavā –
analyzed: yathāsakam hetu phala vibhāga paricchindana vasena ṭhānasaḥ hetusaḥ bhagavataḥ ñāṇam pavattati tena āha bhagavā
translated: That is why the Blessed One’s knowledge occurs by analysis of cause and fruit in each instance. Hence the Blessed One said:

analyzed: andhaḥ a cakkhukaḥ hata nettaḥ a pariṇāyakaḥ vipatha pakkhandaḥ añjasā aparaddhaḥ mahā ogha pakkhandaḥ  dvīhi diṭṭhigatehi pariyuṭṭhitaḥ tīhi duccaritehi vippaṭipanno catūhi yogehi yojitaḥ  catūhi ganthehi ganthitaḥ catūhi upādānehi upādiyati pañca gati samāruḍhaḥ pañcahi  kāma guṇehi rajjati pañcahi nīvaraṇehi chahi vivāda mūlehi vivadati chahi
translated: It is blind, it is sightless, it is without a guide, it has gone off the path, it has lost its way, it is in the great flood, it is in the great wilderness, it is in the great bramble patch, it is in the great darkness, it is in the great blinding darkness.

original: taṇhākāyehi rajjati, chahi diṭṭhigatehi pariyuṭṭhito, sattahi anusayehi anusaṭo,
analyzed: taṇhā kāyehi rajjati chahi diṭṭhi gatehi pariyuṭṭhitaḥ sattahi anusayehi anusaṭaḥ
translated: It is surrounded by the two kinds of views, it is engaged in the three kinds of wrongness, it is yoked to the four kinds of knottedness, it is tied to the four kinds of grasping, it is mounted on the five kinds of destiny, it is bound by the five kinds of bondage, it is attached to the five kinds of sense pleasure, it is covered by the five hindrances, it is in conflict with the six roots of dispute, it is attached to the six kinds of craving, it is surrounded by the six kinds of views, it is pursued by the seven kinds of pursuit, it is afflicted by the eight kinds of worldly conditions, it is caught in the net of the nine kinds of dwellings, it is burned by the ten kinds of wrong path.

original: sattahi saññojanehi saṃyutto, sattahi mānehi unnato, aṭṭhahi lokadhammehi samparivattati,🔽aṭṭhahi micchattehi niyyāto, aṭṭhahi purisadosehi dussati, navahi āghātavatthūhi
analyzed: sattahi saññojanehi saṃyuttaḥ sattahi mānehi unnataḥ aṭṭhahi lokadhammehi samparivattati  aṭṭhahi micchattehi niyyātaḥ aṭṭhahi purisa dosehi dussati navahi āghāta vatthūhi
translated: He is committed to the eight wrongnesses, corrupted by the eight worldly affairs,

original: āghātito, navavidhamānehi unnato, navahi taṇhāmūlakehi dhammehi rajjati, dasahi kilesavatthūhi
analyzed: āghātitaḥ navavidha mānehi unnataḥ navahi taṇhā mūlakehi dhammehi rajjati dasahi kilesa vatthūhi
translated: and is assailed by the nine causes of vexation. He is puffed up with the nine kinds of conceit, and is entangled by the nine fetters rooted in craving. He is defiled by the ten defilements of the mind,

original: kilissati, dasahi āghātavatthūhi āghātito, dasahi akusalakammapathehi samannāgato,🔽dasahi saṃyojanehi saṃyutto, dasahi micchattehi niyyāto, dasavatthukāya micchādiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: kilissati dasahi āghāta vatthūhi āghātitaḥ dasahi akusala kammapathehi samannāgataḥ  dasahi saṃyojanehi saṃyuttaḥ dasahi micchattehi niyyātaḥ dasa vatthukāya micchādiṭṭhiyā
translated: and is assailed by the ten causes of vexation. He is endowed with the ten courses of unwholesome action,🔽bound by the ten fetters, committed to the ten wrongnesses,🔽endowed with the tenfold wrong view, and with the tenfold view of holding to a particular view as paramount.

original: samannāgato, dasavatthukāya antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgato, aṭṭhasatataṇhāpapañcehi
analyzed: samannāgataḥ dasa vatthukāya antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgataḥ aṭṭha sata taṇhā papañcehi
translated: He is entangled by the one hundred and eight fetters of craving,🔽and is beset by the sixty-two kinds of false views. He is a dweller in the world.

original: papañcito, dvāsaṭṭhiyā diṭṭhigatehi pariyuṭṭhito, lokasannivāsoti passantānaṃ buddhānaṃ
analyzed: papañcitaḥ dvāsaṭṭhiyā diṭṭhigatehi pariyuṭṭhitaḥ loka sannivāsaḥ ti passantānam buddhānam
translated: Seeing this, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: bhagavantānaṃ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamati.
analyzed: bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati
translated: experience great compassion for beings.

original: “Ahañcamhi tiṇṇo, loko ca atiṇṇo. Ahañcamhi mutto, loko ca amutto. Ahañcamhi danto,🔽loko ca adanto. Ahañcamhi santo, loko ca asanto. Ahañcamhi assattho, loko ca anassattho.🔽Ahañcamhi parinibbuto, loko ca aparinibbuto. Pahomi khvāhaṃ tiṇṇo tāretuṃ, mutto
analyzed: aham camhi tiṇṇaḥ loko ca a tiṇṇaḥ aham camhi muttaḥ loko ca a muttaḥ aham camhi danto  loko ca adantaḥ aham camhi santaḥ loko ca asantaḥ aham camhi assattho loko ca anassattho  aham ca amhi parinibbutaḥ loko ca a parinibbutaḥ pahomi khvā aham tiṇṇaḥ tāretum mutto
translated: “I am delivered, but the world is not delivered. I am freed, but the world is not freed. I am calm,🔽but the world is not calm. I am secure, but the world is not secure.

original: mocetuṃ, danto dametuṃ, santo sametuṃ, assattho assāsetuṃ, parinibbuto parinibbāpetunti
analyzed: mocetum dantaḥ dametum santaḥ sametum assatthaḥ assāsetum parinibbutaḥ parinibbāpetum ti
translated: I am fully quenched, but the world is not fully quenched. I am able to deliver those who are not delivered, to free those who are not freed, to calm those who are not calm, to secure those who are not secure, to fully quench those who are not fully quenched.”

original: passantānaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ sattesu mahākaruṇā okkamatī”ti.
analyzed: passantānam buddhānam bhagavantānam sattesu mahā karuṇā okkamati iti
translated: When the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, see thus, great compassion arises in them for beings.

original: Evaṃ ekūnanavutiyā ākārehi vibhajanaṃ kataṃ.
analyzed: evam ekūna navutiyāḥ ākārehi vibhajanam katam
translated: Thus the analysis is made in eighty-nine modes.

original: Yaṃ pana yāvatā dhammadhātuyā yattakaṃ ñātabbaṃ saṅkhatāsaṅkhatādikassa sabbassa
analyzed: yam pana yāvatā dhammadhātuyā yattakam ñātabbam saṅkhata asaṅkhata ādikassa sabbassa
translated: But the knowledge of the Buddhas is not only so much. It is the knowledge of the entire world sphere, of all that can be known, of the formed and unformed, etc.,

original: paropadesanirapekkhaṃ sabbākārena paṭivijjhanasamatthaṃ ākaṅkhamattappaṭibaddhavuttianaññasādhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: para upadesa nirapekkham sabba ākārena paṭivijjhana samattham ākaṅkhamatta ppaṭibaddha vutti anañña sādhāraṇam
translated: which is independent of the instruction of others, which is capable of penetrating all modes of knowledge by a mere act of volition, and which is not shared by any other being.

original: bhagavato ñāṇaṃ sabbathā anavasesasaṅkhatāsaṅkhatasammutisaccāvabodhato sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ🔽tatthāvaraṇābhāvato nissaṅgappavattimupādāya anāvaraṇañāṇanti vuccati. Ekameva hi
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ñāṇam sabbathā anavasesa saṅkhata asaṅkhata sammuti sacca avabodhataḥ sabbaññuta ññāṇam  tattha āvaraṇa abhāvataḥ nissaṅga ppavattim upādāya anāvaraṇa ñāṇam ti vuccati ekam eva hi
translated: The Blessed One’s knowledge of omniscience is so called because it is the penetration of all the kinds of states that are included in the categories of the formed and the unformed, and of the conventional and the ultimate truths, without exception.🔽And it is called knowledge of non-hindrance because it occurs without hindrance owing to the absence of any hindrance to that knowledge.

original: taṃ ñāṇaṃ visayappavattimukhena aññehi asādhāraṇabhāvadassanatthaṃ duvidhena uddiṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: tat ñāṇam visaya ppavatti mukhena aññehi asādhāraṇa bhāva dassana ttham duvidhena uddiṭṭham
translated: For it is only one kind of knowledge, but it is stated in two ways in order to show that it is not shared by others because of the way in which it occurs with respect to its object.

original: Aññathā sabbaññutānāvaraṇañāṇānaṃ sādhāraṇatā sabbavisayatā āpajjeyyuṃ, na ca taṃ
analyzed: aññathā sabbaññu tā anāvaraṇa ñāṇānam sādhāraṇa tā sabba visaya tā āpajjeyyum na ca tam
translated: Otherwise, omniscience and knowledge of non-hindrance would be common to all and would have all as their domain. But that is not right.

original: yuttaṃ kiñcāpi imāya yuttiyā. Ayañhettha pāḷi –🔽“Sabbaṃ saṅkhatamasaṅkhataṃ anavasesaṃ jānātīti sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ, tattha āvaraṇaṃ🔽natthīti anāvaraṇañāṇaṃ. Atītaṃ sabbaṃ jānātīti sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ, tattha āvaraṇaṃ
analyzed: yuttam kiñca api imāya yuttiyā  sabbam saṅkhatam asaṅkhatam anavasesam jānāti iti sabbaññuta ññāṇam tattha āvaraṇam  natthi iti anāvaraṇa ñāṇam atītam sabbam jānāti iti sabbaññuta ññāṇam tattha āvaraṇam
translated: And although this interpretation is correct, the text is as follows:🔽“It knows all formed and unformed states without exception, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the past, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the future, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance.

original: natthīti anāvaraṇañāṇaṃ. Anāgataṃ sabbaṃ jānātīti sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ, tattha āvaraṇaṃ
analyzed: na atthi iti anāvaraṇa ñāṇam anāgatam sabbam jānāti iti sabbaññuta ññāṇam tattha āvaraṇam
translated: It knows all the present, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the near, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the far, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the gross, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the refined, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the surpassable, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the unsurpassable, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-hindrance. It knows all the mundane, thus it is knowledge of omniscience. There is no hindrance to that, thus it is knowledge of non-

original: natthīti anāvaraṇañāṇaṃ. Paccuppannaṃ sabbaṃ jānātīti sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ, tattha āvaraṇaṃ
analyzed: natthi iti anāvaraṇa ñāṇam paccuppannam sabbam jānāti iti sabbaññuta ññāṇam tattha āvaraṇam
translated: “There is not” is unobstructed knowledge. “He knows all that has come to be” is the knowledge of omniscience. Herein, the knowledge of omniscience is obstructed in three instances:

original: natthīti anāvaraṇañāṇa”nti vitthāro.
analyzed: natthi iti anāvaraṇa ñāṇam ti vitthāro
translated: and the knowledge that there is no obstruction is the knowledge of non-obstruction. He knows all that is present, and there is no obstruction to his knowledge of it: this is the knowledge of omniscience, and the knowledge that there is no obstruction is the knowledge of non-obstruction.”🔽So these six kinds of knowledge that are not shared by disciples are “such” because they occur with an undistorted mode of knowledge, and they are “not otherwise” because they are infallible in their respective fields.

original: Evametāni bhagavato chaasādhāraṇañāṇāni aviparītākārappavattiyā yathāsakavisayassa avisaṃvādanato tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni. Evampi bhagavā tathāni āgatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: evam etāni bhagavataḥ cha asādhāraṇa ñāṇāni aviparīta ākāra ppavattiyā yathā saka visayassa avisaṃvādanato tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni evam pi bhagavā tathāni āgataḥ ti tathāgataḥ
translated: And so the Blessed One is “such” because he has come to suchness.

original: Tathā –🔽“Sattime, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅgā – satisambojjhaṅgo, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo,
analyzed: tathā  sattime bhikkhave bojjhaṅgā sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ
translated: And again:

original: pītisambojjhaṅgo, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, samādhisambojjhaṅgo, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo”ti
analyzed: pīti sambojjhaṅgo passaddhi sambojjhaṅgo samādhi sambojjhaṅgo upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo ti
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these seven factors of enlightenment. What seven? The enlightenment factor of mindfulness … the enlightenment factor of equanimity” .

original: evaṃ sarūpato, “yāyaṃ lokuttaramaggakkhaṇe uppajjamānā līnuddhaccapatiṭṭhānāyūhanakāmasukhallikattakilamathānuyogaucchedasassatābhinivesādīnaṃ
analyzed: evam sarūpataḥ yā ayam lokuttara magga kkhaṇe uppajjamānā
translated: So they are “such” in the sense of being of the same nature as this. And they are “not otherwise” because they are not subject to the views of vanity, sensual desire, and so on, which arise in the foolish many.

original: anekesaṃ upaddavānaṃ paṭipakkhabhūtā satiādibhedā dhammasāmaggī, yāya ariyasāvako
analyzed: anekesam upaddavānam paṭipakkha bhūtā sati ādi bhedā dhamma sāmaggī ariya sāvako
translated: By means of that concentration the noble disciple

original: bujjhati kilesaniddāya uṭṭhahati, cattāri vā ariyasaccāni paṭivijjhati, nibbānameva
analyzed: bujjhati kilesa niddāya uṭṭhahati cattāri vā ariya saccāni paṭivijjhati nibbānam eva
translated: awakens from the sleep of defilements, he rises up, or he penetrates the four noble truths, or he realizes Nibbāna. That concentration is called enlightenment .

original: vā sacchikarotīti, sā dhammasāmaggī bodhīti vuccati. Tassā ‘bodhiyā aṅgāti bojjhaṅgā,
analyzed: vā sacchikaroti iti sā dhamma sāmaggī bodhī iti vuccati tassā bodhiyā aṅgā ati bojjhaṅgā
translated: The factors of that enlightenment are the enlightenment factors .

original: ariyasāvako vā yathāvuttāya dhammasāmaggiyā bujjhatīti katvā bodhīti vuccati, tassa
analyzed: ariya sāvakaḥ vā yathā vuttāya dhamma sāmaggiyā bujjhati iti katvā bodhī iti vuccati tassa
translated: Or the noble disciple is called enlightenment because he awakens to the aforesaid concentration consisting in the states beginning with mindfulness.🔽The factors of that enlightenment are the enlightenment factors” .🔽Thus they are in the general sense.

original: bodhissa aṅgātipi bojjhaṅgā”ti evaṃ sāmaññalakkhaṇato. “Upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇo satisambojjhaṅgo,
analyzed: bodhissa aṅgā atipi bojjhaṅgā ati evam sāmañña lakkhaṇato upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgo
translated: “The mindfulness enlightenment factor has the characteristic of establishing .🔽The investigation-of-states enlightenment factor has the characteristic of investigating .

original: pavicayalakkhaṇo dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, paggahalakkhaṇo vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, pharaṇalakkhaṇo
analyzed: pavicaya lakkhaṇaḥ dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgo paggaha lakkhaṇaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgo pharaṇa lakkhaṇo
translated: The energy enlightenment factor has the characteristic of exerting .🔽The rapture enlightenment factor has the characteristic of pervading .🔽The tranquillity enlightenment factor has the characteristic of quieting .

original: pītisambojjhaṅgo, upasamalakkhaṇo passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, avikkhepalakkhaṇo samādhisambojjhaṅgo,
analyzed: pīti sambojjhaṅgo upasama lakkhaṇaḥ passaddhi sambojjhaṅgo avikkhepa lakkhaṇaḥ samādhi sambojjhaṅgo
translated: The concentration enlightenment factor has the characteristic of non-distraction .

original: paṭisaṅkhānalakkhaṇo upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo”ti evaṃ visesalakkhaṇato.
analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna lakkhaṇaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo ti evam visesa lakkhaṇato
translated: The equanimity enlightenment factor has the characteristic of looking on .🔽Thus in the specific sense.

original: “Tattha katamo satisambojjhaṅgo? Idha, bhikkhu, satimā hoti paramena satinepakkena
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ idha bhikkhu satimā hoti paramena sati nepakkena
translated: He dwells contemplating feelings as feelings, ardent, fully aware, and mindful, having put away covetousness and grief for the world.🔽He dwells contemplating mind as mind, ardent, fully aware, and mindful, having put away covetousness and grief for the world.

original: samannāgato, cirakatampi cirabhāsitampi saritā hoti anussaritā”tiādinā sattannaṃ
analyzed: samannāgataḥ cirakatam pi cira bhāsitam pi saritā hoti anussaritā ati ādinā
translated: He dwells contemplating mind-objects as mind-objects, ardent, fully aware, and mindful, having put away covetousness and grief for the world” .🔽This shows how the seven enlightenment factors occur in a single moment by the mutual assistance of the enlightenment factors.🔽“Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness? There is, bhikkhus, mindfulness and there is mindfully clear comprehension” .

original: bojjhaṅgānaṃ aññamaññopakāravasena ekakkhaṇe pavattidassanato, “tattha katamo satisambojjhaṅgo?🔽Atthi ajjhattaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammesu sati, atthi bahiddhā dhammesu satī”tiādinā tesaṃ
analyzed: bojjhaṅgānam aññamañña upakāra vasena eka kkhaṇe pavatti dassanato tattha katamaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgo  atthi ajjhattam bhikkhave dhammesu sati atthi bahiddhā dhammesu sati iti ādinā tesam
translated: This shows how they occur by the division of their respective functions.🔽“Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness? There is, bhikkhus, the internal mindfulness enlightenment factor. There are mental objects, bhikkhus, external to that mindfulness enlightenment factor” .🔽This shows how they occur by the division of their respective objective fields.

original: visayavibhāgena pavattidassanato. “Tattha katamo satisambojjhaṅgo? Idha, bhikkhave,
analyzed: visaya vibhāgena pavatti dassanato tattha katamaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgo idha bhikkhave
translated: “Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness? There is, bhikkhus, the internal mindfulness enlightenment factor. There are mental objects, bhikkhus, external to that mindfulness enlightenment factor” .🔽This shows how they occur by the division of their respective objective fields.🔽“Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness? There is, bhikkhus, the internal mindfulness enlightenment factor. There are mental objects, bhikkhus, external to that mindfulness enlightenment factor” .🔽This shows how they occur by the division of their respective objective fields.

original: bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmi”ntiādinā
analyzed: bhikkhu sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vossagga pariṇāmin tiādinā
translated: “Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness? There is, bhikkhus, the internal mindfulness enlightenment factor. There are mental objects, bhikkhus, external to that mindfulness enlightenment factor” .🔽This shows how they occur by the division of their respective objective fields.🔽“Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness? There is, bhikkhus, the internal mindfulness enlightenment factor. There are mental objects, bhikkhus, external to that mindfulness enlightenment factor” .🔽This shows how they occur by the division of their respective objective fields.

original: bhāvanāvidhidassanato. “Tattha katame satta bojjhaṅgā? Idha bhikkhu yasmiṃ samaye
analyzed: bhāvanā vidhi dassanato tattha katame satta bojjhaṅgāḥ idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye
translated: “Herein, what is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness? There is, bhikkhus, the internal mindfulness enlightenment factor.

original: lokuttaraṃ jhānaṃ bhāveti…pe… tasmiṃ samaye satta bojjhaṅgā honti satisambojjhaṅgo…pe…🔽upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo. Tattha katamo satisambojjhaṅgo? Sabbakilesehi
analyzed: lokuttaram jhānam tasmin samaye satta bojjhaṅgāḥ honti sati sambojjhaṅga upe  upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo tattha katamaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgo yā sati pe anussati itiādinā  channavutiyā naya sahassa vibhāgehi iti evam nānā ākārataḥ pavattāni bhagavataḥ sambojjhaṅga vibhāvana ñāṇāni  tassa tassa atthassa avisaṃvādanato tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni evam pi bhagavā  tathāni āgataḥ iti tathāgataḥ  tathā  tattha katamam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ariya saccam ayam eva ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgiko  maggo seyyathidam sammā diṭṭhi pe sammā samādhi iti evam sarūpataḥ sabba kilesehi
translated: He develops the supramundane jhāna … At that time there are seven factors of enlightenment. The enlightenment factor of mindfulness …

original: ārakattā ariyabhāvakarattā ariyaphalappaṭilābhakarattā ca ariyo, aṭṭhavidhattā nibbānādhigamāya
analyzed: ārakattā ariya bhāva karattā ariya phala ppaṭilābha karattā ca ariyaḥ aṭṭhavidhattā nibbāna adhigamāya
