original: ekantakāraṇattā ca aṭṭhaṅgiko. Kilese mārento gacchati, nibbānatthikehi maggīyati,
analyzed: ekanta kāraṇa ttā ca aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ kilese mārentaḥ gacchati nibbāna atthikehi
translated: And it is the eightfold path because it is the sole cause. It is the path because it goes by destroying defilements, because it is gone by those who seek Nibbāna,

original: sayaṃ vā nibbānaṃ maggatīti maggoti evaṃ sāmaññalakkhaṇato. “Sammā dassanalakkhaṇā
analyzed: sayam vā nibbānam maggati iti maggo ti evam sāmañña lakkhaṇato sammā dassana lakkhaṇā
translated: or because it goes to Nibbāna by itself. This is how it should be understood as to characteristic, etc.🔽As to characteristic, etc., right view has the characteristic of seeing rightly;

original: sammādiṭṭhi, sammā abhiniropanalakkhaṇo sammāsaṅkappo, sammā pariggahaṇalakkhaṇā
analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi sammā abhiniropana lakkhaṇaḥ sammā saṅkappo sammā pariggahaṇa lakkhaṇā
translated: right thought has the characteristic of rightly determining;🔽right speech has the characteristic of right embracing;

original: sammāvācā, sammā samuṭṭhānalakkhaṇo sammākammanto, sammā vodānalakkhaṇo sammāājīvo,
analyzed: sammā vācā sammā samuṭṭhāna lakkhaṇo sammā kammanto sammā vodāna lakkhaṇo sammā ājīvo
translated: right action has the characteristic of right instigation; right livelihood has the characteristic of right cleansing;

original: sammā paggahalakkhaṇo sammāvāyāmo, sammā upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇā sammāsati, sammā avikkhepalakkhaṇo🔽sammāsamādhī”ti evaṃ visesalakkhaṇato. Sammādiṭṭhi aññehipi attano paccanīkakilesehi🔽saddhiṃ micchādiṭṭhiṃ pajahati, nibbānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ karoti, tappaṭicchādakamohavidhamanena
analyzed: sammā paggaha lakkhaṇo sammāvāyāmo sammā upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇā sammā sati sammā avikkhepa lakkhaṇo  sammāsamādhi iti evam visesa lakkhaṇato sammādiṭṭhi aññehi pi attanaḥ paccanīka kilesehi  saddhim micchādiṭṭhim pajahati nibbānam ārammaṇam karoti tad paṭicchādaka moha vidhamanena
translated: right effort has the characteristic of right exerting; right mindfulness has the characteristic of right establishing; right concentration has the characteristic of right non-distraction.🔽As to how they abandon: right view abandons wrong view together with its associated states by causing the noble path to arise.🔽It makes Nibbāna its object and it sees the states associated with it as non-delusion by sweeping away the delusion that conceals Nibbāna.

original: asammohato sampayuttadhamme ca passati. Tathā sammāsaṅkappādayopi micchāsaṅkappādīni
analyzed: asammohato sampayutta dhamme ca passati tathā sammāsaṅkappa ādayaḥ pi micchāsaṅkappa ādīni
translated: Similarly, right thought abandons wrong thought,🔽and so on.

original: pajahanti, nibbānañca ārammaṇaṃ karonti, sahajātadhammānaṃ sammāabhiniropanapariggahaṇasamuṭṭhānavodānapaggahaupaṭṭhānasamādahanāni
analyzed: pajahanti nibbānam ca ārammaṇam karonti sahajāta dhammānam sammā abhiniropana pariggahaṇa samuṭṭhāna vodāna paggaha upaṭṭhāna samādahanāni
translated: They abandon, and they make Nibbāna their object. They rightly apply themselves to the states that are conascent with them, and they instigate, arouse, and instigate again the apprehending, the defining, the adverting, the up- holding, the establishing, the repeatedly-lifting-up, and the non-forgetting of those states.

original: ca karontīti evaṃ kiccavibhāgato. Sammādiṭṭhi pubbabhāge nānakkhaṇā visuṃ visuṃ dukkhādiārammaṇā🔽hutvā maggakāle ekakkhaṇā nibbānameva ārammaṇaṃ katvā kiccato “dukkhe ñāṇa”ntiādīni
analyzed: ca karonti iti evam kicca vibhāgato sammādiṭṭhi pubbabhāge nānā kkhaṇā visum visum dukkha ādi ārammaṇā  hutvā magga kāle eka kkhaṇāḥ nibbānam eva ārammaṇam katvā kiccataḥ dukkhe ñāṇa nti ādīni
translated: So they are distinguished by their functions. Right view, in the earlier stage, is not of the same moment and has different objects in the various instances as the states beginning with the contemplation of impermanence that have suffering, etc., as their object.🔽But at the time of the path it is of the same moment and has Nibbāna as its sole object. It gets the four names beginning “Knowledge of suffering” according to its function.

original: cattāri nāmāni labhati, sammāsaṅkappādayopi pubbabhāge nānakkhaṇā nānārammaṇā maggakāle
analyzed: cattāri nāmāni labhati sammāsaṅkappa ādayaḥ pi pubba bhāge nāna kkhaṇāḥ nānā ārammaṇāḥ magga kāle
translated: Right thought, etc., in the earlier stage, are not of the same moment and have different objects.

original: ekakkhaṇā ekārammaṇā.🔽Tesu sammāsaṅkappo kiccato nekkhammasaṅkappotiādīni tīṇi nāmāni labhati, sammāvācādayo
analyzed: eka khaṇāḥ eka ārammaṇāḥ  tesu sammāsaṅkappo kiccataḥ nekkhamma saṅkappo ti ādīni tīṇi nāmāni labhati sammā vācā ādayaḥ
translated: But at the time of the path they are of the same moment and have the same object.🔽Of these, right thought gets the three names beginning “Renunciation-thinking” according to its function.🔽The three beginning with right speech are abstentions and also intentions in the earlier stage, being distinguished as “abstention from false speech,” etc.

original: tayo pubbabhāge musāvādāveramaṇītiādivibhāgā viratiyopi cetanāyopi hutvā maggakkhaṇe
analyzed: tayo pubba bhāge musāvāda averamaṇī iti ādi vibhāgāḥ viratiyaḥ api cetanāyaḥ api hutvā magga kkhaṇe
translated: But at the time of the path they are only abstentions.

original: viratiyova, sammāvāyāmasatiyo kiccato sammappadhānasatipaṭṭhānavasena cattāri nāmāni
analyzed: viratiyo uva sammā vāyāma satiyo kiccato sammappadhāna sati paṭṭhāna vasena cattāri nāmāni
translated: Right endeavour and right mindfulness get the four names beginning “Righteous endeavour” and “Foundation of mindfulness” according to their function.

original: labhanti. Sammāsamādhi pana maggakkhaṇepi paṭhamajjhānādivasena nānā evāti evaṃ pubbabhāgaparabhāgesu
analyzed: labhanti sammāsamādhi pana magga kkhaṇe pi paṭhamajjhāna ādi vasena nānā eva ati evam pubbabhāga parabhāgesu
translated: and right concentration is of various kinds too, according to whether it is the first jhāna, and so on. So they occur in the various ways already stated.

original: pavattivibhāgato, “idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammādiṭṭhiṃ bhāveti vivekanissita”ntiādinā
analyzed: pavatti vibhāgataḥ idha bhikkhave bhikkhu sammādiṭṭhim bhāveti viveka nissita nti ādinā
translated: As to the method of development: “Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu develops right view, which is based upon seclusion, based upon dispassion, based upon cessation, that ends in self-surrender” ,

original: bhāvanāvidhito, “tattha katamo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo? Idha, bhikkhu, yasmiṃ samaye lokuttaraṃ
analyzed: bhāvanā vidhito tattha katamaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo idha bhikkhu yasmin samaye lokuttaram
translated: and so on in the way beginning “Herein, what is the Noble Eightfold Path? Right view … right concentration” ,🔽and in the way beginning “Here, bhikkhus, whenever a bhikkhu is developing the supermundane … and has a swift cognizance … and has attained the first jhāna … and is developing the supermundane … and has a sluggish cognizance … and has attained the second jhāna … and has attained the third jhāna … and has attained the fourth jhāna … and is developing the supermundane … and has attained the base of infinite space … and has attained the base of infinite consciousness … and has attained the base of nothingness … and is developing the supermundane … and has attained the base of neither perception nor non-perception … and has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, then on that occasion his cognizance is rightly directed to abandoning wrongness, and his cognizance is rightly directed to undertaking rightness” ,🔽and so on in the way beginning “Herein, what is right view? Knowledge of suffering … Knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of suffering is right view” ,

original: jhānaṃ bhāveti…pe… dukkhāpaṭipadaṃ dandhābhiññaṃ, tasmiṃ samaye aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo
analyzed: jhānam dukkha apaṭipadam dandha abhiññam tasmin samaye aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: and in the way beginning “Herein, what is right thought? Thought of renunciation … Thought of non-ill will … Thought of non-cruelty is right thought” ,

original: hoti sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo”tiādinā caturāsītiyā nayasahassavibhāgehīti evaṃ anekākārato🔽pavattāni bhagavato ariyamaggavibhāvanañāṇāni atthassa avisaṃvādanato sabbānipi tathāni🔽avitathāni anaññathāni. Evampi bhagavā tathāni āgatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: hoti sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappaḥ ti ādinā caturāsītiyā naya sahassa vibhāgehi iti evam aneka ākārato  pavattāni bhagavataḥ ariya magga vibhāvana ñāṇāni atthassa avisaṃvādanato sabbāni api tathāni  avitathāni anaññathāni evampi bhagavā tathāni āgataḥ ti tathāgataḥ
translated: and in the way beginning “Herein, what is right speech? Abstinence from false speech … Abstinence from malicious speech … Abstinence from harsh speech … Abstinence from gossip is right speech” ,🔽and in the way beginning “Herein, what is right action? Abstinence from killing living beings … Abstinence from taking what is not given … Abstinence from misconduct in sensual desires is right action” ,🔽and in the way beginning “Herein, what is right livelihood? Here a noble disciple, having abandoned wrong livelihood, earns his living by right livelihood” ,

original: Tathā paṭhamajjhānasamāpatti yā ca nirodhasamāpattīti etāsu anupaṭipāṭiyā viharitabbaṭṭhena
analyzed: tathā paṭhamajjhāna samāpatti yā ca nirodha samāpatti iti etāsu anupaṭipāṭiyā viharitabba ṭṭhena
translated: and in the way beginning “Herein, what is right effort? Here a bhikkhu awakens zeal for the non-arising of un

original: samāpajjitabbaṭṭhena ca anupubbavihārasamāpattīsu sampādanapaccavekkhaṇādivasena
analyzed: samāpajjitabba ṭṭhena ca anupubba vihāra samāpattīsu sampādana paccavekkhaṇa ādi vasena
translated: and in the case of the successive attainments, by way of the reviewing of the fulfilment, etc.,

original: yathārahaṃ sampayogavasena ca pavattāni bhagavato ñāṇāni tadatthasiddhiyā tathāni
analyzed: yathāraham sampayoga vasena ca pavattāni bhagavataḥ ñāṇāni tad attha siddhiyā tathāni
translated: And the Blessed One’s knowledge that occurs in the way appropriate to each case, in the sense of attaining the successive stages of jhāna, in the sense of reviewing the fulfilment of the jhānas, and so on, and in the sense of combining them, is also such,

original: avitathāni anaññathāni. Tathā “idaṃ imassa ṭhānaṃ, idaṃ aṭṭhāna”nti aviparītaṃ tassa🔽tassa phalassa kāraṇākāraṇajānanaṃ, tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ atītādibhedabhinnassa kammasamādānassa
analyzed: avitathāni anaññathāni tathā idam imassa ṭhānam idam aṭṭhānam ti aviparītam tassa  tassa phalassa kāraṇa akāraṇa jānanam tesam tesam sattānam atīta ādi bheda bhinnassa kamma samādānassa
translated: not otherwise, not otherwise, for the accomplishment of their purpose.🔽And his knowledge of the reason and the non-reason for the various kinds of fruit is also such, not otherwise, not otherwise, since it is unperverted in discerning the right and wrong occasions for the various kinds of fruit.

original: anavasesato yathābhūtaṃ vipākantarajānanaṃ, āyūhanakkhaṇeyeva tassa tassa sattassa
analyzed: anavasesataḥ yathābhūtam vipāka antara jānanam tassa tassa sattassa
translated: And his knowledge of the ripening of the various kinds of kamma of beings in the past, present, and future, without remainder, is also such, not otherwise, not otherwise.🔽And his knowledge of the way that leads to the various kinds of destiny, namely, “This is the way that leads to hell … This is the way that leads to heaven … This is the way that leads to the imperturbable … This is the way that leads to enlightenment,” is also such, not otherwise, not otherwise, since it is the discernment of the way that leads to the various kinds of destiny, namely, the way that leads to the four kinds of generation, the five kinds of destiny, the seven stations of consciousness, and the nine abodes of beings, which way is accompanied by taints and without taint, according as it was said:

original: “ayaṃ nirayagāminī paṭipadā…pe… ayaṃ nibbānagāminī paṭipadā”ti yāthāvato sāsavānāsavakammavibhāgajānanaṃ,
analyzed: ayam niraya gāminī paṭipadā āpe ayam nibbāna gāminī paṭipadā ti yāthāvato sa āsava anāsava kamma vibhāga jānanam
translated: “The way that leads to the imperturbable, that leads to the imperturbable only” .

original: 0.khandhāyatanādīnaṃ upādinnānupādinnādianekasabhāvaṃ nānāsabhāvañca tassa lokassa🔽“imāya nāma dhātuyā ussannattā imasmiṃ dhammappabandhe ayaṃ viseso jāyatī”tiādinā
analyzed: khandha āyatana ādīnam upādinna anupādinna ādi aneka sabhāvam nānā sabhāvam ca tassa lokassa 🔽imāya nāma dhātuyā ussanna ttā imasmin dhammappabandhe ayam visesaḥ jāyati itiādinā
translated: And his knowledge of the world’s manifold and varied elements, such as the aggregates, sense bases, and senses-and-faculties, which are of many kinds and various kinds, is also such, not otherwise, not otherwise, since it is the discernment of the manifold and varied elements of the world.🔽And his knowledge of the world’s manifold and varied elements, such as the aggregates, sense bases, and senses-and-faculties, which are of many kinds and various kinds, is also such, not otherwise, not otherwise, since it is the discernment of the manifold and varied elements of the world. For it is said: “The world is a manifold world, a varied world. In this world with its manifold and varied elements, the worldling is bewildered, but the Perfect One is not” .

original: nayena yathābhūtaṃ dhātunānattajānanaṃ, anavasesato sattānaṃ hīnādiajjhāsayādhimuttijānanaṃ,
analyzed: nayena yathābhūtam dhātu nānatta jānanam anavasesataḥ sattānam hīna ādi ajjhāsaya adhimutti jānanam
translated: He knows the diversity of elements in beings as it really is by means of the method of the elements. He knows the inclinations, tendencies, and temperaments of beings as they really are without exception.

original: saddhādiindriyānaṃ tikkhamudutājānanaṃ, saṃkilesādīhi saddhiṃ jhānavimokkhādivisesajānanaṃ,
analyzed: saddhā ādi indriyānam tikkha mudu tā jānanam saṃkilesa ādīhi saddhim jhāna vimokkha ādi visesa jānanam
translated: He knows the keenness and dullness of the faculties of faith, etc., in beings as they really are. He knows the different kinds of meditation, deliverance, concentration, attainment, and way of practice as they really are together with their respective constituents.

original: sattānaṃ aparimāṇāsu jātīsu tappaṭibandhena saddhiṃ anavasesato pubbenivutthakkhandhasantatijānanaṃ,🔽hīnādivibhāgehi saddhiṃ cutipaṭisandhijānanaṃ, “idaṃ dukkha”ntiādinā heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva
analyzed: sattānam aparimāṇāsu jātīsu tad paṭibandhena saddhim anavasesataḥ pubbenivuttha kkhandha santati jānanam  hīna ādi vibhāgehi saddhim cuti paṭisandhi jānanam idam dukkham ti ādinā heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva
translated: He knows the succession of aggregates in the various births of beings as they really are together with their respective causes.🔽He knows death and rebirth of beings as they really are together with their respective distinctions. He knows the world with its many and various elements as it really is by means of the method of the world. He knows the four noble truths as they really are by means of the method of the four noble truths.

original: catusaccajānananti imāni bhagavato dasabalañāṇāni avirajjhitvā yathāsakaṃ visayāvagāhanato🔽yathādhippetatthasādhanato ca yathābhūtavuttiyā tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: catu sacca jānanam ti imāni bhagavataḥ dasa bala ñāṇāni a virajjhitvā yathāsakam visaya avagāhanato  ca yathā bhūta vuttiyā tathāni avitathāni anaññathāni vuttam ha etam
translated: These are the ten powers of a Tathāgata. They are called “powers” because he has no fear or trembling in the face of anyone, and because he has reached the utmost blessedness and supremacy in the world with its deities.🔽They are called “tathā” because they are not otherwise, not otherwise than they seem, in the way stated.

original: “Idha tathāgato ṭhānañca ṭhānato aṭṭhānañca aṭṭhānato yathābhūtaṃ pajānātī”tiādi.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ ṭhānam ca ṭhānataḥ aṭṭhānam ca aṭṭhānataḥ yathābhūtam pajānāti itiādi
translated: For this is said: “Here, a Tathāgata understands as it really is the possible as possible and the impossible as impossible” , and so on.

original: Evampi bhagavā tathāni āgatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: evam pi bhagavā tathāni āgataḥ iti tathāgataḥ
translated: Thus he has come to such tathās, thus he is a Tathāgata.

original: Yathā cetesaṃ ñāṇānaṃ vasena, evaṃ yathāvuttānaṃ satipaṭṭhānasammappadhānavibhāvanañāṇādīnaṃ🔽anantāparimeyyabhedānaṃ anaññasādhāraṇānaṃ paññāvisesānaṃ vasena bhagavā tathāni
analyzed: yathā ca itesam ñāṇānam vasena evam yathā vuttānam sati paṭṭhāna sammappadhāna vibhāvana ñāṇa ādīnam  ananta aparimeyya bhedānam anañña sādhāraṇānam paññā visesānam vasena bhagavā tathāni
translated: And just as he has come thus by these kinds of knowledge, so too he has come thus by the special knowledges of understanding, which are of countless and measureless kinds and are not shared by any other kind of being, such as the knowledge of the development of the foundations of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases for success, etc.,

original: ñāṇāni āgato adhigatoti tathāgato. Evampi tathāni āgatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: ñāṇāni āgataḥ adhigataḥ iti tathāgataḥ evam pi tathāni āgataḥ iti tathāgataḥ
translated: and he has reached them, attained them, and penetrated to them, thus he is the “Tathāgata” . So too he has come thus by the special knowledges of understanding, which are of countless and measureless kinds and are not shared by any other kind of being, such as the knowledge of the development of the foundations of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases for success, etc.,🔽and he has reached them, attained them, and penetrated to them, thus he is the “Tathāgata” .

original: Kathaṃ tathā gatoti tathāgato? Yā sā bhagavato abhijāti abhisambodhi dhammavinayapaññāpanā
analyzed: katham tathā gataḥ ti tathāgataḥ yā sā bhagavataḥ abhijāti abhisambodhi dhamma vinaya paññāpanā
translated: How has he gone rightly? The Blessed One’s appearance in the world, his enlightenment, his teaching of the Dhamma,

original: anupādisesanibbānadhātu, sā tathā. Kiṃ vuttaṃ hoti? Yadatthaṃ lokanāthena abhisambodhi🔽patthitā pavattitā ca, tadatthassa ekantasiddhiyā avisaṃvādanato aviparītatthavuttiyā
analyzed: anupādisesa nibbāna dhātu sā tathā kim vuttam hoti yad attham lokanāthena abhisambodhi  patthi tā pavatti tā ca tad atthassa ekanta siddhiyā avisaṃvādanataḥ aviparīta attha vuttiyā
translated: and his final Nibbāna in the element of Nibbāna that is without residue of the substratum of existence are rightly so. What is meant? The appearance in the world of the Benefactor of the world, his enlightenment, his teaching of the Dhamma,

original: tathā avitathā anaññathā. Tathā hi ayaṃ bhagavā bodhisattabhūto samatiṃsapāramiparipūraṇādikaṃ
analyzed: tathā avitathā anaññathā tathā hi ayam bhagavā bodhisatta bhūtaḥ sama tiṃsa pārami paripūraṇa ādikam
translated: and his final Nibbāna in the element of Nibbāna that is without residue of the substratum of existence are rightly so. Why? Because they are not otherwise, not otherwise than so, not otherwise than rightly, not otherwise than truly. For this Blessed One, while still a bodhisatta, fulfilled the pāramīs, etc.,

original: vuttappabhedaṃ sabbaṃ buddhattahetuṃ sampādetvā tusitapure ṭhitova buddhakolāhalaṃ
analyzed: vutta ppabhedam sabbam buddha tta hetum sampādetvā tusitapure ṭhitaḥ uva buddha kolāhalam
translated: and he fulfilled all the causes for Buddhahood, which are of the kinds already stated. Standing in the Tusita heaven, he made a great shout, saying:

original: sutvā dasasahassacakkavāḷadevatāhi ekato sannipatitāhi upasaṅkamitvā –
analyzed: sutvā dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa devatāhi ekatas sannipatitāhi upasaṅkamitvā
translated: and the deities of the ten thousand world systems assembled together and approached him,

original: “Kālo deva mahāvīra, uppajja mātukucchiyaṃ;
analyzed: kālaḥ deva mahāvīraḥ uppajja mātukucchiyam
translated: saying: “The time has come, O Great Hero, to be conceived in the womb of your mother;

original: Sadevakaṃ tārayanto, bujjhassu amataṃ pada”nti. –
analyzed: sa devakam tārayantaḥ bujjhassu amatam padanti
translated: Delivering the world with its gods, be enlightened in the Deathless State.”

original: Āyācito uppannapubbanimitto pañca mahāvilokanāni viloketvā “idānāhaṃ manussayoniyaṃ
analyzed: āyācitaḥ uppanna pubba nimittaḥ pañca mahā vilokanāni viloketvā idānā aham manussa yoniyam
translated: Being thus requested, he surveyed the five great events, and then, thinking: “Now I shall be conceived in the human womb,

original: uppajjitvā abhisambujjhissāmī”ti āsāḷhipuṇṇamāya sakyarājakule mahāmāyāya deviyā
analyzed: uppajjitvā abhisambujjhissāmi iti āsāḷhipuṇṇamāya sakya rāja kule mahāmāyāya deviyā
translated: and attain enlightenment,” he took conception in the womb of Queen Mahāmāyā of the Sakyan royal family, on the full-moon day of the month of Āsāḷhā.

original: kucchimhi paṭisandhiṃ gahetvā dasa māse devamanussehi mahatā parihārena parihariyamāno
analyzed: kucchimhi paṭisandhim gahetvā dasa māse deva manussehi mahatā parihārena parihariyamānaḥ
translated: For ten months he was carried by her, being ministered to with the four requisites in great abundance by gods and men.

original: visākhapuṇṇamāya paccūsasamaye abhijātiṃ pāpuṇi.
analyzed: visākhapuṇṇamāya paccūsa samaye abhijātim pāpuṇi
translated: And on the full-moon day of the month of Visākhā, at the time of the first watch of the night, he was born.

original: Abhijātikkhaṇe panassa paṭisandhiggahaṇakkhaṇe viya dvattiṃsapubbanimittāni pāturahesuṃ.
analyzed: abhijāti khaṇe panassa paṭisandhi ggahaṇa kkhaṇe viya dvattiṃsa pubba nimittāni pāturahesuṃ
translated: But at the moment of his birth, just as at the moment of his conception, the thirty-two omens appeared.

original: Ayañhi dasasahassī lokadhātu kampi saṅkampi sampakampi sampavedhi, dasasu cakkavāḷasahassesu
analyzed: ayam hi dasa sahassī lokadhātu kampi saṅkampi sampakampi sampavedhi dasasu cakkavāḷa sahassesu
translated: For this ten-thousandfold world system shook, quivered, and trembled.

original: appamāṇo obhāso phari, tassa taṃ siriṃ daṭṭhukāmā viya jaccandhā cakkhūni paṭilabhiṃsu,
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ obhāsaḥ phari tassa tam sirim daṭṭhu kāmāḥ viya jat candhā cakkhūni paṭilabhiṃsu
translated: and immeasurable radiance spread forth, as if desirous of seeing his glory. The blind received sight,

original: badhirā saddaṃ suṇiṃsu. Mūgā samālapiṃsu, khujjā ujugattā ahesuṃ, paṅgulā padasā
analyzed: badhirā saddam mūgā samālapiṃsu khujjāḥ uju gattāḥ ahesum paṅgulāḥ padasā
translated: the deaf hearing, the dumb speech, the crippled became straight, the lame able to walk,

original: gamanaṃ paṭilabhiṃsu, bandhanagatā sabbasattā andubandhanādīhi mucciṃsu, sabbanirayesu
analyzed: gamanam bandhana gatā sabba sattāḥ andu bandhana ādīhi mucciṃsu sabba nirayesu
translated: all beings in bondage were freed from fetters and so on, in all the hells

original: aggi nibbāyi, pettivisaye khuppipāsā vūpasami, tiracchānānaṃ bhayaṃ nāhosi, sabbasattānaṃ🔽rogo vūpasami, sabbasattā piyaṃvadā ahesuṃ, madhurenākārena assā hasiṃsu, vāraṇā🔽gajjiṃsu, sabbatūriyāni sakaṃ sakaṃ ninnādaṃ muñciṃsu, aghaṭṭitāni eva manussānaṃ
analyzed: aggi nibbāyi pettivisaye khuppipāsā vūpasami tiracchānānam bhayam na ahosi sabba sattānam  rogaḥ vūpasami sabba sattā piyaṃvadāḥ ahesum madhurena ākārena assā hasiṃsu vāraṇā  gajjiṃsu sabba tūriyāni sakam sakam ninnādam muñciṃsu a ghaṭṭitāni eva manussānam
translated: the fires were extinguished, in the realm of ghosts hunger and thirst ceased, among animals there was no fear,🔽all beings’ diseases ceased, all beings became friendly, with sweet voices they laughed, the elephants🔽roared, all musical instruments sounded their own notes, without being struck, ornaments of men

original: hatthūpagādīni ābharaṇāni madhurenākārena raviṃsu, sabbadisā vippasannā ahesuṃ, sattānaṃ
analyzed: hatthūpaga ādīni ābharaṇāni madhurena ākārena raviṃsu sabbadisā vippasannāḥ ahesum sattānam
translated: such as armlets and so on shone with sweet sounds, all directions became clear,

original: sukhaṃ uppādayamāno mudusītalavāto vāyi, akālamegho vassi, pathavitopi udakaṃ ubbhijjitvā
analyzed: sukham uppādayamānaḥ mudu sītala vātaḥ vāyi akāla meghaḥ vassi pathavitaḥ api udakam ubbhijjitvā
translated: a gentle cool breeze blew producing happiness in beings, an untimely rain fell, and water sprang up from the earth,

original: vissandi, pakkhino ākāsagamanaṃ vijahiṃsu, nadiyo asandamānā aṭṭhaṃsu, mahāsamudde
analyzed: vissandi pakkhinaḥ ākāsagamanam vijahiṃsu nadiyaḥ a sandamānāḥ aṭṭhaṃsu mahā samudde
translated: the birds lost their power of flight, the rivers stood still,🔽the water of the ocean became sweet,

original: madhuraṃ udakaṃ ahosi, upakkilesavimutte sūriye dissamāne eva ākāsagatā sabbā jotiyo
analyzed: madhuram udakam ahosi upakkilesa vimutte sūriye dissamāne eva ākāsa gatā sabbā jotiyo
translated: when the sun appeared, freed from its obscurations, all the lights in the sky

original: jaliṃsu, ṭhapetvā arūpāvacare deve avasesā sabbe devā sabbepi nerayikā dissamānarūpā
analyzed: ṭhapetvā arūpāvacare deve avasesā sabbe devā sabbe api nerayikā dissamāna rūpā
translated: went out, all the gods except those in the immaterial world, and all the denizens of hell,

original: ahesuṃ, tarukuṭṭakavāṭaselādayo anāvaraṇabhūtā ahesuṃ, sattānaṃ cutūpapātā nāhesuṃ,
analyzed: taru kuṭṭa kavāṭa sela ādayaḥ anāvaraṇa bhūtāḥ ahesum sattānam cutūpapātāḥ na ahesum
translated: became visible, the trees, stumps, walls, creepers, etc., became non-obstructing, there was no death or rebirth of beings,

original: sabbaṃ aniṭṭhagandhaṃ abhibhavitvā dibbagandho vāyi, sabbe phalūpagā rukkhā phaladharā
analyzed: sabbam an iṭṭha gandham abhibhavitvā dibba gandhaḥ vāyi sabbe phala upagāḥ rukkhāḥ phala dharāḥ
translated: divine fragrance pervaded, overcoming all unpleasant smells, all fruit-bearing trees became laden with fruit,

original: sampajjiṃsu, mahāsamuddo sabbatthakameva pañcavaṇṇehi padumehi sañchannatalo ahosi,🔽thalajajalajādīni sabbapupphāni pupphiṃsu, rukkhānaṃ khandhesu khandhapadumāni, sākhāsu
analyzed: sampajjiṃsu mahā samuddaḥ sabbatthakam eva pañca vaṇṇehi padumehi sañchanna talaḥ ahosi  thala ja jala ja ādīni sabba pupphāni rukkhānam khandhesu khandha padumāni sākhāsu
translated: the ocean became covered with lotuses of five colours,🔽all the flowers on land and in the water blossomed, on the trunks of the trees, on the branches,🔽on the creepers, there appeared lotus flowers, on the ground, through the rocks,

original: sākhapadumāni, latāsu latāpadumāni pupphiṃsu, mahītale silātalāni bhinditvā uparūpari
analyzed: sākha padumāni latāsu latā padumāni pupphiṃsu mahī tale silā talāni bhinditvā upari upari
translated: upwards and downwards,

original: satta satta hutvā daṇḍapadumāni nāma nikkhamiṃsu, ākāse olambakapadumāni nibbattiṃsu,
analyzed: satta satta hutvā daṇḍapadumāni nāma nikkhamiṃsu ākāse olambaka padumāni nibbattiṃsu
translated: and seven times seven lotus flowers issued forth from the tip of each of his fingers, and lotus flowers hung down from the sky,

original: samantato pupphavassaṃ vassi, ākāse dibbatūriyāni vajjiṃsu, sakaladasasahassī lokadhātu
analyzed: samantataḥ puppha vassam vassi ākāse dibba tūriyāni vajjiṃsu sakala dasa sahassī lokadhātu
translated: and a rain of flowers fell all around, and divine musical instruments sounded in the sky, and the whole of the ten-thousand world system

original: vaṭṭetvā vissaṭṭhamālāguḷaṃ viya uppīḷetvā baddhamālākalāpo viya alaṅkatappaṭiyattaṃ
analyzed: vaṭṭetvā vissaṭṭha mālā guḷam viya uppīḍetvā baddha mālā kalāpaḥ viya alaṅkata paṭiyattam
translated: was as though it were a garland of flowers, as though it were a wreath of flowers, as though it were a decorated and prepared garland seat,

original: mālāsanaṃ viya ca ekamālāmālinī vipphurantavāḷabījanī pupphadhūpagandhaparivāsitā🔽paramasobhaggappattā ahosi, tāni ca pubbanimittāni upari adhigatānaṃ anekesaṃ visesādhigamānaṃ
analyzed: ca eka mālā mālinī puppha dhūpa gandha parivāsitā  parama sobhagga ppattā ahosi tāni ca pubba nimittāni upari adhigatānam anekesam visesa adhigamānam
translated: and a single garland of flowers, with a flickering lamp of oil, perfumed with the scent of flower incense,🔽reached the highest beauty. And those former signs🔽were the signs of the many special attainments that he would later attain.

original: nimittabhūtāni eva ahesuṃ. Evaṃ anekacchariyapātubhāvappaṭimaṇḍitā cāyaṃ abhijāti
analyzed: nimitta bhūtāni eva ahesum evam ca ayam abhijāti
translated: And this noble birth, adorned with the manifestation of many such wonders,

original: yadatthaṃ anena abhisambodhi patthitā, tassā abhisambodhiyā ekantasiddhiyā tathāva🔽ahosi avitathā anaññathā.
analyzed: yadattham anena abhisambodhi patthitā tassāḥ abhisambodhiyāḥ ekanta siddhiyā 🔽ahosi avitathā anaññathā
translated: was just as it was for the sake of which he had made his aspiration for full enlightenment,🔽and it was just so, not otherwise, for the complete success of that full enlightenment.

original: Tathā ye buddhaveneyyā bodhaneyyabandhavā, te sabbepi anavasesato sayameva bhagavatā
analyzed: tathā ye buddha veneyyāḥ bodhaneyya bandhavā te sabbe pi anavasesataḥ sayam eva bhagavatā
translated: Likewise, all those relatives who are to be awakened by the Buddha, without exception, have been trained by the Blessed One himself.

original: vinītā. Ye ca sāvakaveneyyā dhammaveneyyā ca, tepi sāvakādīhi vinītā vinayaṃ gacchanti🔽gamissanti cāti yadatthaṃ bhagavatā abhisambodhi abhipatthitā, tadatthassa ekantasiddhiyā
analyzed: vinītāḥ ye ca sāvaka veneyyā dhamma veneyyā ca te pi sāvaka ādīhi vinītāḥ vinayam gacchanti  gamissanti ca ati yad attham bhagavatā abhisambodhi abhipatthitā tad atthassa ekanta siddhiyā
translated: And those who are to be trained by disciples and those who are to be trained by the Dhamma, they too are being trained, have been trained, and will be trained by disciples and so forth.

original: abhisambodhi tathā avitathā anaññathā.🔽Apica yassa yassa ñeyyadhammassa yo yo sabhāvo bujjhitabbo, so so hatthatale ṭhapitaāmalakaṃ
analyzed: tathā avitathā anaññathā  apica yassa yassa ñeyya dhammassa yaḥ yaḥ sabhāvaḥ bujjhitabbo saḥ saḥ hattha tale ṭhapita āmalakam
translated: Thus, the awakening of the Blessed One is such, not otherwise, not otherwise, for the complete success of the purpose for which the aspiration was made.

original: viya āvajjanamattappaṭibaddhena attano ñāṇena aviparītaṃ anavasesato bhagavatā abhisambuddhoti
analyzed: viya āvajjana matta paṭibaddhena attanaḥ ñāṇena aviparītam anavasesataḥ bhagavatā abhisambuddhā iti
translated: Moreover, whatever is to be known, whatever is to be understood, whatever is to be realized, that has been fully understood, fully realized by the Blessed One with his knowledge free from taints, like an āmalaka fruit in the palm of his hand.

original: evampi abhisambodhi tathā avitathā anaññathā.
analyzed: evampi tathā avitathā anaññathā
translated: Thus too, the awakening of the Blessed One is such, not otherwise, not otherwise.

original: Tathā tesaṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ tathā tathā desetabbappakāraṃ tesaṃ tesañca sattānaṃ
analyzed: tathā tesam tesam dhammānam tathā tathā desetabba ppakāram tesam tesam ca sattānam
translated: Likewise, the Blessed One has fully understood, fully realized the various aspects of the teaching that are to be taught in various ways, and the various inclinations

original: āsayānusayacaritādhimuttiṃ sammadeva oloketvā dhammataṃ avijahanteneva paññattinayavohāramaggaṃ🔽anatidhāvanteneva ca dhammataṃ vibhāvantena yathāparādhaṃ yathājjhāsayaṃ yathādhammañca
analyzed: āsayā anusaya carita adhimuttim sammat eva oloketvā dhamma tam a vijahantena iva paññatti naya vohāra maggaṃ  an atidhāvantena iva ca dhammatam vibhāvantena yathāparādham yathājjhāsayam yathādhammam ca
translated: And the Blessed One, after looking into the dispositions, underlying tendencies, ways of receiving teaching, and inclinations of those to be trained, and after instructing them in the way of expression that is the method of exposition without violating the way things are,🔽and after revealing the way things are without overstepping the way of expression, instructed them in accordance with their faults, inclinations, and the Dhamma,

original: anusāsantena bhagavatā veneyyā vinītā ariyabhūmiṃ sampāpitāti dhammavinayapaññāpanāpissa
analyzed: anusāsantena bhagavatā veneyyā vinītā ariya bhūmim sampāpitā ati dhamma vinaya paññāpanā apissa
translated: and thus trained those to be trained, bringing them to the noble plane. So the proclamation of the Dhamma and Discipline

original: tadatthasiddhiyā yathābhūtavuttiyā ca tathā avitathā anaññathā.
analyzed: tad attha siddhiyā yathā bhūta vuttiyā ca tathā avitathā anaññathā
translated: is not otherwise, not otherwise than as the way to the realization of that state.

original: Tathā yā sā bhagavatā anuppattā pathaviyādiphassavedanādirūpārūpasabhāvavinimuttā🔽lujjanabhāvābhāvato lokasabhāvātītā tamasā visaṃsaṭṭhattā kenaci anobhāsanīyā lokasabhāvābhāvato🔽eva gatiādibhāvarahitā appatiṭṭhā anārammaṇā amatamahānibbānadhātu khandhasaṅkhātānaṃ
analyzed: tathā yā sā bhagavatā anuppattā pathaviya ādi phassa vedanā ādi rūpa arūpa sa bhāva vinimuttā  lujjana bhāva abhāvataḥ loka sabhāva atītā tamasā kenaci anobhāsanīyā loka sabhāva abhāvataḥ  eva gati ādi bhāva rahitā appatiṭṭhā anārammaṇā amata mahānibbānadhātu khandha saṅkhātānam
translated: And that state is the unformed element, which the Blessed One attained, and which is free from the nature of the earth kasiṇa, etc., and of the feelings, perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness born of contact with the earth kasiṇa, etc.,

original: upādīnaṃ lesamattassapi abhāvato anupādisesāti vuccati, yaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ –
analyzed: upa ādīnam lesa mattassa api abhāvataḥ anupādisesā ti vuccati yam sandhāya vuttam
translated: and which is beyond the nature of the world in the sense of being not subject to abrasion, and which is beyond the nature of the world in the sense of being dissociated from darkness, and which is beyond the nature of the world in the sense of being not subject to the vicissitudes of the world, such as rebirth-linking, and which is the element of the deathless, the supreme security from bondage, the supreme refuge, the supreme haven, the supreme island, the supreme kinsman, the supreme friend, the supreme goal, the supreme support, the supreme meeting-place, the supreme heir, the supreme treasure, the supreme bed, the supreme prosperity, the supreme glory, the supreme bliss, the supreme peace, the supreme sublime state, the supreme nibbāna-element, which is called “without trace left behind” because there is not even a trace left of the aggregates.

original: “Atthi, bhikkhave, tadāyatanaṃ, yattha neva pathavī na āpo na tejo na vāyo na ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ
analyzed: atthi bhikkhave tat āyatanam yattha na iva pathavī na āpaḥ na tejaḥ na vāyo na ākāsānam ca āyatanam
translated: “There is, monks, that sphere where there is neither earth, nor water, nor fire, nor air;

original: na viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ na ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ nāyaṃ loko na
analyzed: na viññāṇañcāyatanam na ākiñcaññāyatanam na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam na ayam lokaḥ na
translated: nor the sphere of infinite space, nor the sphere of infinite consciousness, nor the sphere of nothingness, nor the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception;🔽not this world, nor the next world, nor sun, nor moon.

original: paro loko na ca ubho candimasūriyā, tatrāpāhaṃ, bhikkhave, neva āgatiṃ vadāmi na
analyzed: paraḥ lokaḥ na ca ubho candima sūriyā tatra apa aham bhikkhave na iva āgatim vadāmi na
translated: And there, monks, I say there is neither coming, nor going, nor staying;

original: gatiṃ na ṭhitiṃ na cutiṃ na upapattiṃ, appatiṭṭhaṃ appavattaṃ anārammaṇamevetaṃ,
analyzed: gatim na ṭhitim na cutim na upapattim appatiṭṭham appavattam anārammaṇam eva etam
translated: neither passing away nor arising: it is without a basis, it has no dependence, it is without support.

original: esevanto dukkhassā”ti.
analyzed: esevantaḥ dukkhassa ati
translated: This, just this, is the end of stress.”

original: Sā sabbesampi upādānakkhandhānaṃ atthaṅgamo, sabbasaṅkhārānaṃ samatho, sabbūpadhīnaṃ
analyzed: sā sabbesam pi upādānakkhandhānam atthaṅgamaḥ sabba saṅkhārānam samathaḥ sabba upadhīnam
translated: This is the destruction of all the constituents subject to clinging, the stilling of all formations, the relinquishing of all acquisitions,

original: paṭinissaggo, sabbadukkhānaṃ vūpasamo, sabbālayānaṃ samugghāto, sabbavaṭṭānaṃ upacchedo,
analyzed: paṭinissaggaḥ sabba dukkhānam vūpasamaḥ sabba ālayānam samugghātaḥ sabba vaṭṭānam upacchedaḥ
translated: the dissolution of all craving, the uprooting of all attachment, the exhaustion of all suffering, the realization of all Nibbana.

original: accantasantilakkhaṇoti yathāvuttasabhāvassa kadācipi avisaṃvādanato tathā avitathā
analyzed: accanta santi lakkhaṇo ti yathā vutta sabhāvassa kadācipi avisaṃvādanato tathā avitathā
translated: It is the characteristic of ultimate peace, because it is never deceptive as to its true nature.

original: anaññathā. Evametā abhijātiādikā tathā gato upagato adhigato paṭipanno pattoti tathāgato.
analyzed: anaññathā evam etāḥ abhijāti ādikā tathā gataḥ upagataḥ adhigataḥ paṭipannaḥ patto ti tathāgataḥ
translated: and not otherwise. Thus he is the Tathāgata because he has gone to the very depths of these kinds of knowledge, etc., and he has reached them, he has trodden the path to them, he has attained them.

original: Evaṃ bhagavā tathā gatoti tathāgato.
analyzed: evam bhagavā tathā gataḥ iti tathāgataḥ
translated: This is how the Blessed One is the Tathāgata because he has gone in this way.

original: Kathaṃ tathāvidhoti tathāgato? Yathāvidhā purimakā sammāsambuddhā, ayampi bhagavā
analyzed: katham tathāvidhā uti tathāgataḥ yathāvidhā purimakā sammāsambuddhā ayam pi bhagavā
translated: How is he the Tathāgata because he has become such? He has become such as were the Enlightened Ones of the past.

original: tathāvidho. Kiṃ vuttaṃ hoti? Yathāvidhā te bhagavanto maggasīlena phalasīlena sabbenapi
analyzed: tathāvidhaḥ kim vuttam hoti yathāvidhā te bhagavantaḥ magga sīlena phala sīlena sabbena api
translated: What is meant? He has become such as they were in virtue of virtue, in concentration, in understanding, in deliverance, and in knowledge and vision of deliverance, in the virtue of the path, in the virtue of the fruition, in all the kinds of virtue,

original: lokiyalokuttarasīlena, maggasamādhinā phalasamādhinā sabbenapi lokiyalokuttarasamādhinā,
analyzed: lokiya lokuttara sīlena magga samādhinā phala samādhinā sabbena api lokiya lokuttara samādhinā
translated: in the concentration of the path, in the concentration of the fruition, in all the kinds of concentration,

original: maggapaññāya phalapaññāya sabbāyapi lokiyalokuttarapaññāya, devasikaṃ valañjitabbehi
analyzed: magga paññāya phala paññāya sabbāya api lokiya lokuttara paññāya devasikam
translated: in the understanding of the path, in the understanding of the fruition, in all the kinds of understanding, in the four jhānas, etc., which are to be entered upon and dwelt in by day and by night,

original: catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasamāpattivihārehi, tadaṅgavimuttiyā, vikkhambhanavimuttiyā,
analyzed: catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa samāpatti vihārehi tad aṅga vimuttiyā vikkhambhana vimuttiyā
translated: in the twenty-four kinds of triple-knowledge attainment, in the deliverance by the way of the faculties, in the deliverance by the way of the powers,

original: samucchedavimuttiyā, paṭippassaddhivimuttiyā, nissaraṇavimuttiyāti saṅkhepato. Vitthārato
analyzed: samuccheda vimuttiyā paṭippassaddhi vimuttiyā nissaraṇa vimuttiyā ati saṅkhepataḥ vitthārataḥ
translated: in the deliverance by the way of the enlightenment factors, in the deliverance by the way of the path, in brief, and in detail,

original: pana anantāparimāṇabhedehi acinteyyānubhāvehi sakalasabbaññuguṇehi, ayampi amhākaṃ🔽bhagavā tathāvidho. Sabbesañhi sammāsambuddhānaṃ āyuvemattaṃ, sarīrappamāṇavemattaṃ,
analyzed: pana ananta aparimāṇa bhedehi acinteyya anubhāvehi sakala sabbaññu guṇehi ayam pi amhākam  bhagavā tathāvidhaḥ sabbesam hi sammāsambuddhānam āyu vemattam sarīra ppamāṇa vemattam
translated: but with infinite, immeasurable, inconceivable powers, with all the special qualities of a Buddha,🔽our Blessed One is also like that. For all the Fully Enlightened Ones are equal in five ways: in the matter of their life-span, their bodily size, their ethical quality, their meditational power, and their wisdom.

analyzed: mahiddhika tā ati paramena cittavasībhāvena ca iddhividha yogena  mahatiyā iddhiyā samannāgamaḥ mahiddhika tā cira kāla sambhūtena su vidūra paṭipakkhena  icchitattha nipphatti hetu bhūtena mahā jutikena puñña tejena samannāgamaḥ mahā anubhāva tā
translated: “Greatly powerful” means being endowed with great power, which is the ability to produce the manifestation of the supernormal power of the Dhamma through the highest mastery of the mind and through the supernormal power of psychic potency.🔽“Greatly influential” means being endowed with great influence, which is the great radiance of merit that is the cause for the accomplishment of the desired goal through the practice of the path for a long time and through the practice of the path that is far removed from the defilements.

original: Yatrāti acchariyapasaṃsākotuhalahāsapasādiko paccattatthe nipāto. Tena yuttattā vijāyissatīti
analyzed: yatra ati paccatta atthe nipāto tena yutta ttā vijāyissati iti
translated: “Where” is a particle in the sense of independence, beginning with the wonder of the praise of the marvelous. Because of being connected with that, it will be born.

original: anāgatakālavacanaṃ, attho pana atītakāloyeva. Ayañhettha attho – yā hi nāma ayaṃ
analyzed: anāgata kāla vacanam pana atīta kālaḥ yā iva ayam ha ittha atthaḥ yā hi nāma ayam
translated: The statement in the future time, but the meaning is only in the past time. This is the meaning here – whatever this🔽Suppavāsā, who was thus immersed in suffering, who had difficulty in obtaining, immediately after the Blessed One’s words, was happy, healthy,

original: suppavāsā tathā dukkhanimuggā kicchāpannā bhagavato vacanasamakālameva sukhinī arogā
analyzed: suppavāsā tathā dukkha nimuggā kiccha āpannā bhagavataḥ vacana sama kālam eva sukhinī arogā
translated: and

original: arogaṃ puttaṃ vijāyīti. Attamanoti sakamano, bhagavati pasādena kilesarahitacittoti
analyzed: arogam puttam vijāyī iti atta mano ti sa ka mano bhagavati pasādena kilesa rahita cittaḥ ti
translated: She gave birth to a healthy son. Delighted: with a delighted mind, with a mind free from defilements through confidence in the Blessed One.

original: attho. Kilesapariyuṭṭhitañhi cittaṃ vase avattanato attamanoti na sakkā vattunti.
analyzed: attho kilesa pariyuṭṭhitam hi cittam vase avattanataḥ atta manaḥ ti na sakkā vattunti
translated: For a mind defiled by defilements cannot be called delighted because it does not submit to control.

original: Attamanoti vā pītisomanassehi gahitamano. Pamuditoti pāmojjena yutto. Pītisomanassajātoti
analyzed: atta mano ti vā pīti somanassehi gahita mano pamuditoti pāmojjena yutto pīti somanassa jāto ti
translated: Or else, delighted means his mind was seized by joy and gladness. He rejoiced: he was endowed with joy. He was filled with joy and gladness:

original: jātabalavapītisomanasso. Athāti pacchā, tato katipāhassa accayena. Sattabhattānīti🔽sattasu divasesu dātabbabhattāni. Svātanāyāti svātanapuññatthaṃ, yaṃ sve buddhappamukhassa
analyzed: jāta balava pīti somanassaḥ atha ati pacchā tatas katipāhassa accayena satta bhattāni iti  sattasu divasesu dātabba bhattāni svātanāya ati svātana puññattham yam sve buddha ppamukhassa
translated: he had arisen joy and gladness that were strong. Then: afterwards, after a few days. For seven days:

original: saṅghassa dānavasena payirupāsanavasena ca bhavissati puññaṃ tadatthaṃ.🔽Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ āmantesīti kasmā āmantesi? Suppavāsāya
analyzed: saṅghassa dāna vasena payirupāsana vasena ca bhavissati puññam tad attham  atha khalu bhagavā āyasmantam mahāmoggallānam āmantesi iti kasmai āmantesi su pavāsāya
translated: for the seven days’ meals. For the sake of the merit: for the sake of the merit that would be his by giving alms to the Community headed by the Buddha and by paying homage to it.🔽Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Maha Moggallana. Why did he address him? In order to protect the lay follower’s confidence.

original: sāmikassa pasādarakkhaṇatthaṃ. Suppavāsā pana acalappasādāva, upāsakassa pana pasādarakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: sāmikassa pasāda rakkhaṇa attham suppavāsā pana upāsakassa pana pasāda rakkhaṇam
translated: But Suppavāsa was unshakably confident, and it was in order to protect the lay follower’s confidence that the Blessed One addressed the venerable Maha Moggallana.

original: mahāmoggallānattherassa bhāro. Tenāha “tuyheso upaṭṭhāko”ti. Tattha tuyhesoti tuyhaṃ
analyzed: mahāmoggallāna ttherassa bhāro tena āha upaṭṭhāko ti tattha tuyha isoti tuyham
translated: Herein, he is your supporter means: he is your supporter.

original: eso. Tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ pāṭibhogoti mama bhogādīnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ dhammānaṃ ahāniyā avināsāya
analyzed: eso tiṇṇam dhammānam pāṭibhogaḥ ti mama bhoga ādīnam tiṇṇam dhammānam ahāniyāḥ avināsāya
translated: For three things, friend, I have a supporter means: for three things, namely, my wealth, etc., I have a supporter who will not let them be lost or destroyed.

original: ayyo mahāmoggallāno yadi pāṭibhogo yadi patibhū, ito satta divase atikkamitvā mama
analyzed: ayyaḥ mahāmoggallānaḥ yadi pāṭibhogaḥ yadi patibhū ito satta divase atikkamitvā mama
translated: If the venerable Moggallāna is my supporter, if he is my helper, then after seven days have passed

original: sakkā dānaṃ dātunti yadi ayyena ñātanti dīpeti. Theropi tassa tesu divasesu bhogānaṃ
analyzed: sakkā dānam dātunti yadi ayyena ñātanti dīpeti theraḥ api tassa tesu divasesu
translated: I will be able to give the gift. If the venerable one knows, he will show me.” The Elder saw that during those days there would be no harm to his wealth

original: jīvitassa ca anupaddavaṃ passitvā āha – “dvinnaṃ kho nesaṃ, āvuso, dhammānaṃ pāṭibhogo
analyzed: jīvitassa ca anupaddavam passitvā āha dvinnam kho nesam āvuso dhammānam pāṭibhogaḥ
translated: and to his life, and so he said: “For two things, friend, I have a supporter,

original: bhogānañca jīvitassa cā”ti. Saddhā panassa cittappaṭibaddhāti tasseva bhāraṃ karonto
analyzed: bhogānam ca jīvitassa ca ati saddhā panassa citta paṭibaddhā ati tassa iva bhāram karontaḥ
translated: for wealth and for life.” But his faith was bound up with his mind. Therefore, making his burden his own,

original: “saddhāya pana tvaññeva pāṭibhogo”ti āha. Api ca so upāsako diṭṭhasacco, tassa saddhāya
analyzed: saddhāya pana tu aññā eva pāṭibhogaḥ ti āha api ca so upāsakaḥ diṭṭhasacco tassa saddhāya
translated: he said: “But for faith you are your own supporter.” Moreover, that lay follower was one who had seen the Truths. For him there was no change in his faith.

original: aññathābhāvo natthīti tathā vuttaṃ. Teneva ca kāraṇena bhagavatā “pacchāpi tvaṃ karissasīti
analyzed: aññathābhāvaḥ natthi iti tathā vuttam tena iva ca kāraṇena bhagavatā pacchā api tvam karissasi iti
translated: Therefore it was said thus. And for this very reason the Blessed One said: “Afterwards you will do it.”

original: saññāpehī”ti vuttaṃ. Upāsakopi satthari there ca gāravena subbacatāya tassā ca puññena
analyzed: saññāpehi iti vuttam upāsakaḥ api satthari there ca gāravena subbaca tāya tassā ca puññena
translated: and he said, “Announce it.” The lay devotee, out of respect for the Teacher and the elders and wishing for the prosperity of Suppavāsā through her merit,

original: vaḍḍhiṃ icchanto “karotu suppavāsā koliyadhītā satta bhattāni, pacchāhaṃ karissāmī”ti anujāni.
analyzed: vaḍḍhim icchantaḥ karotu suppavāsā koliya dhītā satta bhattāni pacchā aham karissāmi iti anujāni
translated: said, “Let Suppavāsā give seven meals. Afterwards I will give.”

original: Tañca dārakanti vijātadivasato paṭṭhāya ekādasamaṃ divasaṃ atikkamitvā tato paraṃ
analyzed: tat ca vijāta divasataḥ paṭṭhāya ekādasamam divasam atikkamitvā tatas param
translated: And the child: after exceeding eleven days from the day of his birth,

original: sattāhaṃ buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ bhojetvā sattame divase taṃ sattavassikaṃ
analyzed: sattāham buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham bhojetvā sattame divase tam satta vassikam
translated: after feeding the Community of monks with the Buddha at its head for seven days, on the seventh day he had the seven-year-old child

original: dārakaṃ bhagavantaṃ bhikkhusaṅghañca vandāpesi. Satta me vassānīti satta me saṃvaccharāni,🔽accantasaṃyogavasena cetaṃ upayogavacanaṃ. Lohitakumbhiyaṃ vutthānīti mātukucchiyaṃ🔽attano gabbhavāsadukkhaṃ sandhāya vadati. Aññānipi evarūpāni satta puttānīti “aññepi
analyzed: dārakam bhagavantam bhikkhu saṅghañca vandāpesi satta me vassāni iti satta me saṃvaccharāni  a c c anta saṃyoga vasena upayoga vacanam lohitakumbhiyam vutthāni iti mātukucchiyam  attanaḥ gabbha vāsa dukkham sandhāya vadati aññāni pi evarūpāni satta puttāni iti aññe pi
translated: pay homage to the Buddha and the Community of monks. Seven years I lived: this is a statement of the use of the word “seven” in the sense of a maximum period,

original: evarūpe satta putte”ti vattabbe liṅgavipallāsavasena vuttaṃ “evarūpānī”ti. Evaṃ satta
analyzed: evarūpe satta puttā iti vattabbe liṅga vipallāsa vasena vuttam evarūpāni iti evam satta
translated: and it is said with reference to the suffering of his own stay in the womb. Other such children: “Other such seven children” should be said, but it is said with a reversal of the gender, “such children.” Thus,

original: vassāni gabbhadhāraṇavasena sattāhaṃ mūḷhagabbhatāya ca mahantaṃ dukkhaṃ pāpetvā
analyzed: vassāni gabbha dhāraṇa vasena satta aham mūḷha gabbha tāya ca mahantam dukkham pāpetvā
translated: and after making her suffer great suffering for seven days through being confused about the child in her womb and for seven days through bearing the child in her womb,

original: uppajjanakaputteti attho. Etena mātugāmānaṃ puttalolatāya puttalābhena titti natthīti dasseti.
analyzed: uppajjanaka putta iti attho etena mātu gāmānam putta lolatāya putta lābhena titti natthi iti dasseti
translated: the meaning is, she gave birth to a child. By this he shows that there is no satisfaction for women in the acquisition of a child through their craving for a child.

original: Etamatthaṃ viditvāti etaṃ sattadivasādhikāni satta saṃvaccharāni gabbhadhāraṇādivasena
analyzed: etam attham viditvā iti etam satta divasa adhikāni satta saṃvaccharāni gabbha dhāraṇā divasena
translated: Having understood the meaning of this: having understood the meaning stated by her through her craving for a child, which occurred through bearing the child in her womb for more than seven years,

original: pavattaṃ mahantaṃ dukkhaṃ ekapade visaritvā puttalolatāvasena tāya vuttamatthaṃ viditvā.🔽Imaṃ udānanti imaṃ cittasukhappamatto viya pamattapuggale iṭṭhākārena vañcetvā taṇhāsinehassa
analyzed: pavattam mahantam dukkham eka pade visaritvā putta lola tā vasena tāya vuttam attham viditvā  imam udānan ti imam citta sukha ppamattaḥ viya pamatta puggale iṭṭha ākārena vañcetvā taṇhā sinehassa
translated: having spread it out in a single moment,

original: mahānatthakarabhāvadīpakaṃ udānaṃ udānesi.🔽Tattha asātanti amadhuraṃ asundaraṃ aniṭṭhaṃ. Sātarūpenāti iṭṭhasabhāvena. Piyarūpenāti
analyzed: mahānatthakara bhāva dīpakam udānam udānesi  tattha asātam ti amadhuram asundaram aniṭṭham sāta rūpena ati iṭṭha sabhāvena piya rūpena ati
translated: this exclamation: this exclamation, which reveals the great harmfulness of the affection of craving, as if he were heedless through being intoxicated with mental pleasure, he exclaimed.

original: piyāyitabbabhāvena. Sukhassa rūpenāti sukhasabhāvena. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yasmā asātaṃ
analyzed: piyāyitabba bhāvena sukhassa rūpena ati sukha sabhāvena idam vuttam hoti yasmai asātam
translated: Herein, unsweet means unpalatable, unpleasant, unlovely. By the appearance of sweetness: by the nature of what is lovely. By the appearance of what is dear: by the nature of what is to be loved. By the appearance of pleasure: by the nature of pleasure. This is the meaning: because what is unsweet is not lovely, not dear, not pleasant,

original: appiyaṃ dukkhameva samānaṃ sakalampi vaṭṭagataṃ saṅkhārajātaṃ appahīnavipallāsattā
analyzed: appiyam dukkham eva samānam sakalam pi vaṭṭa gatam saṅkhāra jātam appahīna vipallāsa ttā
translated: and all that is included in the round of rebirths, which is simply suffering, is not given up as long as the perversions are not abandoned.

original: ayonisomanasikārena iṭṭhaṃ viya piyaṃ viya sukhaṃ viya ca hutvā upaṭṭhahamānaṃ sativippavāsena
analyzed: a yoniso manasikārena iṭṭham viya piyam viya sukham viya ca hutvā upaṭṭhahamānam sati vippavāsena
translated: and all that is included in the round of rebirths, which is unloved and only suffering, appears to him through the perversion of perception as though it were loved, as though it were unloved, as though it were suffering, as though it were pleasure.

original: pamattapuggalaṃ ativattati abhibhavati ajjhottharati, tasmā imampi suppavāsaṃ punapi
analyzed: pamatta puggalam ativattati abhibhavati ajjhottharati tasmai imam pi suppavāsam puna api
translated: And when he is negligent, it overpowers him, overwhelms him, and submerges him, just as the ocean does a feeble man who gets into water beyond his depth.

original: sattakkhattuṃ evarūpaṃ asātaṃ appiyaṃ dukkhaṃ sātādipatirūpakena dukkhena puttasaṅkhātapemavatthusukhena ajjhottharatīti.
analyzed: sattakkhattum evarūpam asātam appiyam dukkham sāta ādi patirūpakena dukkhena putta saṅkhāta pema vatthu sukhena ajjhottharati iti
translated: So this “good submersion” submerges him again and again in the same unloved, unwanted, unpleasant suffering, which appears as though it were loved, etc., like the pleasure of a son, which is a basis for suffering.

original: Aṭṭhamasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: aṭṭhama sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The eighth sutta is finished.

original: 9. Visākhāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: visākhā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Visākhā Sutta

original: 19. Navame pubbārāmeti sāvatthiyā pācīnadisābhāge anurādhapurassa uttamadevīvihārasadise ṭhāne kārite ārāme. Migāramātupāsādeti migāramātuyā pāsāde.
analyzed: navame pubbārāme iti sāvatthiyā pācīna disā bhāge anurādha purassa uttama devī vihāra sadise ṭhāne kārite ārāme migāra mātu pāsāde iti migāra mātuyā pāsāde
translated: In the ninth sutta, the Eastern Monastery is a monastery built in a place in the eastern direction from Sāvatthī, like the Uttamadevī Monastery in Anurādhapura. The Migāra House is the Migāra Mother’s House.

original: Tatrāyaṃ anupubbikathā – atīte satasahassakappamatthake padumuttaradasabalaṃ ekā
analyzed: tatra ayam anupubbi kathā atīte sata sahassa kappa matthake padumuttara dasa balam ekā
translated: Here is the story of how it came about. In the past, a hundred thousand aeons ago, there appeared a Buddha called Padumuttara, a Leader of the World.

original: upāsikā aññataraṃ upāsikaṃ attano aggupaṭṭhāyikaṭṭhāne ṭhapentaṃ disvā bhagavantaṃ🔽nimantetvā buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusatasahassassa dānaṃ datvā bhagavato nipaccakāraṃ
analyzed: upāsikā aññataram upāsikam attanaḥ aggupaṭṭhāyika ṭṭhāne ṭhapentam disvā bhagavantam  nimantetvā buddha ppamukhassa bhikkhu sata sahassassa dānam datvā bhagavataḥ nipaccakāram
translated: The laywoman, seeing another laywoman making her the chief supporter of the Buddha, invited the Buddha,

original: katvā “anāgate tumhādisassa buddhassa aggupaṭṭhāyikā bhaveyya”nti patthanaṃ akāsi.
analyzed: katvā anāgate tumhādisassa buddhassa agga upaṭṭhāyikā bhaveyyanti patthanam akāsi
translated: and after giving a gift to a hundred thousand monks headed by the Buddha, and after making a respectful offering to the Buddha, made a wish, “May I be the chief supporter of a Buddha like you in the future.”

original: Sā kappasatasahassaṃ devesu ca manussesu ca saṃsaritvā amhākaṃ bhagavato kāle bhaddiyanagare
analyzed: sā kappa sata sahassam devesu ca manussesu ca saṃsaritvā amhākam bhagavataḥ kāle bhaddiya nagare
translated: She transmigrated through the god and human worlds for a hundred thousand eons, and in the time of our Lord Buddha,

original: meṇḍakaseṭṭhiputtassa dhanañjayaseṭṭhino gehe sumanadeviyā kucchismiṃ paṭisandhiṃ
analyzed: meṇḍaka seṭṭhi puttassa dhanañjaya seṭṭhino gehe sumanadeviyā kucchismim paṭisandhim
translated: she was conceived in the womb of Queen Sumana, the wife of the merchant Dhananjaya, the chief merchant of the city of Bhaddiya.

original: gaṇhi. Jātakāle cassā visākhāti nāmaṃ akaṃsu. Sā yadā bhagavā bhaddiyanagaraṃ agamāsi,
analyzed: jāta kāle cassā visākhā ati nāmam sā yadā bhagavā bhaddiya nagaram agamāsi
translated: At the time of her birth they gave her the name Visākhā. When the Lord Buddha came to the city of Bhaddiya,

original: tadā pañcahi dārikāsatehi saddhiṃ bhagavato paccuggamanaṃ katvā paṭhamadassaneneva sotāpannā ahosi.
analyzed: tadā pañcahi dārikā satehi saddhim bhagavato paccuggamanam katvā paṭhama dassanena iva sotāpannā ahosi
translated: she went out to meet the Buddha with five hundred girls, and by the first sight of the Buddha she became a stream-enterer.

original: Aparabhāge sāvatthiyaṃ migāraseṭṭhiputtassa puṇṇavaḍḍhanakumārassa gehaṃ gatā, tattha
analyzed: aparabhāge sāvatthiyam migāraseṭṭhi puttassa puṇṇavaḍḍhana kumārassa geham gatā tattha
translated: Later she went to the house of the young man Puṇṇavaḍḍhana, the son of the chief merchant of Sāvatthī, and there

original: naṃ sasuro migāraseṭṭhi upakāravasena mātuṭṭhāne ṭhapesi. Tasmā migāramātāti vuccati.
analyzed: nam sasuraḥ migāraseṭṭhi upakāra vasena mātuṭṭhāne ṭhapesi tasmā migāra mātā iti vuccati
translated: Her father-in-law, Migara, the chief merchant, treated her as a mother, out of gratitude. Therefore she is called Migara’s mother.

original: Sā attano mahallatāpasādhanaṃ vissajjetvā navakoṭīhi bhagavato bhikkhusaṅghassa ca
analyzed: sā attanaḥ mahalla tāpasa adhanam vissajjetvā nava koṭīhi bhagavataḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa ca
translated: She gave up her own private wealth and with nine crores of treasure she had a mansion built on a piece of land the size of a karisa,

original: vasanatthāya karīsamatte bhūmibhāge uparibhūmiyaṃ pañcagabbhasatāni heṭṭhābhūmiyaṃ
analyzed: vasana atthāya karīsa matte bhūmi bhāge upari bhūmiyam pañca gabbha satāni heṭṭhā bhūmiyam
translated: on the upper floor with five hundred rooms and on the lower floor with five hundred rooms,

original: pañcagabbhasatānīti gabbhasahassehi paṭimaṇḍitaṃ pāsādaṃ kāresi. Tena vuttaṃ “migāramātupāsāde”ti.
analyzed: pañca gabbha satāni iti gabbha sahassehi paṭimaṇḍitam pāsādam kāresi tena vuttam migāra mātu pāsāde ti
translated: thus adorned with a thousand rooms. Therefore it is said, “in Migara’s mother’s mansion.”

original: Kocideva atthoti kiñcideva payojanaṃ. Raññeti rājini. Paṭibaddhoti āyatto. Visākhāya
analyzed: kocid eva attho ti kiñcid eva payojanam raññā iti rājini paṭibaddhaḥ ti āyattaḥ visākhāya
translated: Some purpose: some reason. To the king: to the queen. Attached: connected. Visakha

original: ñātikulato maṇimuttādiracitaṃ tādisaṃ bhaṇḍajātaṃ tassā paṇṇākāratthāya pesitaṃ,🔽taṃ nagaradvārappattaṃ suṅkikā tattha suṅkaṃ gaṇhantā tadanurūpaṃ aggahetvā atirekaṃ
analyzed: ñāti kulataḥ maṇi mutta ādi racitam tādisam bhaṇḍa jātam tassā paṇṇa ākāra atthāya pesitam  tam nagara dvāra ppattam suṅkikā tattha suṅkam gaṇhantā tad anurūpam aggahetvā atirekam
translated: sent such goods as gems, pearls, etc., from her relatives’ homes as a present for her,🔽and when they reached the city gate the porters, taking a toll there, took more than the proper amount.

original: gaṇhiṃsu. Taṃ sutvā visākhā rañño tamatthaṃ nivedetukāmā patirūpaparivārena rājanivesanaṃ
analyzed: gaṇhiṃsu tam sutvā visākhā rañño tam attham nivedetu kāmā pati rūpa parivārena rāja nivesanam
translated: Hearing that, Visakha, wishing to inform the king of the matter, with a suitable retinue went to the king’s palace

original: agamāsi, tasmiṃ khaṇe rājā mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ antepuraṃ gato hoti. Visākhā
analyzed: tasmin khaṇe rājā mallikāya deviyā saddhim antepuram gataḥ hoti visākhā
translated: She went, but at that moment the king had gone to the inner palace with Queen Mallikā. Visākhā

original: okāsaṃ alabhamānā “idāni labhissāmi, idāni labhissāmī”ti bhojanavelaṃ atikkamitvā

translated: These bhikkhus were worldlings. Not knowing that the Elder’s utterance of joy referred to the happiness of seclusion, they thought thus. Therefore it is said: “They thought: ‘No doubt this one …’” Herein, no doubt means without doubt, with certainty.

original: vacanasesena keci atthaṃ vaṇṇenti, apare “yaṃ sā”ti paṭhanti, “yaṃsa pubbe agāriyabhūtassā”ti
