original: Yasmā agārassa hitaṃ kasivāṇijjādikammaṃ agāriyanti vuccati, tañca pabbajjāya natthi,🔽tasmā pabbajjā anagāriyā nāma. Taṃ anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ pabbajeyyaṃ upagaccheyyaṃ,
analyzed: yasmai agārassa hitam kasi vāṇijja ādi kammaṃ agāriyanti vuccati tat ca pabbajjāya natthi  tasmai pabbajjā anagāriyā nāma tam anagāriyam pabbajjam pabbajeyyam upagaccheyyam
translated: Since the work of agriculture, trade, etc., which is beneficial to the household life is called “the household life,” and since that is not found in the going forth,

original: paṭipajjeyyanti attho.🔽Evaṃ attanā rahovitakkitaṃ soṇo upāsako therassa ārocetvā taṃ paṭipajjitukāmo “pabbājetu
analyzed: paṭipajjeyyanti attho  evam attanā rahaḥ vitakkitam soṇaḥ upāsakaḥ therassa ārocetvā tam paṭipajjitu kāmaḥ pabbājetu
translated: therefore the going forth is called “the houseless life.” He should go forth into that houseless life, he should undertake it, he should practice it—this is the meaning.🔽Having thus expressed his private thought, the lay devotee Soṇa said to the elder, “Venerable sir, let the venerable Mahā Kaccāna give me the going forth.”

original: maṃ, bhante, ayyo mahākaccāno”ti āha. Thero pana “tāvassa ñāṇaparipākaṃ katha”nti
analyzed: mam bhante ayyaḥ mahākaccāno ti āha theraḥ pana tāva assa ñāṇa paripākam kathanti
translated: But the elder thought, “How far has his knowledge progressed?”

original: upadhāretvā ñāṇaparipākaṃ āgamayamāno “dukkaraṃ kho”tiādinā pabbajjāchandaṃ nivāresi.🔽Tattha ekabhattanti “ekabhattiko hoti rattūparato virato vikālabhojanā”ti evaṃ vuttaṃ
analyzed: upadhāretvā ñāṇa paripākam āgamayamānaḥ dukkaram kho ti ādinā pabbajjā chandam nivāresi  tattha eka bhattam ti ekabhattikaḥ hoti rattu uparataḥ virataḥ vikāla bhojanā ti evam vuttam
translated: and he reflected. When he saw that his knowledge had progressed as far as it should, he said, “It is difficult, Soṇa,” etc., in order to dissuade him from the going forth.🔽Herein, “one meal a day” is said with reference to the avoidance of eating at improper times, which is included in the virtue of observing the code of rules .

original: vikālabhojanaviratiṃ sandhāya vadati. Ekaseyyanti adutiyaseyyaṃ. Ettha ca seyyāsīsena
analyzed: vikāla bhojana viratim sandhāya vadati ekaseyyanti adutiyaseyyam ettha ca seyyā sīsena
translated: “Sleeping in a secluded place” is sleeping alone. Herein,

original: “eko tiṭṭhati, eko gacchati, eko nisīdatī”tiādinā nayena vuttesu catūsu iriyāpathesu
analyzed: ekaḥ tiṭṭhati ekaḥ gacchati ekaḥ nisīdati itiādinā nayena vuttesu catūsu iriyāpathesu
translated: “One stands, one goes, one sits down” ,

original: kāyavivekaṃ dīpeti, na ekākinā hutvā sayanamattaṃ. Brahmacariyanti methunaviratibrahmacariyaṃ,
analyzed: kāya vivekam dīpeti na ekākinā hutvā sayana mattam methuna virati brahmacariyam
translated: he shows bodily seclusion, not just lying down alone. The life of celibacy : the celibate life of refraining from sexual intercourse,

original: sikkhattayānuyogasaṅkhātaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ vā. Iṅghāti codanatthe nipāto. Tatthevāti
analyzed: sikkhattayā anuyoga saṅkhātam sāsana brahmacariyam vā iṅghā iti codana atthe nipāto tattha iva ati
translated: or the life of the Dispensation consisting in the practice of the three trainings. Come : the word “come” is a summons. There itself :

original: geheyeva. Buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ anuyuñjāti niccasīlauposathasīlādibhedaṃ pañcaṅgaaṭṭhaṅgadasaṅgasīlaṃ,🔽tadanurūpañca samādhipaññābhāvanaṃ anuyuñja. Etañhi upāsakena pubbabhāge anuyuñjitabbaṃ
analyzed: geheyā iva buddhānam sāsanam anuyuñjāti nicca sīla auposatha sīla ādi bhedam pañcaṅga aṭṭhaṅga dasaṅga sīlam  tad anurūpam ca samādhi paññā bhāvanam anuyuñje etat hi upāsakena pubba bhāge anuyuñjitabbam
translated: in the house itself. He should devote himself to the Dispensation of the Buddhas : he should devote himself to the five-factored, eight-factored, and ten-factored virtue consisting in the constant observance of the uposatha precepts, etc.,🔽and to the development of concentration and understanding that is in conformity with that. For this is what is called “the Dispensation of the Buddhas” that should be devoted to by the lay follower in the initial stage.

original: buddhasāsanaṃ nāma. Tenāha – “kālayuttaṃ ekabhattaṃ ekaseyyaṃ brahmariya”nti.
analyzed: buddha sāsanam nāma tena āha kāla yuttam eka bhattam eka seyyam brahmariyanti
translated: Hence it is said: “The time is right for a meal, for a bed, for celibacy, for the life of a celibate.”

original: Tattha kālayuttanti cātuddasīpañcadasīaṭṭhamīpāṭihāriyapakkhasaṅkhātena kālena yuttaṃ,
analyzed: tattha kāla yuttam ti cātuddasī pañcadasī aṭṭhamī pāṭihāriya pakkha saṅkhātena kālena yuttam
translated: Herein, the time is right for a meal at the time called “fourteenth,” “fifteenth,” “eighth,” “day of the lunar penalty,” etc.;

original: yathāvuttakāle vā tuyhaṃ anuyuñjantassa yuttaṃ patirūpaṃ sakkuṇeyyaṃ, na sabbakālaṃ
analyzed: yathā vutta kāle vā anuyuñjantassa yuttam patirūpam sakkuṇeyyam na sabbakālam
translated: Or else, if you ask me at the time mentioned, I shall be able to do what is proper and fitting for you, not at all times.

original: pabbajjāti adhippāyo. Sabbametaṃ ñāṇassa aparipakkattā tassa kāmānaṃ duppahānatāya
analyzed: pabbajjā ti adhippāyaḥ sabbam etam ñāṇassa a paripakka ttā tassa kāmānam du pahāna tāya
translated: The meaning of “going forth” is renunciation. Because his knowledge was not yet mature and because sensual desires are hard to abandon,

original: sammāpaṭipattiyaṃ yogyaṃ kārāpetuṃ vadati, na pabbajjāchandaṃ nivāretuṃ. Pabbajjābhisaṅkhāroti
analyzed: sammāpaṭipattiyam yogyam kārāpetum vadati na pabbajjā chandam nivāretum pabbajjā abhisaṅkhāro ti
translated: the elder said this in order to make him do what is suitable for the right practice, not in order to prevent his desire for going forth. The “preparation for going forth”

original: pabbajituṃ ārambho ussāho. Paṭipassambhīti indriyānaṃ aparipakkattā, saṃvegassa ca
analyzed: pabbajitum ārambhaḥ ussāhaḥ paṭipassambhī iti indriyānam a paripakka ttā saṃvegassa ca
translated: is the undertaking, the effort to go forth. “It subsided” because his faculties were not yet mature and because his sense of spiritual urgency

original: nātitikkhabhāvato vūpasami. Kiñcāpi paṭipassambhi, therena vuttavidhiṃ pana anutiṭṭhanto
analyzed: na atitikkha bhāvataḥ vūpasami kiñcā api paṭipassambhi therena vutta vidhim pana anutiṭṭhanto
translated: was not yet strong enough. Although it subsided, he should follow the method taught by the elder.

original: kālena kālaṃ theraṃ upasaṅkamitvā payirupāsanto dhammaṃ suṇāti. Tassa vuttanayeneva
analyzed: kālena kālam theram upasaṅkamitvā payirupāsantaḥ dhammam suṇāti tassa vutta nayena iva
translated: From time to time he should approach the elder, pay respect to him, and listen to the Dhamma. In this way,

original: dutiyaṃ pabbajjāya cittaṃ uppajji, therassa ca ārocesi. Dutiyampi thero paṭikkhipi.
analyzed: dutiyam pabbajjāya cittam uppajji therassa ca ārocesi dutiyam pi thero paṭikkhipi
translated: in the same way as before, the thought of going forth arose in him for a second time, and he informed the elder. For a second time the elder refused.

original: Tatiyavāre pana ñāṇassa paripakkabhāvaṃ ñatvā “idāni naṃ pabbājetuṃ kālo”ti thero
analyzed: tatiya vāre pana ñāṇassa paripakka bhāvam ñatvā idāni nam pabbājetum kālo ti thero
translated: But on the third occasion, knowing that his knowledge was now mature, the elder thought, “Now is the time to let him go forth.”

original: pabbājesi, pabbajitañca taṃ tīṇi saṃvaccharāni atikkamitvā gaṇaṃ pariyesitvā upasampādesi.
analyzed: pabbājesi pabbajitam ca tam tīṇi saṃvaccharāni atikkamitvā gaṇam pariyesitvā upasampādesi
translated: and after he had gone forth he trained him for three years, and then he sought out a community and gave him Acceptance.

original: Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ – “dutiyampi kho soṇo…pe… upasampādesī”ti.
analyzed: tam sandhāya vuttam dutiyam pi kho soṇa upe upasampādesi iti
translated: In reference to that it was said: “A second time Soṇa … gave him Acceptance.”

original: Tattha appabhikkhukoti katipayabhikkhuko. Tadā kira bhikkhū yebhuyyena majjhimadese
analyzed: tattha appabhikkhuko ti katipaya bhikkhuko tadā kira bhikkhū yebhuyyena majjhima dese
translated: Herein, with few bhikkhus means with a few bhikkhus. At that time, it seems, the bhikkhus lived mostly in the Middle Country ,

original: eva vasiṃsu. Tasmā tattha katipayā eva ahesuṃ, te ca ekasmiṃ nigame eko, ekasmiṃ
analyzed: eva vasiṃsu tasmā tattha katipayāḥ eva ahesum te ca ekasmin nigame ekaḥ ekasmin
translated: so there were only a few there. And they lived separately, one in one village,

original: dveti evaṃ visuṃ visuṃ vasiṃsu. Kicchenāti dukkhena. Kasirenāti āyāsena. Tato tatoti
analyzed: dve iti evam visum visum vasiṃsu kicchena ati dukkhena kasirena ati āyāsena tato tatoti
translated: one in one town, and so on. With difficulty means with trouble. With hardship means with travail. From here and there means from here and there, from villages and towns, etc.

original: tasmā tasmā gāmanigamādito. Therena hi katipaye bhikkhū ānetvā aññesu ānīyamānesu
analyzed: tasmā tasmā gāma nigama āditaḥ therena hi katipaye bhikkhū ānetvā aññesu ānīyamānesu
translated: For when the Elder had brought some bhikkhus and more were being brought,

original: pubbe ānītā kenacideva karaṇīyena pakkamiṃsu, kiñci kālaṃ āgametvā puna tesu ānīyamānesu
analyzed: pubbe ānītā kenacid eva karaṇīyena pakkamiṃsu kiñci kālam āgametvā puna tesu ānīyamānesu
translated: those previously brought left on some business or other. After waiting for some time, when more were being brought,

original: itare pakkamiṃsu. Evaṃ punappunaṃ ānayanena sannipāto cireneva ahosi, thero ca tadā
analyzed: itare evam punappunam ānayanena sannipāto cirena iva ahosi thero ca tadā
translated: those left. Thus the gathering was only accomplished after a long time by bringing them again and again. And the Elder was then

original: ekavihārī ahosi. Dasavaggaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātetvāti tadā bhagavatā paccantadesepi🔽dasavaggeneva saṅghena upasampadā anuññātā. Itonidānañhi therena yācito pañcavaggena
analyzed: eka vihārī ahosi dasa vaggam bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātetvā iti tadā bhagavatā paccanta dese pi  dasavaggena iva saṅghena upasampadā anuññātā itonidānam hi therena yācitaḥ pañcavaggena
translated: he lived alone. Having assembled a Community of monks consisting of ten members: at that time the Blessed One had allowed the full ordination by a Community consisting of ten members even in the border areas. For from this occasion the Elder, being asked, allowed the full ordination by a Community consisting of five members even in the border areas.🔽

original: saṅghena paccantadese upasampadaṃ anujāni. Tena vuttaṃ – “tiṇṇaṃ vassānaṃ…pe… sannipātetvā”ti.🔽Vassaṃvuṭṭhassāti upasampajjitvā paṭhamavassaṃ upagantvā vusitavato. Īdiso ca īdiso🔽cāti evarūpo ca evarūpo ca, evarūpāya nāmakāyarūpakāyasampattiyā samannāgato, evarūpāya
analyzed: saṅghena paccanta dese upasampadam anujāni tena vuttam tiṇṇam vassānam pe sannipātetvā ati  vassaṃvuṭṭhassa ati upasampajjitvā paṭhama vassam upagantvā vusitavataḥ īdiso ca īdiso  ca ati evarūpaḥ ca evarūpaḥ ca evarūpāya nāma kāya rūpa kāya sampattiyā samannāgataḥ evarūpāya
translated: and he lived alone. “Having caused a Community of monks consisting of ten members to assemble”: at that time the Blessed One had allowed the higher ordination to be given by a Community of monks consisting of ten members even in a border region. For the Elder had asked the Blessed One for this, saying: “Lord, let the higher ordination be allowed to be given by a Community of monks consisting of five members in a border region.” Therefore it was said: “Having caused a Community of monks consisting of ten members to assemble … after three years had elapsed.”

original: dhammakāyasampattiyā samannāgatoti sutoyeva me so bhagavā. Na kho me so bhagavā sammukhā
analyzed: dhammakāya sampattiyā samannāgataḥ ti sutoyā iva me saḥ bhagavā na kho me so bhagavā sammukhā
translated: “Who had completed the rains”: who had entered upon the first rains after higher ordination. “Such and such a one”: such and such a one, endowed with such and such a bodily and verbal excellence, endowed with such and such a excellence of the spiritual life. “I have only heard of that Blessed One”: I have only heard of that Blessed One, I have not seen him face to face.

original: diṭṭhoti etena puthujjanasaddhāya evaṃ āyasmā soṇo bhagavantaṃ daṭṭhukāmo ahosi.
analyzed: diṭṭha uti etena puthujjana saddhāya evam āyasmā soṇaḥ bhagavantam daṭṭhu kāmaḥ ahosi
translated: “I have not seen him”: by this the venerable Soṇa showed that he wanted to see the Blessed One out of the faith of an ordinary man.

original: Aparabhāge pana satthārā saddhiṃ ekagandhakuṭiyaṃ vasitvā paccūsasamayaṃ ajjhiṭṭho
analyzed: aparabhāge pana satthārā saddhim eka gandha kuṭiyam vasitvā paccūsa samayam ajjhiṭṭhaḥ
translated: Later, however, he lived with the Teacher in the Fragrant Cottage and at dawn he was inspired

original: soḷasa aṭṭhakavaggikāni satthu sammukhā aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetaso samannāharitvā🔽atthadhammappaṭisaṃvedī hutvā bhaṇanto dhammūpasañhitapāmojjādimukhena samāhito sarabhaññapariyosāne
analyzed: soḷasa aṭṭhaka vaggikāni satthu sammukhā aṭṭhim katvā manasi katvā sabbam cetaso samannāharitvā  attha dhamma paṭisaṃvedī hutvā bhaṇantaḥ dhamma upasañhita pāmojja ādi mukhena samāhitaḥ sarabhañña pariyosāne
translated: having remembered them in his mind, having fixed his whole heart on them,🔽and having experienced the meaning and the Dhamma, and being concentrated at the end of the recitation of the Dhamma, which began with the joy connected with the Dhamma,

original: vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā saṅkhāre sammasanto anupubbena arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Etadatthameva
analyzed: vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā saṅkhāre sammasantaḥ anupubbena arahattam pāpuṇi etad attham eva
translated: and having established insight, and having discerned the (four) formations, he eventually reached Arahantship. For this very purpose

original: hissa bhagavatā attanā saddhiṃ ekagandhakuṭiyaṃ vāso āṇattoti vadanti.
analyzed: hi ssa bhagavatā attanā saddhim eka gandhakuṭiyam vāsaḥ āṇattaḥ iti vadanti
translated: the Fortunate One commanded him to live in the Fragrant Cottage with himself, they say.

original: Keci panāhu – “na kho me so bhagavā sammukhā diṭṭho”ti idaṃ rūpakāyadassanameva sandhāya
analyzed: keci pana āhu na kho me so bhagavā sammukhā diṭṭhā ti idam rūpa kāya dassanam eva sandhāya
translated: But some say: “I have not seen that Fortunate One face to face,” was said by him referring to the seeing of the form body only,

original: vuttanti. Āyasmā hi soṇo pabbajitvāva therassa santike kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā ghaṭento
analyzed: vuttam ti āyasmā hi soṇaḥ pabbajitvā ava therassa santike kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā ghaṭentaḥ
translated: for the venerable Soṇa, after going forth, having received the meditation subject from the Elder, and striving

original: vāyamanto anupasampannova sotāpanno hutvā upasampajjitvā “upāsakāpi sotāpannā honti,
analyzed: vā ayamantaḥ an upasampannaḥ iva sotāpannaḥ hutvā upasampajjitvā upāsakāḥ api sotāpannāḥ honti
translated: and making an effort, while still not having been fully admitted, became a Stream-Enterer, and after being fully admitted, “lay followers are Stream-Enterers,

original: ahampi sotāpanno, kimettha citta”nti uparimaggatthāya vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā antovasseyeva
analyzed: aham pi sotāpannaḥ kim ettha cittanti upari magga tthāya vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā
translated: I too am a Stream-Enterer. What is there in this for you?” And he increased his insight for the purpose of the higher paths.🔽In the course of the rains he reached Arahantship and announced his purity.

original: chaḷabhiñño hutvā visuddhipavāraṇāya pavāresi. Ariyasaccadassanena hi bhagavato dhammakāyo
analyzed: chaḍabhiññaḥ hutvā visuddhi pavāraṇāya pavāresi ariya sacca dassanena hi bhagavataḥ dhammakāyaḥ
translated: For by seeing the Four Noble Truths the Blessed One’s Dhamma body is seen.

original: diṭṭho nāma hoti. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: diṭṭhaḥ nāma hoti vuttam ha etam
translated: This is said:

original: “Yo kho, vakkali, dhammaṃ passati, so maṃ passati. Yo maṃ passati, so dhammaṃ passatī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ kho vakkali dhammam passati saḥ mama passati yaḥ mama passati saḥ dhammam passati iti
translated: “Vakkali, whoever sees the Dhamma sees me, and whoever sees me sees the Dhamma” .

original: Tasmāssa dhammakāyadassanaṃ pageva siddhaṃ, pavāretvā pana rūpakāyaṃ daṭṭhukāmo ahosīti.
analyzed: tasmā assa dhammakāya dassanam pagā iva siddham pavāretvā pana rūpa kāyam daṭṭhu kāmaḥ ahosi iti
translated: So it was the seeing of the Dhamma body that was accomplished first. But after announcing his purity he wanted to see the visible-form body.

original: “Sace maṃ upajjhāyo anujānātī”tipi pāṭho. “Bhante”ti pana likhanti. Tathā “sādhu
analyzed: sace mam upajjhāyaḥ anujānāti iti pi pāṭhaḥ bhante iti likhanti tathā sādhu
translated: “If my preceptor will allow me” is the reading in the Commentary. But in the text “Venerable sir” is written.

original: sādhu, āvuso soṇa, gaccha tvaṃ, āvuso soṇā”tipi pāṭho. “Āvuso”ti pana kesuci potthakesu
analyzed: sādhu āvuso soṇa gaccha tvam āvuso soṇa atipi pāṭhaḥ āvuso iti pana kesuci potthakesu
translated: “Good, good, friend Soṇa” is the reading in the Commentary. But in the text “Go, friend Soṇa” is written.🔽And in some books “friend” is not written.

original: natthi. Tathā “evamāvusoti kho āyasmā soṇo”tipi pāṭho. Āvusovādoyeva hi aññamaññaṃ
analyzed: natthi tathā evam āvuso ti kho āyasmā soṇaḥ tipi pāṭhaḥ hi aññam aññam
translated: “Yes, friend” is the reading in the Commentary. For the exchange of greetings

original: bhikkhūnaṃ bhagavato dharamānakāle āciṇṇo. Bhagavantaṃ pāsādikantiādīnaṃ padānaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhūnam bhagavataḥ dharamāna kāle āciṇṇaḥ bhagavantam pāsādikanti ādīnam padānam
translated: was the practice of the monks at the time of the Lord’s passing. The words “the Lord’s chamber” and so on

original: attho heṭṭhā vuttoyeva.
analyzed: atthaḥ heṭṭhā vuttaḥ yeva
translated: The Blessed One’s way of speaking was the monks’ way of speaking at the time of the Blessed One’s living. The meaning of the words “the Blessed One’s lodging” and so on has already been given below .

original: Kacci bhikkhu khamanīyanti bhikkhu idaṃ tuyhaṃ catucakkaṃ navadvāraṃ sarīrayantaṃ
analyzed: kacci bhikkhu khamanīyanti bhikkhu idam tuyham catu cakkam nava dvāram sarīrayantam
translated: “I trust, bhikkhu, that you are getting better” : “I trust, bhikkhu, that this your body with its four sides and six parts ,

original: kacci khamanīyaṃ, kiṃ sakkā khamituṃ sahituṃ pariharituṃ, kiṃ dukkhabhāro nābhibhavati.
analyzed: kacci khamanīyam kim sakkā khamitum sahitum pariharitum kim dukkha bhāraḥ na abhibhavati
translated: which is yours and has to be borne by you, is getting better, that it can be endured, borne, and managed, that it is not too much for you to carry.”

original: Kacci yāpanīyanti kiṃ taṃtaṃkiccesu yāpetuṃ gametuṃ sakkā, na kañci antarāyanti dasseti.
analyzed: kacci kim taṃ taṃ kiccesu yāpetum gametum sakkā na kañci antarāyanti dasseti
translated: “I trust that you are keeping going” : “I trust that you are able to keep going, to get along, in the various duties, that there is no obstacle for you.”

original: Kaccisi appakilamathenāti anāyāsena imaṃ ettakaṃ addhānaṃ kacci āgatosi.
analyzed: kaccisi appa kilamathena ati anāyāsena imam ettakam addhānam kacci āgataḥ asi
translated: “I trust that you are not having any trouble” : “I trust that you have come this far without trouble, without difficulty.”

original: Etadahosīti buddhāciṇṇaṃ anussarantassa āyasmato ānandassa etaṃ “yassa kho maṃ bhagavā”tiādinā
analyzed: etat ahosi iti anussarantassa āyasmataḥ ānandassa etam yassa kho mama bhagavā ati ādinā
translated: “This occurred to me” : this thought occurred to the venerable Ananda’s mind as he recalled the Blessed One’s practice, which he now expressed in the words beginning with “The Blessed One” .

original: idāni vuccamānaṃ citte āciṇṇaṃ ahosi. Ekavihāreti ekagandhakuṭiyaṃ. Gandhakuṭi hi
analyzed: idāni vuccamānam citte āciṇṇam ahosi eka vihāra iti eka gandhakuṭiyam gandhakuṭi hi

translated: and who is concentrated,

original: Tattha ṭhitena kāyenāti kāyadvārikassa asaṃvarassa pahānena akaraṇena sammā ṭhapitena🔽copanakāyena, tathā cakkhādīnaṃ indriyānaṃ nibbisevanabhāvakaraṇena suṭṭhu ṭhapitena
analyzed: tattha ṭhitena kāyena ati kāyadvārikassa asaṃvarassa pahānena akaraṇena sammā ṭhapitena  copana kāyena tathā cakkha ādīnam indriyānam nibbisevana bhāva karaṇena suṭṭhu ṭhapitena
translated: Herein, he is “standing with the body steadied” is steadied by the abandoning and non-doing of the non-restraint belonging to the door of body,🔽and he is “standing with the body well steadied” by the steadying of the five doors of body by the doing of the non-use of eye, etc.,

original: pañcadvārikakāyena, saṃyatahatthapādatāya hatthakukkuccādīnaṃ abhāvato apariphandanena🔽ṭhitena karajakāyena cāti saṅkhepato sabbenapi kāyena nibbikāratāsaṅkhātena niccalabhāvena
analyzed: pañcadvārika kāyena saṃyata hattha pāda tāya hattha kukkucca ādīnam abhāvataḥ a pariphandanena  ṭhitena karaja kāyena ca ati saṅkhepato sabbena api kāyena nibbikāra tā saṅkhātena niccala bhāvena
translated: and he is “standing with the body steady” by the non-trembling of the body consisting of the trunk, which is due to the absence of such actions as the scratching of the itch with the hand, because of the restraint of the hand and foot,

original: ṭhitena. Etenassa sīlapārisuddhi dassitā. Itthambhūtalakkhaṇe ca idaṃ karaṇavacanaṃ.🔽Ṭhitena cetasāti cittassa ṭhitiparidīpanena samādhisampadaṃ dasseti. Samādhi hi cittassa🔽‘ṭhitī’ti vuccati. Tasmā samathavasena vipassanāvaseneva vā ekaggatāya sati cittaṃ
analyzed: ṭhitena etena assa sīla pārisuddhi dassitā ittham bhūta lakkhaṇe ca idam karaṇa vacanam  ṭhitena cetasā āti cittassa ṭhiti paridīpanena samādhi sampadam dasseti samādhi hi cittassa  ṭhiti iti vuccati tasmā samatha vasena vipassanā vasena iva vā ekagga tāya sati cittam
translated: and he is “standing” in brief by the unmoving state consisting in the non-doing of all the body, which is called “steadying” . This shows his purification of virtue. And this is a verbal expression in terms of a state consisting in a particular kind of standing.🔽He is “standing with the mind steadied” is the showing of the possession of concentration by the steadying of the mind. For concentration is🔽called “steadying” of the mind. So when there is unification of mind, either by means of serenity or by means of insight,

original: ārammaṇe ekodibhāvūpagamanena ṭhitaṃ nāma hoti, na aññathā. Idañca yathāvuttakāyacittānaṃ
analyzed: ārammaṇe eka udi bhāva upagamanena ṭhitam nāma hoti na aññathā idam ca yathā vutta kāya cittānam
translated: then the mind is called “standing” by approaching the state of being directed on to an object one-pointedly, not otherwise. And this steadying of the mind is a condition for the purification of view.

original: ṭhapanaṃ samādahanaṃ sabbasmiṃ kāle sabbesu ca iriyāpathesu icchitabbanti dassento🔽āha – “tiṭṭhaṃ nisinno uda vā sayāno”ti. Tattha vā-saddo aniyamattho. Tena tiṭṭhanto
analyzed: ṭhapanam samādahanam sabbasmim kāle sabbesu ca iriyāpathesu icchitabbanti dassento  āha tiṭṭham nisinnaḥ uda vā sayānaḥ ti tattha vā saddaḥ aniyama atthaḥ tena tiṭṭhantaḥ
translated: He shows that the placing and the steadying are desirable at all times and in all postures,

original: vā nisinno vā sayāno vā tadaññiriyāpatho vāti ayamattho dīpito hotīti caṅkamanassāpi
analyzed: vā nisinnaḥ vā sa yānaḥ vā tad aññiriyāpathaḥ vā ati ayam atthaḥ dīpitaḥ hoti iti caṅkamanassa api
translated: saying, “Standing, walking, sitting, or lying.” Here the word “or” is in the sense of “and.” So the meaning is that he should place and steady the meditation subject while standing or walking or sitting or lying down or in any other posture.

original: idha saṅgaho veditabbo.🔽Etaṃ satiṃ bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahānoti yāya pageva parisuddhasamācāro kāyacittaduṭṭhullabhāvūpasamanena🔽kāyaṃ cittañca asāraddhaṃ katvā paṭiladdhāya anavajjasukhādhiṭṭhāya kāyacittapassaddhivasena
analyzed: idha saṅgahaḥ veditabbo  etam satim bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahāno ti yāya pagā iva parisuddha samācāraḥ kāya citta duṭṭhulla bhāva upasamanena  kāyam cittam ca asāraddham katvā paṭiladdhāya anavajja sukha adhiṭṭhāya kāya citta passaddhi vasena
translated: And the meaning of the clause “Standing, walking, sitting, or lying” should be understood in this way.🔽“This mindfulness a bhikkhu should steadily maintain”: by means of which he has already acquired bodily and mental tranquillity by suppressing the bodily and mental disturbances, and which he has already acquired as a blameless happiness, he should place and steady it rightly by making the mind pliant and wieldy and tranquil and still with bodily and mental tranquillity.

original: cittaṃ lahuṃ muduṃ kammaññañca katvā sammā ṭhapento samādahanto kammaṭṭhānaṃ paribrūheti
analyzed: cittam lahum mudum kammaññam ca katvā sammā ṭhapentaḥ samādahantaḥ kammaṭṭhānam paribrūha iti
translated: He thus brings the meditation subject to the culmination of its development and brings it to head.

original: matthakañca pāpeti, taṃ eva kammaṭṭhānānuyogassa ādimajjhapariyosānesu bahūpakāraṃ
analyzed: matthakam ca pāpa iti tam eva kammaṭṭhāna anuyogassa ādi majjha pariyosānesu bahu upakāram
translated: And this is of great help to him in the beginning, middle, and end of the practice of the meditation subject.

original: satiṃ bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahāno sīlavisodhanaṃ ādiṃ katvā yāva visesādhigamā tattha tattha
analyzed: satim bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahāno sīla visodhanam ādim katvā yāva visesa adhigamā tattha tattha
translated: “He who has established mindfulness” is one who has established it here and there, beginning with purification of virtue, until he reaches the attainment of distinction.🔽The meaning is that he has established it.

original: adhiṭṭhahantoti attho. Labhetha pubbāpariyaṃ visesanti so evaṃ satiārakkhena cetasā🔽kammaṭṭhānaṃ uparūpari vaḍḍhento brūhento phātiṃ karonto pubbāpariyaṃ pubbāpariyavantaṃ
analyzed: adhiṭṭhahantaḥ ti atthaḥ labhetha pubbāpariyam visesanti saḥ evam sati ārakkhena cetasā  kammaṭṭhānam upari upari vaḍḍhentaḥ brūhentaḥ phātim karontaḥ pubbāpariyam pubbāpariyavantam
translated: “He may gain distinction in the earlier and later parts”: he who thus guards mindfulness with his mind,🔽increasing, developing, and extending the meditation subject, may gain distinction,

original: pubbāparabhāgena pavattaṃ uḷāruḷāratarādibhedavisesaṃ labheyya.
analyzed: pubba apara bhāgena pavattam uḷāra uḷāratara ādi bheda visesam labheyya
translated: which is of higher and higher kinds, consisting in the various kinds of distinction that occur in the earlier and later parts.

original: Tattha duvidho pubbāpariyaviseso samathavasena vipassanāvasena cāti. Tesu samathavasena🔽tāva nimittuppattito paṭṭhāya yāva nevasaññānāsaññāyatanavasībhāvo, tāva pavatto🔽bhāvanāviseso pubbāpariyaviseso. Vipassanāvasena pana rūpamukhena abhinivisantassa
analyzed: tattha duvidhaḥ pubba apariya visesaḥ samatha vasena vipassanā vasena ca ati tesu samatha vasena  tāva nimitta uppattitaḥ paṭṭhāya yāva nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana vasībhāvo tāva pavatto  bhāvanā viseso pubba apariya viseso vipassanā vasena pana rūpa mukhena abhinivisantassa
translated: Herein, there are two kinds of distinction in the earlier and later parts: that of serenity and that of insight.🔽As regards the distinction of serenity, the distinction in development that occurs from the time of the arising of the meditation subject up to the attainment of mastery in the attainment of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception is the distinction in the earlier and later parts.

original: rūpadhammapariggahato, itarassa nāmadhammapariggahato paṭṭhāya yāva arahattādhigamo,
analyzed: rūpa dhamma pariggahataḥ itarassa nāma dhamma pariggahataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva arahatta adhigamo
translated: As regards the distinction of insight, in one who has insight into states by making mentality-materiality his object, it is the distinction in development that occurs from the time of discerning the mental and material dhammas up to the time of reaching Arahantship.

original: tāva pavatto bhāvanāviseso pubbāpariyaviseso. Ayameva ca idhādhippeto.
analyzed: tāva pavattaḥ bhāvanā visesaḥ pubba apariya viseso ayam eva ca idha adhippeto
translated: This is the distinction of development that has occurred, the distinction of what is earlier and what later. And this is what is intended here.

original: Laddhāna pubbāpariyaṃ visesanti pubbāpariyavisesaṃ ukkaṃsapāramippattaṃ arahattaṃ🔽labhitvā. Adassanaṃ maccurājassa gaccheti jīvitupacchedavasena sabbesaṃ sattānaṃ
analyzed: pubba apariyam pubba apariya visesam ukkaṃsa pārami pattam arahattam  labhitvā adassanam maccu rājassa gaccha iti jīvita upaccheda vasena sabbesam sattānam
translated: Having obtained the distinction of what is earlier and what later: having obtained the distinction of what is earlier and what later, that is, Arahantship, which has reached its culmination and perfection.🔽He goes beyond the range of the King of Death: he goes beyond the range, beyond the domain, of the three kinds of becoming, which are called the “King of Death” because of their overpowering of all living beings.

original: abhibhavanato maccurājasaṅkhātassa maraṇassa visayabhūtaṃ bhavattayaṃ samatikkantattā
analyzed: abhibhavanataḥ maccurāja saṅkhātassa maraṇassa visaya bhūtam bhavattayam samatikkanta ttā
translated: And he does so because he has gone beyond the triple becoming that is the domain of death, which is called the “King of Death” because of its overpowering of all living beings.

original: adassanaṃ agocaraṃ gaccheyya. Imasmiṃ vagge yaṃ avuttaṃ, taṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayamevāti.
analyzed: a dassanam a gocaram gaccheyya imasmin vagge yam a vuttam tam heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva ati
translated: What has not been commented on in this chapter is to be understood in the way already stated.

original: Dasamasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dasama sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the tenth sutta is ended.

original: Niṭṭhitā ca mahāvaggavaṇṇanā.🔽6. Jaccandhavaggo
analyzed: niṭṭhitā ca mahā vagga vaṇṇanā  jat candha vaggo
translated: And the commentary on the Great Chapter is ended.🔽The Chapter on the Blind

original: 1. Āyusaṅkhārossajjanasuttavaṇṇanā🔽51. Jaccandhavaggassa paṭhame vesāliyantiādi heṭṭhā vuttatthameva. Vesāliṃ piṇḍāya
analyzed: āyu saṅkhāra ussajjana sutta vaṇṇanā  jaccandha vaggassa paṭhame vesāliyantiādi heṭṭhā vutta ttham eva vesālim piṇḍāya
translated: The Sutta on the Casting Off of Life-Force

original: pāvisīti kadā pāvisi? Ukkācelato nikkhamitvā vesāliṃ gatakāle. Bhagavā hi veḷuvagāmake
analyzed: pāvisi iti kadā pāvisi ukkā celataḥ nikkhamitvā vesālim gata kāle bhagavā hi veḷuva gāmake
translated: In the first sutta in the Chapter on the Blind, “at Vesālī” and so on is in the same sense as already stated. He entered Vesālī for alms: when did he enter? At the time of going to Vesālī after leaving the Ukkacelā. For the Blessed One, after leaving the Ukkacelā,

original: vassaṃ vasitvā tato nikkhamitvā anupubbena sāvatthiṃ patvā jetavane vihāsi. Tasmiṃ
analyzed: vassam vasitvā tatas nikkhamitvā anupubbena sāvatthim patvā jetavane vihāsi tasmin
translated: After he had kept the rains, he went forth from that place and in due course reached Sāvatthi, where he dwelt in the Jeta Grove.

analyzed: kāle dhammasenāpati attanaḥ āyu saṅkhāraṃ oloketvā sattāham eva pavattissati iti ñatvā

original: bhagavantaṃ anujānāpetvā nāḷakagāmaṃ gantvā tattha mātaraṃ sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhāpetvā🔽parinibbāyi. Satthā cundena ābhatā tassa dhātuyo gahetvā dhātucetiyaṃ kārāpetvā mahābhikkhusaṅghaparivuto
analyzed: bhagavantam anujānāpetvā nāḷakagāmam gantvā tattha mātaram sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhāpetvā  parinibbāyi satthā cundena ābhatā tassa dhātuyaḥ gahetvā dhātu cetiyam kārāpetvā mahā bhikkhu saṅgha parivutaḥ
translated: After he had obtained the consent of the Exalted One, he went to Nāḷakagāma, where he established his mother in the fruit of stream-entry.🔽Then he passed into Nibbāna. analyzed: dhātuyaḥ gahetvā cetiyam kārāpetvā rājagahataḥ nikkhamitvā anupubbena ukkā celam agamāsi
translated: and after he had caused a shrine to be erected for them, he left Rājagaha and in due course reached Ukkacela.

analyzed: dhammam desetvā ukkā celataḥ nikkhamitvā vesālim agamāsi evam gataḥ bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam  nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya vesālim piṇḍāya pāvisi iti vuccati tena vuttam ukkā celato
translated: After giving the Dhamma talk, he left Ukkacela and went to Vesālī. It is said that the Blessed One went in this way: “Having dressed in the morning time,

analyzed: nikkhamitvā vesālim gata kālā iti  nisīdanam ti idha cammakkhaṇḍam adhippetam cāpālam cetiyanti pubbe cāpālassa nāma

analyzed: yakkhassa vasita ṭṭhānam cāpāla cetiyanti paññāyittha tattha bhagavataḥ kata vihāraḥ api
translated: Seat: a piece of leather is intended here. Cāpāla Shrine: formerly the place where a yakkha named Cāpāla lived was known as “Cāpāla Shrine.” The Blessed One’s dwelling place there is called “Cāpāla Shrine”

analyzed: tāya ruḷhiyā cāpāla cetiyanti vuccati udenam cetiyanti evamādīsu pi esa iva nayo

translated: Seven Leaves: it is said that the seven daughters of King Kiki, who were filled with anxiety, left the royal palace

translated: “Many sons”: a banyan tree with many branches; a deity lived in it; many people

analyzed: putte patthenti tat upādāya tam ṭhānam bahu puttam cetiyanti paññāyittha sārandadanti

analyzed: sārandadassa nāma yakkhassa vasita ṭṭhānam iti sabbāni eva tāni buddha uppādato pubbe
translated: is the place where a yakkha named Sārandada lived. Thus all those places were known as🔽cetiyas before the Buddha’s appearance because they were occupied by deities. And even

analyzed: devatā pariggahita ttā cetiya vohārena voharitāni bhagavataḥ vihāre kate api ca tathā iva  paññāyanti ramaṇīyā ti ettha vesāliyā tāva bhūmi bhāga sampattiyā puggala sampattiyā
translated: after the Buddha’s dwelling places were made, they were still known as🔽cetiyas. “Delightful”: here, the delightful nature of Vesālī should be understood in terms of🔽the excellence of its land, the excellence of its people, and the ease with which requisites

analyzed: na acca āsanna tāya gamana āgamana sampattiyā an ākiṇṇa vihāra ṭṭhāna tāya chāyu udaka sampattiyā

analyzed: paviveka patirūpa tāya ca ramaṇīya tā daṭṭhabbā cattāro iddhipādā ti ettha iddhipāda padassa
translated: terms of the excellence of the dwelling place, which is not crowded; in terms of the excellence of shade and water; and in terms of the excellence of seclusion. “The four bases for spiritual success”: here, the word “base” is explained as follows:

analyzed: atthaḥ heṭṭhā vuttaḥ yā iva bhāvitā ati vaḍḍhitā bahulīka tā ati punappunam katā yā anīka tā ati
translated: “Repeatedly practiced” means done again and again.🔽“Made the vehicle” means made like a yoked vehicle.

analyzed: yutta yānam viya katā vatthukatā ati patiṭṭha ṭṭhena vatthu viya katā anuṭṭhitā ati adhiṭṭhitā
translated: “Made the basis” means made like a basis in the sense of a foundation.🔽“Well-established” means well-determined.

original: Paricitāti samantato citā suvaḍḍhitā. Susamāraddhāti suṭṭhu samāraddhā, ativiya sammā nipphāditāti.
analyzed: paricitā ati samantataḥ citā su vaḍḍhitā su samāraddhā ati suṭṭhu samāraddhā ativiya sammā nipphāditā ati
translated: “Well-penetrated” means well-pervaded, well-increased, well-accomplished.🔽Having spoken thus without restriction, he again spoke in order to show with restriction, saying, “The Tathagata, monks, could remain for the lifespan or for what is left of the lifespan.”

original: Evaṃ aniyamena kathetvā puna niyametvā dassetuṃ, “tathāgatassa kho”tiādimāha. Ettha
analyzed: evam aniyamena kathetvā puna niyametvā dassetum tathāgatassa kho ti ādim āha ettha
translated: Herein,🔽“lifespan” means the lifespan .

original: ca kappanti āyukappaṃ. Tiṭṭheyyāti tasmiṃ tasmiṃ kāle yaṃ manussānaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ,🔽taṃ paripuṇṇaṃ katvā tiṭṭheyya dhareyya. Kappāvasesaṃ vāti “appaṃ vā bhiyyo vā”ti🔽vuttaṃ vassasatato atirekaṃ vā. Mahāsīvatthero panāha – “buddhānaṃ aṭṭhāne gajjitaṃ
analyzed: ca kappanti āyu kappam tiṭṭheyya ati tasmin tasmin kāle yam manussānam āyu ppamāṇam  tam paripuṇṇam katvā tiṭṭheyya dhareyya kappa avasesam vā ati appam vā bhiyyas vā ati  vuttam vassa satataḥ atirekam vā mahāsīva theraḥ pana āha buddhānam aṭṭhāne gajjitam
translated: “Remain” means remain having fulfilled, having endured, the lifespan of human beings at that time.🔽“The remainder of the lifespan” means more or less than one hundred years.🔽But the Elder Maha-Siva said: “There is no thunderous sound in the case of Buddhas.

original: nāma natthi. Yatheva hi veḷuvagāmake uppannaṃ māraṇantikaṃ vedanaṃ dasa māse vikkhambhesi,
analyzed: nāma natthi yathā iva hi veḷuva gāmake uppannam māraṇa ntikam vedanam dasa māse vikkhambhesi
translated: Just as he suppressed for ten months the pain that arose in the village of Veḷuva,

original: evaṃ punappunaṃ taṃ samāpattiṃ samāpajjitvā vikkhambhento imaṃ bhaddakappameva tiṭṭheyyā”ti.
analyzed: evam punappunam tam samāpattim samāpajjitvā vikkhambhentaḥ imam bhadda kappam eva tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: and he would remain in this fortunate aeon, entering upon and emerging from that attainment again and again and thus suppressing the defilements.

original: Kasmā pana na ṭhitoti? Upādinnakasarīraṃ nāma khaṇḍiccādīhi abhibhuyyati, buddhā
analyzed: kasmā pana na upādinnaka sarīram nāma khaṇḍicca ādīhi buddhā
translated: But why does he not remain? Because a body that is still subject to the process of rebirth is overcome by such things as splinters, and Buddhas

original: ca pana khaṇḍiccādibhāvaṃ appatvā pañcame āyukoṭṭhāse bahujanassa piyamanāpakāleyeva🔽parinibbāyanti. Buddhānubuddhesu aggasāvakamahāsāvakesu parinibbutesu aparivārena
analyzed: ca pana khaṇḍicca ādi bhāvam appatvā pañcame āyu koṭṭhāse bahu janassa  parinibbāyanti buddha anubuddhesu aggasāvaka mahāsāvakesu parinibbutesu a parivārena
translated: do not attain final Nibbāna until they have reached the fifth stage of the life-span, when they are dear to and beloved of the multitude.

original: ekakeneva ṭhātabbaṃ hoti, daharasāmaṇeraparivārena vā. Tato “aho buddhānaṃ parisā”ti
analyzed: ekakena iva ṭhātabbam hoti dahara sāmaṇera parivārena vā tatas aho buddhānam parisā ati
translated: And when the chief disciples and the great disciples have attained final Nibbāna, he would have to remain all alone without a companion, either with young bhikkhus or young novices as his companions. Then he would be open to the criticism, “How great the multitude of the Buddhas’ disciples!”

original: hīḷetabbataṃ āpajjeyya, tasmā na ṭhitoti. Evaṃ vuttepi so pana na ruccati, “āyukappo”ti🔽idameva aṭṭhakathāya niyamitaṃ.
analyzed: āpajjeyya tasmā na ṭhitaḥ ti evam vutte pi saḥ pana na ruccati āyu kappo ti  idam eva aṭṭhakathāya niyamitam
translated: That is why he does not remain. But even though this is so, it is still not acceptable. The decision is that “the life-span” is the limit.

original: Oḷārike nimitteti thūle saññuppādane. Thūlasaññuppādanañhetaṃ, “tiṭṭhatu bhagavā
analyzed: oḷārike nimitte iti thūle saññuppādane thūla saññuppādanam ha etam tiṭṭhatu bhagavā
translated: In a gross object: in the production of a gross perception. For this is the production of a gross perception: “Let the Blessed One remain, O Lord, let the Well-Farer remain for an aeon; let him remain for the life-span.”

original: kappa”nti sakalakappaṃ avaṭṭhānayācanāya yadidaṃ “yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro
analyzed: kappanti sakala kappam avaṭṭhāna yācanāya yat idam yassa kassaci ānanda cattāro
translated: “for the whole of the aeon” is the request for the non-relinquishment of the whole of the aeon.

original: iddhipādā bhāvitā”tiādinā aññāpadesena attano caturiddhipādabhāvanānubhāvena kappaṃ
analyzed: iddhipādāḥ bhāvitā ti ādinā añña apadesena attano catur iddhipāda bhāvanā anubhāvena kappam
translated: “For an aeon” is the disclosure of his ability to endure for an aeon by the disclosure of his own four bases of success in his reply to the request to endure by the whole aeon, with the words “To anyone, Ānanda, who has developed the four bases of success in supernormal power” .

original: avaṭṭhānasamatthatāvibhāvanaṃ. Obhāseti pākaṭavacane. Pākaṭañcetaṃ vacanaṃ pariyāyaṃ🔽muñcitvā ujukameva attano adhippāyavibhāvanaṃ.
analyzed: avaṭṭhāna samattha tā vibhāvanam pākaṭa vacane vacanam  muñcitvā ujukam eva attanaḥ adhippāya vibhāvanam
translated: “He illuminates” is in the sense of making manifest. And this is manifest by the disclosure of his own intention in a straight way, by the means of the reply.

original: Bahujanahitāyāti mahājanassa hitatthāya. Bahujanasukhāyāti mahājanassa sukhatthāya.🔽Lokānukampāyāti sattalokassa anukampaṃ paṭicca. Katarassa sattalokassa? Yo bhagavato🔽dhammadesanaṃ sutvā paṭivijjhati, amatapānaṃ pivati, tassa. Bhagavato hi dhammacakkappavattanasuttadesanāya
analyzed: bahu jana hitāya ati mahā janassa hita atthāya bahu jana sukhāya ati mahā janassa sukha tthāya  loka anukampāya ati satta lokassa anukampam paṭicca katarassa satta lokassa yaḥ bhagavataḥ  dhamma desanam sutvā paṭivijjhati amata pānam pivati tassa bhagavataḥ hi dhamma cakka ppavattana sutta desanāya
translated: “For the welfare of the multitude” is for the welfare of the great multitude. “For the happiness of the multitude” is for the happiness of the great multitude.

original: aññātakoṇḍaññappamukhā aṭṭhārasa brahmakoṭiyo dhammaṃ paṭivijjhiṃsu. Evaṃ yāva subhaddaparibbājakavinayanā
analyzed: aññātakoṇḍañña ppamukhāḥ aṭṭhārasa brahmakoṭiyaḥ dhammam paṭivijjhiṃsu evam yāva subhadda paribbājaka vinayanā
translated: “Out of compassion for the world” is for the sake of compassion for the world of beings. For what world of beings? For that world of beings which penetrates the Blessed One’s teaching of the Dhamma and drinks the deathless drink. For when the Blessed One taught the Dhamma in the Discourse on the Setting in Motion of the Wheel of the Dhamma, eighteen koṭis of Brahmas penetrated the Dhamma, with Aṭṭha- ka-Koṇḍañña as their head. And so on down to the conversion of the wanderer Subhadda.

original: dhammapaṭividdhasattānaṃ gaṇanā natthi, mahāsamayasuttaṃ maṅgalasuttaṃ cūḷarāhulovādasuttaṃ
analyzed: dhamma paṭividdha sattānam gaṇanā natthi mahāsamaya suttam maṅgala suttam cūḷa rāhulovāda suttam
translated: There is no counting of those beings who have penetrated the Dhamma.🔽At the time of the teaching of the four suttas, the Great Assembly Sutta, the Auspicious Sutta, the Advice to Rāhula Sutta,

original: samacittasuttanti imesaṃ catunnaṃ suttānaṃ desanākāle abhisamayappattasattānaṃ paricchedo
analyzed: sama citta suttanti imesam catunnam suttānam desanā kāle abhisamaya ppatta sattānam paricchedaḥ
translated: and the Mindful Sutta, there is no limit to the number of beings who attained realization.

original: natthi, etassa aparimāṇassa sattalokassa anukampāya bhagavato ṭhānaṃ jātaṃ. Evaṃ
analyzed: natthi etassa aparimāṇassa satta lokassa anukampāya bhagavataḥ ṭhānam jātam evam
translated: The Blessed One’s presence is for the sake of the immeasurable world of beings. In the same way,

original: anāgatepi bhavissatīti adhippāyena vadati. Devamanussānanti na kevalaṃ devamanussānaṃyeva,
analyzed: anāgate api bhavissati iti adhippāyena vadati deva manussānam ti na kevalam deva manussānam yeva
translated: he speaks with the intention that it will be so in the future as well. “For the sake of gods and men”: not only for the sake of gods and men,

original: avasesānaṃ nāgasupaṇṇādīnampi atthāya hitāya sukhāya bhagavato ṭhānaṃ hoti. Sahetukapaṭisandhike
analyzed: avasesānam nāga supaṇṇa ādīnam pi atthāya hitāya sukhāya bhagavato ṭhānam hoti sa hetuka paṭisandhike
translated: but also for the sake of the rest, such as nāgas, supaṇṇas, etc. The Blessed One’s presence is for their welfare, for their benefit, for their happiness.

original: pana maggaphalasacchikiriyāya bhabbapuggale dassetuṃ evaṃ vuttaṃ, tasmā aññesampi
analyzed: pana magga phala sacchikiriyāya bhabba puggale dassetum evam vuttam tasmai aññesam pi
translated: But in order to show those persons who are capable of realizing the path and fruit with a causal rebirth, it is said thus. Therefore, the meaning is:

original: atthatthāya hitatthāya sukhatthāya bhagavā tiṭṭhatūti attho. Tattha atthāyāti idhalokasampattiatthāya.
analyzed: attha tthāya hita tthāya sukha tthāya bhagavā tiṭṭhatu uti attho tattha atthāya ati idha loka sampatti atthāya
translated: May the Blessed One remain for the sake of their welfare, for the sake of their benefit, for the sake of their happiness.🔽Herein, “for the sake of” means for the sake of the prosperity of this world.

original: Hitāyāti paralokasampattihetubhūtahitatthāya. Sukhāyāti nibbānadhātusukhatthāya.
analyzed: hitāya ati para loka sampatti hetu bhūta hita atthāya sukhāya ati nibbāna dhātu sukha atthāya
translated: For welfare: for the sake of welfare, which is the cause for the excellence of the next world. For happiness: for the sake of the happiness of the Nibbāna element.

original: Purimaṃ pana hitasukhaggahaṇaṃ sabbasādhāraṇavasena veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: purimam pana hita sukha ggahaṇam sabba sādhāraṇa vasena veditabbam
translated: But the former mention of welfare and happiness should be understood as being common to all.

original: Yathā taṃ mārena pariyuṭṭhitacittoti ettha nti nipātamattaṃ, yathā mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto
analyzed: yathā tam mārena pariyuṭṭhita cittaḥ iti ettha nti nipāta mattam yathā mārena pariyuṭṭhita cittaḥ
translated: As if his mind were possessed by Māra: here the word “as if” is merely an expression. As if his mind were possessed by Māra,

original: ajjhotthaṭacitto aññopi koci puthujjano paṭivijjhituṃ na sakkuṇeyya, evameva nāsakkhi
analyzed: ajjhotthaṭa cittaḥ aññaḥ api koci puthujjanaḥ paṭivijjhitum na sakkuṇeyya evam eva na asakkhi
translated: as if the mind of any other worldling were possessed, overwhelmed, by Māra, so too, the elder was unable

original: paṭivijjhitunti attho. Māro hi yassa keci vipallāsā appahīnā, tassa cittaṃ pariyuṭṭhāti.
analyzed: paṭivijjhitunti atthaḥ māraḥ hi yassa keci vipallāsāḥ a pahīnā tassa cittam pariyuṭṭhāti
translated: to penetrate. The meaning is that he was unable to penetrate. For Māra possesses the mind of anyone whose perversions have not been abandoned.

original: Yassa pana sabbena sabbaṃ dvādasa vipallāsā appahīnā, tassa vattabbameva natthi,
analyzed: yassa pana sabbena sabbam dvādasa vipallāsāḥ appahīnā tassa vattabbam eva natthi
translated: But in the case of anyone in whom all the twelve perversions are unabandoned, there is nothing to be said;

original: therassa ca cattāro vipallāsā appahīnā, tenassa cittaṃ pariyuṭṭhāsi. So pana cittapariyuṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: therassa ca cattāro vipallāsāḥ appahīnā tena assa cittam pariyuṭṭhāsi so pana citta pariyuṭṭhānam
translated: but the elder had not abandoned the four perversions, and so his mind was possessed. But in possessing his mind,

original: karonto kiṃ karotīti? Bheravaṃ rūpārammaṇaṃ vā dasseti, saddārammaṇaṃ vā sāveti,
analyzed: karontaḥ kim karoti iti bheravam rūpa ārammaṇam vā dasseti sadda ārammaṇam vā sāveti
translated: what did Māra do? He either showed a terrifying object as a visible-form object or he made a terrifying sound as a sound object,

original: tato sattā taṃ disvā vā sutvā vā satiṃ vissajjetvā vivaṭamukhā honti. Tesaṃ mukhena
analyzed: tatas sattā tam disvā vā sutvā vā satim vissajjetvā vivaṭa mukhāḥ honti tesam mukhena
translated: Then, on seeing or hearing them, beings lose their mindfulness and open their mouths.🔽He puts his hand into their mouths,

original: hatthaṃ pavesetvā hadayaṃ maddati, tato visaññino hutvā tiṭṭhanti. Therassa panesa
analyzed: hattham pavesetvā hadayam maddati tatas visaññinaḥ hutvā tiṭṭhanti therassa pana esa
translated: and he crushes their hearts. Then they stand there unconscious.

original: mukhena hatthaṃ pavesetuṃ kiṃ sakkhissati, bheravārammaṇaṃ pana dasseti. Taṃ disvā
analyzed: mukhena hattham pavesetum kim sakkhissati bherava ārammaṇam pana dasseti tam disvā
translated: But how could he put his hand into the Elder’s mouth? He only shows a terrifying object.🔽On seeing it, the Elder did not penetrate the appearance as a sign.

original: thero nimittobhāsaṃ na paṭivijjhi. Jānantoyeva bhagavā kimatthaṃ yāvatatiyaṃ āmantesi?
analyzed: theraḥ nimitta ubhāsam na paṭivijjhi jānanto yā iva bhagavā kimattham yāvatatiyam āmantesi
translated: The Blessed One knew all this. Why then did he call him three times?

original: Parato “tiṭṭhatu, bhante bhagavā”ti yācite “tuyhevetaṃ dukkaṭaṃ, tuyhevetaṃ aparaddha”nti
analyzed: paratas tiṭṭhatu bhante bhagavā ati yācite tuyhā iva etam dukkaṭam tuyhā iva etam aparaddhanti
translated: When the Elder said, “Let the Blessed One remain, venerable sir,” the Blessed One rebuked him, saying, “This is a fault in you, this is an imperfection in you.”

original: dosāropanena sokatanukaraṇatthaṃ. Passati hi bhagavā “ayaṃ mayi ativiya siniddhahadayo,
analyzed: dosa āropanena soka tanu karaṇa attham passati hi bhagavā ayam mayi ativiya siniddha hadayaḥ
translated: He did this in order to show his displeasure. For the Blessed One saw that the Elder had a very tender heart,

original: so parato bhūmicālakāraṇañca āyusaṅkhārossajjanañca sutvā mama ciraṭṭhānaṃ yācissati,
analyzed: saḥ paratas bhūmicāla kāraṇañca āyu saṅkhāra ussajjanañca sutvā mama cira ṭṭhānam yācissati
translated: and that on hearing the reason for the earthquake and the Blessed One’s relinquishing of the life-process, he would ask the Blessed One to remain,

original: athāhaṃ ‘kissa tvaṃ puretaraṃ na yācasī’ti tasseva sīse dosaṃ pātessāmi, sattā ca
analyzed: atha aham kissa tvam puretaram na yācasi iti tassa iva sīse dosam pātessāmi sattā ca
translated: and then the Blessed One would lay the blame on him, saying, “Why did you not ask me before?” And beings

original: attano aparādhena na tathā vihaññanti, tenassa soko tanuko bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: attanaḥ aparādhena na tathā vihaññanti tena assa sokaḥ tanukaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: and they will not be so harassed because of his own fault. Therefore his sorrow will be slight.”

original: Gaccha tvaṃ, ānandāti yasmā divāvihāratthāya idhāgato, tasmā, ānanda, gaccha tvaṃ yathārucitaṃ ṭhānaṃ divāvihārāya. Tenevāha – “yassa dāni kālaṃ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: gaccha tvam ānanda ati yasmai divāvihāra atthāya idha āgataḥ tasmai ānanda gaccha tvam yathārucitam ṭhānam divāvihārāya tena iva āha yassa dāni kālam maññasi iti
translated: “Go, Ānanda, now that you have come here for the day’s abiding, go to whatever place you are inclined to.” That is why he said: “Now you may go at your own convenience.”

original: Māro pāpimāti ettha satte anatthe niyojento māretīti māro. Pāpimāti tasseva vevacanaṃ.
analyzed: māraḥ pāpimā iti ettha satte anatthe niyojentaḥ māreti iti māraḥ pāpimā iti tassa iva vevacanam
translated: “The Wicked Māra”: here, by urging beings to what is disadvantageous, he kills them, thus he is Māra . Wicked is a synonym for him.

original: So hi pāpadhammena samannāgatattā ‘pāpimā’ti vuccati. Bhāsitā kho panesāti ayañhi
analyzed: so hi pāpa dhammena samannāgata ttā pāpimā iti vuccati bhāsitā kho pana isā ati ayan hi
translated: For he is called “wicked” because he is endowed with wicked states. But the Exalted One said:

original: bhagavati bodhimaṇḍe satta sattāhe atikkamitvā ajapālanigrodhe viharante attano dhītāsu
analyzed: bhagavati bodhimaṇḍe satta sattāhe atikkamitvā ajapāla nigrodhe viharante dhītāsu
translated: When the Exalted One had passed the seven weeks at the foot of the Goatherd’s Banyan Tree and was staying at the Ajapāla Banyan Tree, his three daughters,

original: āgantvā icchāvighātaṃ patvā gatāsu ayaṃ “attheso upāyo”ti cintento āgantvā “bhagavā
analyzed: āgantvā icchā vighātam patvā gatāsu ayam attha iso upāyo ti cintentaḥ āgantvā bhagavā
translated: having come and been frustrated in their desire to tempt him, had gone away. Thinking, “This is the way,” he came and said:

original: yadatthaṃ tumhehi pāramiyo pūritā, so vo attho anuppatto, paṭividdhaṃ sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ,
analyzed: yadattham tumhehi pāramiyaḥ pūritā saḥ vaḥ atthaḥ an uppattaḥ paṭividdham sabbaññuta ññāṇam
translated: “The purpose for which you have fulfilled the pāramīs has now been achieved by you. Omniscient knowledge has been penetrated by you.

original: kiṃ te lokavicaraṇenā”ti vatvā yathā ajja evameva “parinibbātu dāni, bhante bhagavā”ti
analyzed: kim te loka vicaraṇena ati vatvā yathā ajja evam eva parinibbātu dāni bhante bhagavā ati
translated: What have you to do with wandering about in the world?”🔽and just as today, so then also, “Now let the Lord, O Lord, attain final Nibbāna!”

original: yāci. Bhagavā cassa “na tāvāha”ntiādīni vatvā paṭikkhipi. Taṃ sandhāya idāni “bhāsitā🔽kho panesā”tiādimāha.🔽Tattha viyattāti ariyamaggādhigamavasena byattā. Vinītāti tatheva kilesavinayanena
analyzed: yāci bhagavā ca ssa na tau aham nti ādīni vatvā paṭikkhipi tam sandhāya idāni bhāsitā  kho pana isā ati ādim āha  tattha viyattā ati ariya magga adhigama vasena byattā vinītā ati tathā iva kilesa vinayanena
translated: “What have you to do with wandering in the world?” and he asked the Exalted One to attain final Nibbāna, just as he did today. The Exalted One refused his request, saying: “Not yet, Moggallāna.” The present passage refers to that incident.

original: vinītā. Visāradāti sārajjakarānaṃ diṭṭhivicikicchādīnaṃ pahānena visāradabhāvaṃ pattā.🔽Bahussutāti tepiṭakavasena bahu sutametesanti bahussutā. Tameva dhammaṃ dhārentīti🔽dhammadharā. Atha vā bahussutāti pariyattibahussutā ceva paṭivedhabahussutā ca. Dhammadharāti
analyzed: vinītāḥ visāradāti diṭṭhi vicikicchā ādīnam pahānena visārada bhāvam pattā  bahussutā ati tepiṭaka vasena bahu tam eva dhammam dhārenti iti  dhamma dharā atha vā bahu ssutā ati pariyatti bahu ssutā ca iva paṭivedha bahu ssutā ca dhamma dharā ati
translated: Herein, they are accomplished means they are accomplished in the attainment of the noble path. They are disciplined means they are disciplined in the same way by the disciplining of defilements. They are confident means they have attained confidence by the abandoning of the doubts that cause timidity.🔽They are of great wisdom means they have much learning in the three Piṭakas. They are bearers of the Dhamma means they bear the Dhamma.

original: pariyattidhammānaṃ ceva paṭivedhadhammānañca dhāraṇato dhammadharāti evampettha attho
analyzed: pariyatti dhammānam ca iva paṭivedha dhammānam ca dhāraṇataḥ dhammadharā ti evam pa ittha atthaḥ
translated: Or alternatively, they are of great wisdom means they are of great learning both in the learning of the texts and in the learning of the knowledge of the truths. They are bearers of the Dhamma means they bear the Dhamma both of the texts and of the knowledge of the truths. This is the meaning here.

original: veditabbo. Dhammānudhammappaṭipannāti ariyadhammassa anudhammabhūtaṃ vipassanādhammaṃ
analyzed: veditabbaḥ dhamma anudhamma paṭipannā ati ariya dhammassa anudhamma bhūtam vipassanā dhammam
translated: should be known. They are practicing in conformity with the Dhamma: they are practicing the insight Dhamma that is in conformity with the noble Dhamma.

original: paṭipannā. Sāmīcippaṭipannāti ñāṇadassanavisuddhiyā anucchavikaṃ visuddhiparamparāpaṭipadaṃ🔽paṭipannā. Anudhammacārinoti sallekhikaṃ tassā paṭipadāya anurūpaṃ appicchatādidhammaṃ🔽caraṇasīlā. Sakaṃ ācariyakanti attano ācariyavādaṃ. Ācikkhissantīti ādito kathessanti,
analyzed: paṭipannā sāmīci paṭipannā ati ñāṇa dassana visuddhiyā anucchavikam visuddhi paramparā paṭipadam  paṭipannāḥ anudhamma cārino ti sallekhikam tassā paṭipadāya anurūpam appiccha tā ādi dhammaṃ  caraṇa sīlā sakam ācariyakam ti attanaḥ ācariya vādam ācikkhissanti iti āditas kathessanti
translated: They are practicing in accordance with the Dhamma: they are practicing the succession of purifications that is suitable for the purification by knowledge and vision.🔽They are living in conformity with the Dhamma: they have the virtue of practice that is in conformity with that practice, such as fewness of wishes.

original: attanā uggahitaniyāmena pare uggaṇhāpessantīti attho. Desessantīti vācessanti, pāḷiṃ🔽sammā vācessantīti attho. Paññapessantīti pajānāpessanti, pakāsessantīti attho. Paṭṭhapessantīti
analyzed: attanā uggahita niyāmena pare uggaṇhāpessanti iti atthaḥ desessanti iti vācessanti pāḷim  sammā vācessanti iti attho paññapessanti iti pajānāpessanti pakāsessanti iti attho paṭṭhapessanti iti
translated: Their own teacher’s instruction: the doctrine of their own teacher. They will teach: they will give it at the beginning. The meaning is: they will cause others to learn it by the method they themselves have learned.🔽They will expound: they will cause it to be recited correctly. The meaning is: they will cause it to be recited by heart.

original: pakārena ṭhapessanti. Vivarissantīti vivaṭaṃ karissanti. Vibhajissantīti vibhattaṃ
analyzed: pakārena ṭhapessanti vivarissanti iti vivaṭam karissanti vibhajissanti iti vibhattam
translated: They will demonstrate: they will cause it to be understood. The meaning is: they will make it clear. They will establish: they will establish it by means of the demonstration.🔽They will reveal: they will make it open. They will analyze: they will make it divided.

original: karissanti. Uttānīkarissantīti anuttānaṃ gambhīraṃ uttānaṃ pākaṭaṃ karissanti. Sahadhammenāti
analyzed: karissanti uttānīkarissanti iti anuttānam gambhīram uttānam pākaṭam karissanti sahadhammena ati
translated: They will make plain what is not plain: they will make plain, will make clear, what is not plain, what is deep. With the Dhamma:🔽with speech that has a reason, that has a cause. With reasoned talk:

original: sahetukena sakāraṇena vacanena. Sappāṭihāriyanti yāvaniyyānikaṃ katvā. Dhammaṃ desessantīti
analyzed: sa hetukena sa kāraṇena vacanena sappāṭihāriyanti yāvaniyyānikam katvā dhammam desessanti iti
translated: making it lead to the goal of the path. They will teach the Dhamma:

original: navavidhalokuttaradhammaṃ pabodhessanti, pakāsessantīti attho.🔽Ettha ca “paññapessantī”tiādīhi chahi padehi cha atthapadāni dassitāni, ādito pana🔽dvīhi padehi cha byañjanapadānīti. Ettāvatā tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ saṃvaṇṇanānayena
analyzed: navavidha lokuttara dhammam pabodhessanti pakāsessanti iti attho  ettha ca paññapessanti iti ādīhi chahi padehi cha attha padāni dassitāni āditaḥ pana  dvīhi padehi cha byañjana padāni iti ettāvatā tepiṭakam buddha vacanam saṃvaṇṇanā nayena
translated: they will awaken to, will reveal, the ninefold supramundane Dhamma. This is the meaning.🔽And here the six terms beginning with “they will announce” show the six kinds of meaning, while the first two terms show the six kinds of phrasing.

original: saṅgahetvā dassitaṃ hoti. Vuttañhetaṃ nettiyaṃ “dvādasapadāni suttaṃ, taṃ sabbaṃ🔽byañjanañca attho cā”ti.🔽Brahmacariyanti sikkhattayasaṅgahitaṃ sakalaṃ sāsanabrahmacariyaṃ. Iddhanti samiddhaṃ
analyzed: saṅgahetvā dassitam hoti vuttam ha etam nettiyam dvādasa padāni suttam tam sabbam  byañjanam ca atthaḥ ca ati  brahmacariyanti sikkhattaya saṅgahitam sakalam sāsana brahmacariyam iddham ti samiddham
translated: So far the Buddha’s word consisting of the three Piṭakas is shown by the method of commentary as being collected together. For this is said in the Netti: “A sutta has twelve terms, All of which are either phrasing Or else they are the meaning” .

original: jhānuppādavasena. Phītanti vuddhippattaṃ sabbaphāliphullaṃ abhiññāsampattivasena.
analyzed: jhānuppāda vasena phītanti vuddhi ppattam sabba phāli phullam abhiññā sampatti vasena
translated: The life of purity: the whole life of purity in the Dispensation, which is included in the three trainings. It has been successful: it has been successful by the arising of jhāna. It has been fulfilled: it has reached growth and fulfilment by the attainment of the higher knowledges.

original: Vitthārikanti vitthataṃ tasmiṃ tasmiṃ disābhāge patiṭṭhahanavasena. Bāhujaññanti
analyzed: vitthārikanti vitthatam tasmin tasmin disā bhāge patiṭṭhahana vasena bāhujaññanti
translated: “In detail” means in detail in the sense of being established in this or that direction. “Well-known” means

original: bahūhi ñātaṃ paṭividdhaṃ bahujanābhisamayavasena. Puthubhūtanti sabbākāravasena puthulabhāvappattaṃ.🔽Kathaṃ? Yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitanti yattakā viññujātikā devā manussā ca atthi,
analyzed: bahūhi ñātam paṭividdham bahu jana abhisamaya vasena puthu bhūtanti sabba ākāra vasena puthula bhāva ppattam  katham yāva deva manussehi suppakāsitanti yattakā viññu jātikā devā manussā ca atthi
translated: known to, penetrated by, many people in the sense of being understood by the multitude. “Well-proclaimed” means having attained the state of being extensive in all aspects.🔽How? “As far as gods and men are concerned” means

original: tehi sabbehi suṭṭhu pakāsitanti attho.
analyzed: tehi sabbehi suṭṭhu pakāsitanti atthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that it is well-proclaimed by all those who are endowed with consciousness, whether gods or men.

original: Appossukkoti nirussukko līnavīriyo. “Tvañhi, pāpima, sattasattāhātikkamanato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: appossukkaḥ ti nirussukkaḥ līna vīriyaḥ tvam hi pāpima satta sattāha atikkamanataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: “Without delay” means without delay, with slackened energy. “Evil one, from the time when seven days have passed

original: ‘parinibbātu dāni, bhante bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato’ti viravanto āhiṇḍittha, ajja
analyzed: parinibbātu dāni bhante bhagavā parinibbātu sugataḥ iti viravantaḥ āhiṇḍittha ajja
translated: since your cry, ‘Now let the Blessed One attain final Nibbana, let the Sublime One attain final Nibbana,’

original: dāni paṭṭhāya vigatussāho hohi, mā mayhaṃ parinibbānatthāya vāyāmaṃ karohī”ti vadati.
analyzed: dāni paṭṭhāya vigatussāhaḥ hohi mā mayham parinibbāna tthāya vāyāmam karohi iti vadati
translated: you have been wandering about, but from today onwards you can be at ease. Do not make any effort for my final Nibbana.”

original: Sato sampajāno āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossajīti satiṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ katvā ñāṇena paricchinditvā
analyzed: sataḥ sampajānaḥ āyu saṅkhāram ossajīti satim su upaṭṭhitam katvā ñāṇena paricchinditvā
translated: “Mindfully and with full awareness he relinquished the life-process” means having established mindfulness well, having delimited it with knowledge,

original: āyusaṅkhāraṃ vissaji pajahi. Tattha na bhagavā hatthena leḍḍuṃ viya āyusaṅkhāraṃ🔽ossaji, temāsamattameva pana samāpattiṃ samāpajjitvā tato paraṃ na samāpajjissāmīti
analyzed: āyu saṅkhāram vissaji pajahi tattha na bhagavā hatthena leḍḍum viya āyu saṅkhāram  ossaji te māsa mattam eva pana samāpattim samāpajjitvā tatas param na samāpajjissāmi iti
translated: He gave up, he abandoned, the life-continuum. Herein, the Blessed One did not throw away the life-continuum as one might throw away a clod or a potsherd. Instead, he entered upon the attainment of cessation for three months and then he did not emerge from it.🔽🔽

original: cittaṃ uppādesi. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ – “ossajī”ti, “vossajjī”tipi pāṭho.🔽Kasmā pana bhagavā kappaṃ vā kappāvasesaṃ vā ṭhātuṃ samattho tattakaṃ kālaṃ aṭṭhatvā
analyzed: cittam uppādesi tam sandhāya vuttam  kasmā pana bhagavā kappam vā kappa avasesam vā ṭhātum samatthaḥ tattakam kālam a ṭhatvā
translated: He relinquished, abandoned, his life-continuum. Herein, the Blessed One did not throw away his life-continuum like a clod with his hand. He merely formed the thought, “I will not enter upon attainment for more than three months,” and he did not enter upon it. That is what is meant by “he relinquished” . The reading “vossajjī” is also correct.

original: parinibbāyituṃ mārassa yācanāya āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossaji? Na bhagavā mārassa yācanāya🔽āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossaji, nāpi therassa āyācanāya na ossajissati, temāsato pana paraṃ
analyzed: parinibbāyitum mārassa yācanāya āyu saṅkhāram ossaji na bhagavā mārassa yācanāya  āyu saṅkhāram na api therassa āyācanāya na ossajissati te māsataḥ pana param
translated: But why did the Blessed One, who was able to remain for an aeon or the remainder of an aeon, not remain for the remainder of the aeon but instead relinquish his life-continuum by declining Mara’s request?

original: buddhaveneyyānaṃ abhāvato āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossaji. Ṭhānañhi nāma buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ
analyzed: buddha veneyyānam abhāvataḥ āyu saṅkhāram ossaji ṭhānam hi nāma buddhānam bhagavantānam
translated: The Blessed One did not relinquish his life-continuum by declining Mara’s request, nor did he do so by declining the elder’s request. He relinquished it because there were no more disciples to be trained after three months. For the Blessed One’s remaining

original: yāvadeva veneyyavinayanatthaṃ, te asati vineyyajane kena nāma kāraṇena ṭhassanti.
analyzed: yāvat eva veneyya vinaya nattham te asati vineyya jane kena nāma kāraṇena
translated: is only for the purpose of training disciples. When there are no more disciples to be trained, for what purpose should they remain?

original: Yadi ca mārassa yācanāya parinibbāyeyya, puretaraṃyeva parinibbāyeyya. Bodhimaṇḍepi
analyzed: yadi ca mārassa yācanāya parinibbāyeyya puretaraṃ yeva parinibbāyeyya bodhimaṇḍe pi
translated: And if he were to attain final Nibbana because of Mara’s request, he would have attained final Nibbana long ago. For even at the Bodhi Tree

analyzed: hi mārena yācitam nimitta ubhāsa karaṇam pi therassa soka tanu karaṇa atthanti
translated: Mara made a request of him, and the Elder’s manifestation of a sign was in order to show his sorrow.

original: Apica buddhabaladīpanatthaṃ nimittobhāsakaraṇaṃ. Evaṃ mahānubhāvā buddhā bhagavantoyeva
analyzed: apica buddha bala dīpana ttham nimitta ubhāsa karaṇam evam mahā anubhāvāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ yā iva
translated: Moreover, the manifestation of the sign was in order to show the power of a Buddha. For thus it is said: “The Blessed Ones, the Buddhas, are so powerful that

original: tiṭṭhantāpi attano ruciyāva tiṭṭhanti, parinibbāyantāpi attano ruciyāva parinibbāyantīti.
analyzed: tiṭṭhantā api attanaḥ ruciyā ava tiṭṭhanti parinibbāyantā api attanaḥ ruciyā ava parinibbāyanti iti
translated: they remain as long as they will, and they attain final Nibbana as long as they will.”

original: Mahābhūmicāloti mahanto pathavīkampo. Tadā kira dasasahassilokadhātu akampittha.🔽Bhiṃsanakoti bhayajanako. Devadundubhiyo ca phaliṃsūti devabheriyo nadiṃsu, devo
analyzed: mahā bhūmi cālo ti mahantaḥ pathavī kampo tadā kira dasa sahassi lokadhātu akampittha  bhiṃsanakaḥ uti bhaya janakaḥ deva dundubhiyo ca deva bheriyaḥ nadiṃsu devaḥ
translated: A great earthquake: a great trembling of the earth. At that time, it is said, the ten-thousandfold world system shook.

original: sukkhagajjitaṃ gajji, akālavijjulatā nicchariṃsu, khaṇikavassaṃ vassīti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: sukkha gajjitam gajji akāla vijjula tā nicchariṃsu khaṇika vassam vassi iti vuttam hoti
translated: Frightful: causing fear. And the deva-drums: the drums of the gods sounded. The deva-drums resounded with a sound that was neither loud nor soft.

original: Etamatthaṃ viditvāti etaṃ saṅkhāravisaṅkhārānaṃ visesasaṅkhātaṃ atthaṃ sabbākārato
analyzed: etam attham viditvā iti etam saṅkhāra visaṅkhārānam visesa saṅkhātam attham sabba ākārataḥ
translated: Having known the meaning of this: having known in all aspects the meaning of this distinction between formations and non-formations.

original: viditvā. Imaṃ udānanti anavasesasaṅkhāre vissajjetvā attano visaṅkhāragamanadīpakaṃ🔽udānaṃ udānesi. Kasmā udānesi? Koci nāma vadeyya “mārena pacchato pacchato anubandhitvā
analyzed: viditvā imam udānanti anavasesa saṅkhāre vissajjetvā attanaḥ visaṅkhāra gamana dīpakam  udānam udānesi kasmai udānesi koci nāma vadeyya mārena pacchatas pacchatas anubandhitvā
translated: Having known. This was the utterance: after relinquishing all formations without exception, he uttered this utterance, which shows his own going beyond formations.

original: ‘parinibbātu, bhante’ti upadduto bhayena bhagavā āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossajī”ti. “Tassokāso
analyzed: parinibbātu bhante iti upaddutaḥ bhayena bhagavā āyu saṅkhāram ossaji iti tassa ukāsaḥ
translated: Why did he utter it? Someone might say: “The Blessed One relinquished the life-formation out of fear, being pressed by Mara who was following close behind, saying, ‘May the Blessed One attain final Nibbana, Lord.’ ” To preclude such a notion,

original: mā hotu, bhītassa udānaṃ nāma natthī”ti etassa dīpanatthaṃ pītivegavissaṭṭhaṃ udānaṃ
analyzed: mā hotu bhītassa udānam nāma natthi iti etassa dīpana attham pīti vega vissaṭṭham udānam
translated: for there is no utterance of one who is afraid.

original: udānesīti aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ. Tato temāsamatteneva ca pana buddhakiccassa nipphajjanato
analyzed: udānesi iti aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam tatas ca pana buddha kiccassa nipphajjanato
translated: This is why it is said in the commentaries that he uttered this utterance, which is an outburst of his rapture.🔽And because the fulfilment of the Buddha’s task was now only three months away,

original: evaṃ dīgharattaṃ mayā parihaṭoyaṃ dukkhabhāro na cirasseva nikkhipiyatīti passato
analyzed: evam dīgharattam mayā parihaṭaḥ ayam dukkha bhāraḥ na cirassa iva passato
translated: he saw that the burden of suffering, which he had borne for so long, would soon be laid down.

original: parinibbānaguṇapaccavekkhaṇe tassa uḷāraṃ pītisomanassaṃ uppajji, tena pītivegena
analyzed: parinibbāna guṇa paccavekkhaṇe tassa uḷāram pīti somanassam uppajji tena pīti vegena
translated: And as he reflected on the special qualities of final Nibbana, he experienced an exalted rapture and joy.

original: udānesīti yuttaṃ viya. Ekantena hi visaṅkhāraninno nibbānajjhāsayo satthā mahākaruṇāya
analyzed: udānesi iti yuttam viya ekantena hi visaṅkhāra ninnaḥ nibbāna ajjhāsayaḥ satthā mahākaruṇāya

original: balakkārena viya sattahitatthaṃ loke suciraṃ ṭhito. Tathā hi devasikaṃ catuvīsatikoṭisatasahassasaṅkhā
analyzed: balakkārena viya satta hita attham loke su ciram tathā hi devasikam catuvīsati koṭi sata sahassa saṅkhā
translated: For thus he swallowed up the attainments numbering 240,000 koṭis every day,

analyzed: samāpattiyaḥ vaḷañjeti sodāni mahā karuṇā adhikārassa nipphanna ttā nibbāna abhimukhaḥ anappakam
translated: and then, because the function of great compassion had been fulfilled, he experienced an immeasurable

analyzed: pīti somanassam paṭisaṃvedesi tena iva hi bhagavataḥ kilesa parinibbāna divase viya khandha parinibbāna divase pi
translated: measure of joy and gladness, as if facing Nibbāna. And so it was that on the day of the Blessed One’s final Nibbāna,

analyzed: sarīra ābhā visesataḥ vippasannā parisuddhā pabhassarā ahosi iti
translated: the radiance of his body was especially clear, pure and bright, as if on the day of his final Nibbāna of the defilements.

original: Gāthāya soṇasiṅgālādīnampi paccakkhabhāvato tulitaṃ paricchinnanti tulaṃ, kāmāvacarakammaṃ.
analyzed: gāthāya soṇa siṅgāla ādīnam pi paccakkha bhāvato tulitam paricchinnanti tulam kāmāvacara kammaṃ
translated: In the verse, “weighed” is a balance, since it is evident to jackals, hyenas, etc., and is measured. It is sense-sphere kamma.

analyzed: na tulam atulam tulam vā sadisam assa aññam lokiya kammam natthi iti atulam mahaggata kammaṃ
translated: “Not weighed” is incomparable. There is no other worldly kamma comparable to it, thus it is incomparable. It is fine-material-sphere kamma.

original: Kāmāvacaraṃ rūpāvacaraṃ vā tulaṃ, arūpāvacaraṃ atulaṃ. Appavipākaṃ vā tulaṃ, bahuvipākaṃ
analyzed: kāmāvacaram rūpāvacaram vā tulam arūpāvacaram atulam ap pavipākam vā tulam bahu vipākam
translated: Sense-sphere or fine-material-sphere kamma is weighed. Immaterial-sphere kamma is not weighed. Kamma with little result is weighed. Kamma with much result is not weighed.

original: atulaṃ. Sambhavanti sambhavassa hetubhūtaṃ, upapattijanakanti attho. Bhavasaṅkhāranti
analyzed: atulam sambhavanti sambhavassa hetu bhūtam upapatti janakanti atthaḥ bhava saṅkhāranti

analyzed: kavacam viya atta sambhavanti attani sañjātam kilesam idam vuttam hoti sa vipāka ṭṭhena
translated: kavacaṃ viya abhindi. Attasambhavanti attani sañjātaṃ kilesaṃ. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti “savipākaṭṭhena
