translated: He attained Nibbāna. As soon as he resolved, his whole body burst into flames. In a moment

analyzed: viya aṇumattam pi saṅkhāra gatam masimattam pi tattha kiñci  adhiṭṭhāna balena jhāpetvā nibbāyi tena vuttam atha kho āyasmā dabbaḥ malla putto tiādi
translated: the fire, like the fire at the end of the aeon, consumed his body without leaving so much as an ash or a cinder,🔽and then it went out. Hence it was said above: ‘Then the venerable Dabba the Mallian …’

original: Tattha vuṭṭhahitvā parinibbāyīti iddhicittato vuṭṭhahitvā bhavaṅgacittena parinibbāyi.
analyzed: tattha vuṭṭhahitvā parinibbāyi iti iddhi cittataḥ vuṭṭhahitvā bhavaṅga cittena parinibbāyi
translated: Herein, he attained Nibbāna and emerged means that he attained Nibbāna with the life-continuum consciousness after emerging from the consciousness of the supernormal power.

original: Jhāyamānassāti jāliyamānassa. Ḍayhamānassāti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Atha vā jhāyamānassāti
analyzed: jhāyamānassa ati jāliyamānassa ḍayhamānassa ati tassa iva vevacanam atha vā jhāyamānassa ati
translated: “Burning” is the same as “flaming.”

original: jālāpavattikkhaṇaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, ḍayhamānassāti vītaccitaṅgārakkhaṇaṃ. Chārikāti
analyzed: jāla apavatti khaṇam sandhāya vuttam ḍayhamānassa ati chārikā iti
translated: Or alternatively, “burning” is said in reference to the moment of the flame’s occurrence, “flaming” in reference to the moment of the embers’ occurrence. “Embers” is

original: bhasmaṃ. Masīti kajjalaṃ. Na paññāyitthāti na passittha, adhiṭṭhānabalena sabbaṃ🔽khaṇeneva antaradhāyitthāti attho. Kasmā pana thero uttarimanussadhammaṃ iddhipāṭihāriyaṃ
analyzed: bhasmam masi iti kajjalam na paññāyittha ati na passittha adhiṭṭhāna balena sabbam  khaṇena iva antaradhāyittha iti attho kasmā pana thero uttari manussa dhammam iddhi pāṭihāriyam
translated: ashes. “Charcoal” is soot. “You did not see” means you did not see it. The meaning is: by the power of resolve, you did not see it all disappear in a moment.

original: dassesi, nanu bhagavatā iddhipāṭihāriyakaraṇaṃ paṭikkhittanti? Na codetabbametaṃ🔽gihīnaṃ sammukhā pāṭihāriyakaraṇassa paṭikkhittattā. Tañca kho vikubbanavasena, na
analyzed: dassesi nanu bhagavatā iddhi pāṭihāriya karaṇam paṭikkhittanti na codetabbam etam  gihīnam sammukhā pāṭihāriya karaṇassa paṭikkhitta ttā tat ca kho vikubbana vasena na
translated: But why did the Elder show a superhuman wonder? Hasn’t the Buddha prohibited the performance of wonders?🔽This should not be criticized,

original: panevaṃ adhiṭṭhānavasena. Ayaṃ panāyasmā dhammasāminā āṇattova pāṭihāriyaṃ dassesi.
analyzed: pana evam adhiṭṭhāna vasena ayam pana ayasmā dhammasāminā āṇattaḥ iva pāṭihāriyam dassesi
translated: for the performance of wonders in the presence of householders has been prohibited, but that is in the sense of a display of psychic power, not in the sense of a resolve.🔽This venerable one, however, performed the wonder on the Buddha’s command.

original: Etamatthaṃ viditvāti etaṃ āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa anupādāparinibbānaṃ sabbākārato viditvā tadatthaparidīpanaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi.🔽Tattha abhedi kāyoti sabbo bhūtupādāyapabhedo catusantatirūpakāyo bhijji, anavasesato
analyzed: etam attham viditvā ti etam āyasmataḥ dabbassa malla puttassa anupādā parinibbānam sabba ākārataḥ viditvā tad attha paridīpanam imam udānam udānesi  tattha abhedi kāyaḥ ti sabbaḥ catu santati rūpa kāyaḥ anavasesato
translated: Having known the meaning of this: having known in all aspects the venerable Dabba Mallaputta’s attainment of final Nibbāna without clinging, he uttered this exalted utterance of joy.

original: ḍayhi, antaradhāyi, anuppattidhammataṃ āpajji. Nirodhi saññāti rūpāyatanādigocaratāya🔽rūpasaññādibhedā sabbāpi saññā appaṭisandhikena nirodhena nirujjhi. Vedanā sītibhaviṃsu
analyzed: ḍayhi antaradhāyi an uppatti dhamma tam āpajji nirodhi saññāti rūpa āyatana ādi gocara tāya  rūpa saññā ādi bhedā sabbā api saññā appaṭisandhikena nirodhena vedanā
translated: Herein, the body broke up: the entire fourfold body consisting of the four primary elements and derived from the primary elements broke up, was destroyed, disappeared, and came to cessation without remainder.🔽Ceased was perception: all perception, classed as perception of the visible-form base, etc., ceased by the cessation without clinging of one who has no more attachment.

original: sabbāti vipākavedanā kiriyavedanāti sabbāpi vedanā appaṭisandhikanirodhena niruddhattā
analyzed: sabbā ati vipāka vedanā kiriya vedanā ti sabbā api vedanā appaṭisandhika nirodhena
translated: Feelings were stilled: all feelings, classed as resultant feelings and functional feelings, ceased by the cessation without clinging,

original: aṇumattampi vedanādarathassa abhāvato sītibhūtā ahesuṃ, kusalākusalavedanā pana arahattaphalakkhaṇeyeva
analyzed: aṇumattam pi vedanā darathassa abhāvato sīti bhūtāḥ ahesum kusala akusala vedanā pana
translated: and because there was no more occurrence of even the slightest feeling, they were stilled. But wholesome and unwholesome feelings reached cessation at the moment of the attainment of Arahantship.

original: nirodhaṃ gatā. “Sītirahiṃsū”tipi paṭhanti, santā niruddhā ahesunti attho. Vūpasamiṃsu
analyzed: nirodham gatā paṭhanti santāḥ niruddhāḥ ahesun ti atthaḥ
translated: Some read “sīti rahiṃsu” . The meaning is: they were cool, they ceased.

original: saṅkhārāti vipākakiriyappabhedā sabbepi phassādayo saṅkhārakkhandhadhammā appaṭisandhikanirodheneva🔽niruddhattā visesena upasamiṃsu. Viññāṇaṃ atthamāgamāti viññāṇampi vipākakiriyappabhedaṃ
analyzed: saṅkhārā ti vipāka kiriya ppabhedā sabbe pi phassa ādayo saṅkhāra khandha dhammā appaṭisandhika nirodhena iva  niruddha ttā visesena viññāṇam attham āgamā ti viññāṇam pi vipāka kiriya ppabhedam
translated: “Conditions”: all the states of the aggregate of mental formations, classed as resultant and functional, with the exception of the last thought-conception and thought-concomitants of an Arahant,🔽have “ceased without remainder” by the cessation without remainder of the last thought-conception and thought-concomitants of an Arahant.🔽“Consciousness has come to its end”: all consciousness, classed as resultant and functional,

original: sabbaṃ appaṭisandhikanirodheneva atthaṃ vināsaṃ upacchedaṃ agamā agacchi.
analyzed: sabbam appaṭisandhika nirodhena iva attham vināsam upacchedam agamā agacchi
translated: has “come to its end, has vanished, has cooled down,” by the cessation without remainder of the last thought-conception and thought-concomitants of an Arahant.

original: Iti bhagavā āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa pañcannampi khandhānaṃ pubbeyeva kilesābhisaṅkhārupādānassa🔽anavasesato niruddhattā anupādāno viya jātavedo appaṭisandhikanirodhena niruddhabhāvaṃ
analyzed: iti bhagavā āyasmataḥ dabbassa malla puttassa pañcannam pi khandhānam pubbe yeva kilesa abhisaṅkhāra upādānassa  anavasesataḥ niruddha ttā anupādānaḥ viya jātavedo appaṭisandhika nirodhena niruddha bhāvam
translated: Thus the Blessed One, by way of the cessation without remainder of the five aggregates of clinging of the venerable Dabba the Mallian,

original: nissāya pītivegavissaṭṭhaṃ udānaṃ udānesīti.
analyzed: nissāya pīti vega vissaṭṭham udānam udānesi iti
translated: as if by the non-clinging of a fire without fuel, uttered this exclamation of joy, which arose from the impact of his rapture.

original: Navamasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: navama sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the ninth sutta is finished.

original: 10. Dutiyadabbasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya dabba sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The commentary on the second sutta on Dabba

original: 80. Dasame tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesīti bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā
analyzed: dasame tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi iti bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantam viharitvā
translated: . In the tenth sutta, “there the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus” after the Blessed One had stayed at Rājagaha for as long as he liked,

original: janapadacārikaṃ caranto anukkamena sāvatthiṃ patvā jetavane viharantoyeva yesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: janapada cārikam carantaḥ anukkamena sāvatthim patvā jetavane viharantaḥ yeva yesam bhikkhūnam
translated: and in due course he arrived at Sāvatthī. Staying there in Jeta’s Wood,🔽he had the parinibbāna of the venerable Dabba the Mallian witnessed by those bhikkhus who had not seen it,

original: āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa parinibbānaṃ apaccakkhaṃ, tesaṃ taṃ paccakkhaṃ katvā
analyzed: āyasmataḥ dabbassa malla puttassa parinibbānam apaccakkham tesam tam paccakkham katvā
translated: and he had the venerable Dabba’s bowl and robes brought from the charnel ground. Then, in order to show them, he addressed the bhikkhus, saying: ‘Bhikkhus, the bhikkhu Dabba the Mallian has attained final Nibbāna. Here are his bowl and robes.’

original: dassetuṃ, yepi ca mettiyabhūmajakehi katena abhūtena abbhācikkhaṇena there gāravarahitā
analyzed: dassetum ye pi ca mettiya bhūmajakehi katena a bhūtena abbha ācikkhaṇena there gārava rahitā
translated: And in order to remove the lack of respect of those ordinary people who had no respect for the elders because of the false accusation made by the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka,🔽and in order to generate respect for the elders, he addressed the bhikkhus, saying: ‘Bhikkhus, the bhikkhu Dabba the Mallian has attained final Nibbāna. Here are his bowl and robes.’

original: puthujjanā, tesaṃ there bahumānuppādanatthañca āmantesi. Tattha tatrāti vacanasaññāpane
analyzed: puthujjanā tesam there bahu māna uppādana attham ca āmantesi tattha tatra ati vacana saññāpane
translated: Herein, there is only a mere indeclinable left in the word there .🔽The word kho is a particle of emphasis.

original: nipātamattaṃ. Khoti avadhāraṇe. Tesu “tatrā”ti iminā “bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesī”ti
analyzed: nipāta mattam kho ti avadhāraṇe tesu tatra ati iminā bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi iti
translated: Of these, by the word there he illuminates the fact that the words the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus are being spoken of.

original: etesaṃ padānaṃ vuccamānataṃyeva joteti. “Kho”ti pana iminā āmantesiyeva, nāssa āmantane
analyzed: etesam padānam vuccamāna taṃyā iva jota iti kho ti pana iminā āmantesiyā iva na assa āmantane
translated: But by the word kho he shows the meaning that he addressed them and that there was no obstacle to his addressing them.

original: koci antarāyo ahosīti imamatthaṃ dasseti. Atha vā tatrāti tasmiṃ ārāme. Khoti vacanālaṅkāre
analyzed: koci antarāyaḥ ahosi iti imam attham dasseti atha vā tatra ati tasmin ārāme vacana alaṅkāre
translated: Or alternatively, there is in that monastery. Kho is an ornament of speech.

original: nipāto. Āmantesīti abhāsi. Kasmā pana bhagavā bhikkhūyeva āmantesīti? Jeṭṭhattā seṭṭhattā
analyzed: nipātaḥ āmantesi iti abhāsi kasmā pana bhagavā bhikkhūya iva āmantesi iti jeṭṭha ttā seṭṭha ttā
translated: is a particle. Addressed: spoke. But why did the Blessed One address only the bhikkhus? Because of seniority, because of excellence,

original: āsannattā sabbakālaṃ sannihitattā dhammadesanāya visesato bhājanabhūtattā ca.
analyzed: āsanna ttā sabbakālam sannihita ttā dhamma desanāya visesataḥ bhājana bhūta ttā ca
translated: because of proximity, because of being available at all times, and because of being a vessel for the teaching in particular.

original: Bhikkhavoti tesaṃ āmantanākāradassanaṃ. Bhadanteti āmantitānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gāravena
analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti tesam āmantanā ākāra dassanam bhadanta iti āmantitānam bhikkhūnam gāravena
translated: Bhikkhus: this shows the way in which he addressed them. Venerable sir: this is the reply given by the bhikkhus who were addressed out of respect for the Teacher.

original: satthu paṭivacanadānaṃ. Tattha “bhikkhavo”ti vadanto bhagavā te bhikkhū ālapati.
analyzed: satthu paṭivacana dānam tattha bhikkhavaḥ ti vadantaḥ bhagavā te bhikkhū ālapati
translated: Herein, by saying “bhikkhus” the Blessed One addresses those bhikkhus.

original: “Bhadante”ti vadantā te paccālapanti. Apica “bhikkhavo”ti iminā karuṇāvipphārasommahadayanissitapubbaṅgamena
analyzed: bhadanta iti vadantā te paccālapanti apica bhikkhavaḥ ti iminā karuṇā vipphāra sommahadaya nissita pubbaṅgamena
translated: By saying “Venerable sir” they reply to him. Furthermore, by the words “bhikkhus,” which are uttered with a mind tender with the outpours of compassion,

original: vacanena te bhikkhū kammaṭṭhānamanasikāradhammapaccavekkhaṇādito nivattetvā attano
analyzed: vacanena te bhikkhū kammaṭṭhāna manasikāra dhamma paccavekkhaṇa āditaḥ nivattetvā attanaḥ
translated: the Blessed One turns those bhikkhus away from the meditation subject they are already giving attention to, such as the recollection of the Buddha, etc.,

original: mukhābhimukhe karoti. “Bhadante”ti iminā satthari ādarabahumānagāravadīpanavacanena
analyzed: mukha abhimukhe karoti bhadanta iti iminā satthari ādara bahu māna gārava dīpana vacanena
translated: and faces them towards himself. By the words “Venerable sir,” which indicate respect, reverence, and deference towards the Teacher,

original: te bhikkhū attano sussūsataṃ ovādappaṭiggahagāravabhāvañca paṭivedenti. Bhagavato
analyzed: te bhikkhū attanaḥ sussūsa tam ovāda paṭiggaha gārava bhāvañca paṭivedenti bhagavato
translated: those bhikkhus make known their own willingness to listen and their deference in accepting advice. The Blessed One

original: paccassosunti te bhikkhū bhagavato vacanaṃ patiassosuṃ sotukāmataṃ janesuṃ. Etadavocāti
analyzed: paccassosunti te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ vacanam patiassosum sotu kāma tam janesum etat avoca ati
translated: Pacassosuṃ means they listened to the Blessed One’s word and they desired to hear . Etad-avocāti

original: bhagavā etaṃ idāni vakkhamānaṃ sakalaṃ suttaṃ abhāsi. Dabbassa, bhikkhave, mallaputtassātiādi
analyzed: bhagavā etam idāni vakkhamānam sakalam suttam abhāsi dabbassa bhikkhave malla puttassa atiādi
translated: the Blessed One spoke this entire sutta which is now being spoken. Dabbassa, bhikkhave, mallaputtassātiādi

original: anantarasutte vuttatthameva. Etamatthantiādīsupi apubbaṃ natthi, anantarasutte vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: anantara sutte vutta ttham eva etam attha nti ādīsu pi apubbam natthi anantara sutte vutta nayena iva veditabbam
translated: has the same meaning as in the immediately preceding sutta. Etamatthantiādīsupi apubbaṃ natthi, anantarasutte vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.

original: Gāthāsu pana ayoghanahatassāti ayo haññati etenāti ayoghanaṃ, kammārānaṃ ayokūṭaṃ
analyzed: gāthāsu pana ayaḥ ghana hatassa ati ayaḥ haññati etena ati ayaḥ ghanam kammārānam ayaḥ kūṭam
translated: In the verses, however, ayoghanahatassāti ayo haññati etenāti ayoghanaṃ, kammārānaṃ ayokūṭaṃ

original: ayomuṭṭhi ca. Tena ayoghanena hatassa pahatassa. Keci pana “ayoghanahatassāti ghanaayopiṇḍaṃ
analyzed: ayaḥ muṭṭhi ca tena ayaḥ ghanena hatassa pahatassa keci pana ayaḥ ghana hatassa ati ghana ayaḥ piṇḍam
translated: and ayomuṭṭhi . Tena ayoghanena hatassa pahatassa. Keci pana “ayoghanahatassāti ghanaayopiṇḍaṃ

original: hatassā”ti atthaṃ vadanti. Eva-saddo cettha nipātamattaṃ. Jalato jātavedasoti jhāyamānassa
analyzed: hatassa ati attham vadanti eva saddaḥ ca ittha nipāta mattam jalataḥ jātavedasaḥ iti jhāyamānassa
translated: hatassā”ti atthaṃ vadanti. Eva-saddo cettha nipātamattaṃ. Jalato jātavedasoti jhāyamānassa

original: aggissa. Anādare etaṃ sāmivacanaṃ. Anupubbūpasantassāti anukkamena upasantassa vijjhātassa
analyzed: aggissa anādare etam sāmi vacanam anupubbūpasantassa ati anukkamena upasantassa vijjhātassa
translated: aggissa. Anādare etaṃ sāmivacanaṃ. Anupubbūpasantassāti anukkamena upasantassa vijjhātassa

original: niruddhassa. Yathā na ñāyate gatīti yathā tassa gati na ñāyati. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti🔽– ayomuṭṭhikūṭādinā mahatā ayoghanena hatassa saṃhatassa, kaṃsabhājanādigatassa vā
analyzed: niruddhassa yathā na ñāyate gati iti yathā tassa gati na ñāyati idam vuttam hoti  ayaḥ muṭṭhikūṭa ādinā mahatā ayaḥ ghanena hatassa saṃhatassa kaṃsa bhājana ādi gatassa vā
translated: As to the ceased: as to the ceased without any known destination. This is what is said:

original: jalamānassa aggissa, tathā uppannassa vā saddassa anukkamena upasantassa suvūpasantassa
analyzed: jalamānassa aggissa tathā uppannassa vā saddassa anukkamena upasantassa suvūpasantassa
translated: As to the fire that has been put out by a great mass of iron, etc., that has been heated and is compact, or as to the sound that has arisen and then gradually subsided and quite ceased,

original: dasasu disāsu na katthaci gati paññāyati paccayanirodhena appaṭisandhikaniruddhattā.
analyzed: dasasu disāsu na katthaci gati paññāyati paccaya nirodhena appaṭisandhika niruddha ttā
translated: no destination of it is discerned anywhere in the ten directions.

original: Evaṃ sammāvimuttānanti evaṃ sammā hetunā ñāyena tadaṅgavikkhambhanavimuttipubbaṅgamena
analyzed: evam sammā vimuttānam ti evam sammā hetunā ñāyena tad aṅga vikkhambhana vimutti pubbaṅgamena
translated: Thus perfectly released: thus released by the noble path, which is the right means, and which is headed by the deliverance consisting in the temporary suppression of the defilements by the supramundane jhāna;

original: ariyamaggena catūhipi upādānehi āsavehi ca vimuttattā sammā vimuttānaṃ, tato eva🔽kāmapabandhasaṅkhātaṃ kāmoghaṃ bhavoghādibhedaṃ avasiṭṭhaṃ oghañca taritvā ṭhitattā
analyzed: ariya maggena catūhi pi upādānehi āsavehi ca vimutta ttā sammā vimuttānam tatas eva  kāma pabandha saṅkhātam kāma ogham bhava ogha ādi bhedam avasiṭṭham ogham ca taritvā
translated: they are perfectly released because they are released from the four kinds of clinging and from the taints.🔽Having crossed the flood: having crossed the flood of sense desire, which is called the “bond of sense desire,” and having crossed the remaining floods, which are the floods of becoming, etc.,

original: kāmabandhoghatārinaṃ suṭṭhu paṭipassambhitasabbakilesavipphanditattā kilesābhisaṅkhāravātehi
analyzed: kāma bandha ughatārinam suṭṭhu kilesa abhisaṅkhāra vātehi
translated: they stand, having completely stilled the perturbation of all defilements. They stand having completely stilled the perturbation of all defilements by the winds of the in-breaths and out-breaths, which are the winds of the formations consisting in defilements.

original: ca akampanīyatāya acalaṃ anupādisesanibbānasaṅkhātaṃ sabbasaṅkhārūpasamaṃ sukhaṃ
analyzed: ca a kampanīya tāya acalam an upādisesa nibbāna saṅkhātam sabba saṅkhā rūpa samam sukham
translated: and because it is unshakable, it is “unwavering.” It is the bliss called “the deathless,” the stilling of all formations.

original: pattānaṃ adhigatānaṃ khīṇāsavānaṃ gati devamanussādibhedāsu gatīsu ayaṃ nāmāti paññapetabbatāya
analyzed: pattānam adhigatānam khīṇāsavānam gati deva manussa ādi bhedāsu gatīsu ayam nāma ati paññapetabba tāya
translated: It is the destiny of those who have attained it, who have reached it, who have destroyed the taints, because it cannot be specified thus: “It is this in the various destinies such as the heavenly world, the human world, etc.”

original: abhāvattā paññāpetuṃ natthi na upalabbhati, yathāvuttajātavedo viya apaññattikabhāvameva hi so gatoti attho.
analyzed: abhāvattā paññāpetum natthi na upalabbhati yathā vutta jātavedaḥ viya apaññattika bhāvam eva hi so gataḥ ti attho
translated: It does not exist, is not found, because it cannot be specified, like the previously described fire. The meaning is that it has gone to the state of being unspecifiable.

original: Dasamasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Niṭṭhitā ca pāṭaligāmiyavaggavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: dasama sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  niṭṭhitā ca pāṭaligāmiya vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The tenth sutta is finished.🔽And the commentary on the Pāṭaligāmiyavagga is finished.

original: Nigamanakathā
analyzed: nigamana kathā
translated: The section on the conclusion

original: Ettāvatā ca –
analyzed: ettāvatā ca
translated: And so far🔽The one who has well liberated from existence,

original: Suvimuttabhavādāno, devadānavamānito;
analyzed: deva dānava mānitaḥ
translated: Honoured by gods and men,🔽The one who has cut off the stream of craving,

original: Pacchinnataṇhāsantāno, pītisaṃvegadīpano.🔽Saddhammadānanirato, upādānakkhayāvaho;
analyzed: pacchinna taṇhā santānaḥ pīti saṃvega dīpanaḥ  saddhamma dāna nirataḥ upādāna khaya āvahaḥ
translated: The one who shines with rapture and with awe,🔽The one who is intent on giving the true Dhamma,🔽The one who brings about the destruction of clinging,

original: Tattha tattha udāne ye, udānesi vināyako.
analyzed: tattha tattha udāne ye udānesi vināyako
translated: The one who has uttered the Uddānas🔽In various places, the Leader,

original: Te sabbe ekato katvā, āropentehi saṅgahaṃ;
analyzed: te sabbe ekatas katvā āropentehi saṅgaham
translated: All of them, having collected them together,🔽Have been included in the Uddāna

original: Udānamiti saṅgītaṃ, dhammasaṅgāhakehi yaṃ.
analyzed: udānam iti saṅgītam dhamma saṅgāhakehi yam
translated: By those who compiled it, saying “Uddāna.”

original: Tassa atthaṃ pakāsetuṃ, porāṇaṭṭhakathānayaṃ;
analyzed: tassa attham pakāsetum porāṇa aṭṭhakathā nayam
translated: In order to explain the meaning of that,

original: Nissāya yā samāraddhā, atthasaṃvaṇṇanā mayā.
analyzed: nissāya yā samāraddhā attha saṃvaṇṇanā mayā
translated: The commentary on the meaning that I have composed,

original: Sā tattha paramatthānaṃ, suttantesu yathārahaṃ;
analyzed: sā tattha parama atthānam suttantesu yathāraham
translated: In the Suttas, in the sense of the ultimate, as is fitting,

original: Pakāsanā paramatthadīpanī nāma nāmato.
analyzed: pakāsanā paramatthadīpanī nāma nāmato
translated: Is called the “Illuminator of the Ultimate.”

original: Sampattā pariniṭṭhānaṃ, anākulavinicchayā;
analyzed: sampattā pariniṭṭhānam an ākula vinicchayā
translated: It has reached completion, with a commentary that is free from confusion,

original: Catuttiṃsappamāṇāya, pāḷiyā bhāṇavārato.
analyzed: catuttiṃsa pamāṇāya pāḷiyā bhāṇa vārataḥ
translated: In accordance with the text, which is forty-four chapters in length.

original: Iti taṃ saṅkharontena, yaṃ taṃ adhigataṃ mayā;
analyzed: iti tam yam tam adhigatam mayā
translated: Thus, by one who has composed it, whatever merit has been obtained by me,

original: Puññaṃ tassānubhāvena, lokanāthassa sāsanaṃ.
analyzed: puññam tassa anubhāvena lokanāthassa sāsanam
translated: By the power of that, may the Dispensation of the Lord of the World

original: Ogāhitvā visuddhāya, sīlādipaṭipattiyā;
analyzed: ogāhitvā visuddhāya sīla ādi paṭipattiyā
translated: Having entered into the pure practice of virtue and so on,

original: Sabbepi dehino hontu, vimuttirasabhāgino.
analyzed: sabbe pi dehinaḥ hontu vimutti rasa bhāginaḥ
translated: May all beings share in the essence of liberation.

original: Ciraṃ tiṭṭhatu lokasmiṃ, sammāsambuddhasāsanaṃ;
analyzed: ciram tiṭṭhatu lokasmim sammāsambuddha sāsanam
translated: May the Dispensation of the Fully Enlightened One remain long in the world,

original: Tasmiṃ sagāravā niccaṃ, hontu sabbepi pāṇino.
analyzed: tasmim sa gāravāḥ niccam hontu sabbe pi pāṇinaḥ
translated: And may all beings always have respect for it.

original: Sammā vassatu kālena, devopi jagatīpati;
analyzed: sammā vassatu kālena devaḥ api jagatīpati
translated: May the god who is the Lord of the World rain down in season,

original: Saddhammanirato lokaṃ, dhammeneva pasāsatūti.
analyzed: saddhamma nirataḥ lokam dhammena iva pasāsatu iti
translated: And may the world, devoted to the True Dhamma, be happy through the Dhamma alone.

original: Badaratitthavihāravāsinā ācariyadhammapālattherena
analyzed: badaratittha vihāra vāsinā ācariya dhammapāla ttherena
translated: By the Elder Ācariya Dhammapāla, who resides at the monastery of Badaratittha,

original: Katāudānassa aṭṭhakathā samattā.
analyzed: kata audānassa aṭṭhakathā samattā
translated: The commentary on the Udāna is completed.
